loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Madel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily need products, such as bread for snacks, candies, shampoo, sugar and sachet coffee, in the local community. Madel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Madel joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Madel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy L. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Mean Mech, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is far from the irrigation system and has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Vy L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the rice field. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family living with this loan.

Mrs. Vy L. is 43 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are farmers while the other one is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her husband's rice field

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Meng Korng, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to grow rice.  As well as this job, he is a construction laborer.

Mr. Meng Korng faces some problems on the rice plantation because his field is far from the irrigation system and it is now infertile, so Mrs. Sokha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to support the rice field. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's lives with this loan.

Mrs. Sokha S. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school while the other is too young to go  school or work. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Tamana Abdull Zaher Group

texts.en:
The Tamana A. Zaher group has four members: Roogull, Tamana, Farid Ahmad and Hayat Bibi. They all live in Kabul, Afghanistan. Roogull is the group leader of Tamana A. Zaher group. She is married and she lives in a family that has five members. She wants to take a loan for her son. He is a mechanic and he has been involved in this business for more then four years. He wants to buy some tools for his shop with this loan.  

The second member of the Tamana A. Zaher group is Tamana, who is busy with bead working.  She wants to buy a new machine for her business with this loan.

The third member of this group is Farid Ahmad, who has a general store and wants to complete his stock with this loan.

The last member, Hayat Bibi, wants to take a loan for her husband. He has a fresh fruit cart and with this loan he wants to buy more fruit for his cart.   

They all have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete their requirements. 

They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more materials for their businesses

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 66 years old and married, and she has two children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. 

Patience sells baby things, such as clothes, flasks, bathing bowls, etc. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She sells her goods in the market. 

Patience is hoping for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She has been in this business for a long time.She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy No. 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy est une association de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thiès, une ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar. Ce groupe qui porte le nom d’un grand marabout Tidiane a été fondé en 2006 par des femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cependant après quelques années de beaux compagnonnages, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi sous l’encadrement de l’agent de crédit de la mutuelle que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, au nombre de 14 en ce moment, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années.
Le groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy  organise des réunions chaque le 20 du mois où tous les sous groupes sont conviés pour verser leur remboursement auprès de la présidente et cette dernière sous l’assistance de la trésorière assure le versement à la mutuelle.
La présidente est Madame Coumba Faye et la trésorière Madame Oumou N. toutes deux habitantes de Thiès. 

Cependant le sous groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy N°5 est à son deuxième prêt dans la mutuelle et il est dirigé par la trésorière Madame Oumou N. âgée de 48 ans. Cette dernière mariée et mère de 5 enfants s’active dans le commerce par passion depuis 15 ans. Elle place du piment, du karité, du Nétetou....etc à ses clientes vendeuses dans le marché grand Thiès. Avec ce crédit, elle compte compléter son approvisionnement auprès de ses fournisseurs à Bamako au Mali. Ses revenus lui permettent de gérer les charges quotidiennes au niveau de sa famille et de régler les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 
Elle est dans ce sous groupe avec Madame Ndeye Ndella T. (la trésorière)  vendeuse de poissons, Madame Ndou Gou N. vendeuse de parfums, Madame  Ndioba G. vendeuse de boubous et tissus et Madame Anta M.   vendeuse de bijoux et thiouraye.
Dans le cadre de leurs activités, elles sollicitent un prêt de 500000 F CFA où chacune pourra recevoir 100 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group is an association of businesswomen who own small stores in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar. This group, named after a great Tijani marabout, was set up in 2006 by entrepreneurial women who where eager to increase their purchasing power through a tontine (a rotating savings and credit system where a group of individuals regularly contribute an agreed amount; the total amount is paid alternately to an individual member). However, after several years of successfully operating their tontine, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution UIMCEC which could grant them loans without security. Under the supervision of a loan officer of the village bank, the group was divided into subgroups of five members, each subgroup with a chairwoman and a treasurer. Right now there are 14 such subgroups. They may have the same members for many years. The Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group meets every 20th of the month. The members of each subgroup pay their installment to their chairwoman who, with the assistance of the treasurer, is in charge of repaying the whole sum to the village bank. The chairwoman of the subgroup Sope Serigne Babacar Sy No. 5, which applies now for its second loan, is Mrs Oumou N. and the treasurer is Mrs Ndeye Ndella T., both residents of Thiès. Mrs N., aged 48, is married and the mother of five children. She has passionately run her store for 15 years. She sells chili pepper, shea butter and nététou (a popular condiment in West Africa) at the market in Thiès. She will use her loan to get fresh supplies from Bamako in Mali. Her earnings enable her to provide for her family's daily needs and pay the school fees for her children. The other members of her subgroup are Mrs Ndeye Ndella T. (the treasurer) who sells fish, Mrs Ndou Gou N. who sells perfume, Mrs Ndioba G. who sells bubus (African dresses for both women and men) and cloths, and Mrs Anta M. who sells jewelry and thiouraye (a traditional mixture of grains and fragrant wood that is burnt with coal or charcoal). To bolster their activities, they apply for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs, and each will receive a share of 100,000 CFA francs.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 10

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70 kilometres from Dakar.  The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood.  The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.

Today the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC.  Groups of five members are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount.  On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.  Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC.  Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.

Ms. Aissatou N. is a mother of eight and the head of group No. 10.  She has been active in her trade for over 20 years.  She sells cereals (wheat, sorghum, etc.), peanuts and vegetables in the market of Grand Thies.  She travels to villages in the region to purchase her products.  She says the small loans mean she can only buy so much per visit and so must make more frequent visits than she would like to.

The other members of the group are: Khadidiatou B., who runs a small food stand selling Senegalese dishes such as Mafi and thiébu dieune; Awa F., who sells perfumes; Adama B., who sells bed linens and thiouraye (a Senegalese incense); and Khady N., who sells fresh vegetables.  Each group member receives 100,000 FCFA to finance their activities.

loans.use: To promote each member's small business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth K. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education. Elizabeth's husband is a store keeper while she sells brake fluid and car spare parts at Essaman Junction, near Elmina. Elizabeth has been in this business since 1997, and it enables her to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more spare part for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more car spare parts for resale

loans.name: Ehis

texts.en:
Ehis is 33 years old and married. He has a child who is still dependent on him. His wife is a hairdresser and she also supports their home. 

Ehis sells shoes and handbags to his customers at retail prices. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells for long hours to enable him meet the basic needs  of his family members. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He hopes to own a shoe company in the future. 

Ehis is hoping for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa S. is married and has four children. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a contractor.

Theresa sells raw but fresh groundnuts (peanuts) at Ataabazi, which she has been doing since 2004. She uses her income to pay utility bills.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase more groundnuts in large quantities to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in the business as she wishes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O. is 40 years old and married, and she has six children. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She also sells food supplements at retail prices. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes to expand her businesses in the future. She is a LAPO client.

Helen needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and food supplements to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and food supplements to sell

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of four members who all live in Sarei Sambath village in Kandal Province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Kosal S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a widow with one child who is enrolled in the local public school. Kosal is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In addition to this job, she is employed in a garment factory. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Kosal S. has applied for a loan to hire laborers to harvest her rice.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy E. sells fresh groundnuts (peanuts), tins of tomatoes and other food supplies at Ataabazi near Elmina. Nancy has received no formal education. She is married and has four children.

Nancy has been selling groundnuts and tins of tomatoes, etc., since 2003, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and tins of tomatoes in larger quantities for resale.

Nancy hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and tins of tomatoes in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mr. Tuy L. lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing vegetables to support his family. His wife, Mrs. San Chie, is a housewife and she is shown on the right in the photo. They have two children who are workers in a garment factory.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn less money than needed to support their living. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Tuy L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan he wants to buy fuel and pesticides for his vegetable field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel for his farm

loans.name: Mhamad Kamel

texts.en:
Mhamad Kamel is a 60-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children.

Mhamad Kamel has been working as a car painter and repairer since 1970. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped increase his business profitability.

Mhamad Kamel is speciA. in his work because he does it well. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work as well as having previous experience. When he first started his business, he had some financiA. issues. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 45 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Since 1997, he has owned and operated a home product shop where he sells dishes, tissues, home decorations, and other goods. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region, and they feel comfortable buying from his shop because he offers a wide variety of products. 
   
When Hussein first started his business, he faced no difficulties. He started the business because he wanted to have independent work, and because he realized there were no shops like his in his region. 

Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Hussein has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. Hussein's previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his merchandise. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana T. is 44 years old and used to be married to a seafarer. She is a single parent of three children and one dependent, who usually help her in her shop. Nana sells drinks and liquor in her shop. She has been in business for about ten years now, and is very hardworking. Nana is seeking a loan to buy more stock for her shop so that she can care for her children.

loans.use: To buy drinks and liquor for her shop

loans.name: Sok Lay's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of six people who are located in Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sok Lay H. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is fruit seller in front of a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Sokun Cha, is a construction laborer. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers in the garment factory while the other two are attending the local school.

Although members of the family each have business activities, they are still in a poor condition economically. Thus, Mrs. Sok Lay H. would like to apply for a loan to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina S. is a LAPO client. She is a 32-year-old mother of five children. She produces and sells cellophane bags at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She has been in this business for a long time. 

She needs a loan of NGN 90,000 to purchase materials to produce more cellophane bags to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce cellophane bags

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait le commerce de bouillie de mil, elle achète le produit en vrac, le transforme et le prépare en repas pour le petit déjeuné et le soir. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Coumba Diamnka is a 47 year-old married mother of three. She has been a member of Petit Kandé's Banc Villageois for 7 and a half years, and has received 15 loans, all of which have been well managed and repaid. She makes bouillie (a hot breakfast cereal made from millet) for a living; she buys the product in bulk, processes it, and manufactures it into a breakfast or evening meal. She is actively involved in day-to-day family duties.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her commercial productivity

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing U. owns a spiritual shop where she sells spiritual items like candles, oils, spiritual books, and other materials. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Blessing is 35 years old and married. She has five children who are still in school and dependent upon her. Blessing is a LAPO client. 

Blessing is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Nine people, who are all living in Preaek Khmaer village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Leang K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a village vice-chief. Aside from this job, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice and other crops to support his living.

Mr. Leang K. now faces some problems because his rice field has infertile soil. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and rice seed to increase his rice yield in the current year.

Mr. Leang K.’s wife, Mrs. Ros Soem, helps him with the farming. This couple has three children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seed for his farm

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is single and has three children. She has received no formal education. Comfort bakes and sells bread at Ataabazi near Elmina, which she has been doing since 1990. Comfort uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other expenses. 

Comfort will use the loan to purchase more flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients needed to bake her bread. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest in the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady B. est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 05 ans et a eu à bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait un commerce de tissus teintés, elle achète sa marchandise en gros et revend dans son quartier. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou B. is 33 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in Petit Kandé for five years and has had ten loans which she has always paid back on a regular basis. She buys and sells dyed fabric, buying her merchandise wholesale and selling it on in her neighborhood. She contributes to her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex I. is 43 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife has a grocery stall where she sells groceries to support their home. 

Alex runs a motorcycle taxi service. His business is doing well, but he needs more money to lift his family above poverty. He hopes to start a new business. 

Alex is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase a machine to grind cassava. He says that this business is highly lucrative and he hopes to make more profits. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cassava grinding machine

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people, all of whom live in Preaek Khmer village in Kandal province. Roeung T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will use the loan for varying purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Kou Kon, are farmers who own a piece of land on which to grow crops to make a living. With this farm, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to support the green leeks field. Thus, Roeung T. decided to apply for a loan to buy more green leeks to grow, and, with the rest of the loan, she needs to buy fertilizers, and pesticides. 

Roeung T. is the mother of four children, two of whom are farmers, while the other two are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy green leeks, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena M. sells Fante kenkey (a dish served with pepper sauce and fried fish or any type of meat normally eaten by the Fante, an ethnic group in Cape Coast). She also sells raw maize and salt at Memepeasem, near Elmina. Philomena has received junior high education.  She is married and has one child. 

Philomena has been selling kenkey and the other food items since 2007. She is responsible for paying for the electricity and other utilities bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to make her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to make kenkey (local food dish) for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future.

Florence needs a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva.

Florence is a Bini by tribe and she lives in Benin City. She is 34 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Florence is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 03 ans et a bénéficié de 06 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is a 38-year old woman who is married and responsible for her three children. She has been a member of the village bank in Petit Kandé for three years and has had six loans which she has managed well and repaid. She takes a share of the responsiblity for the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Memoh Gideon and they have seven children. She and her entire family live in a house with 12 rooms. Being a very hard working woman, she has encountered some family expenses, such as the death of family members. 

She runs a restaurant business and farming business with the support of her children and her husband. She will invest the loan in buying flour, palm oil, sugar groundnuts and seedlings for farming. With previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with cooked food for their social activities. 

This will be her third loan from GHAPE; she joined GHAPE in 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location in mile 11 Bambui, the quality of her food, and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
The part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of her children; the other part will be used to expand the business. Mary does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization.

loans.use: Buy flour, palm oil and groundnuts for her restaurant and seeds for planting

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. Juliet needs a loan amount of 160,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. 

She lives in Benin City. She is 29 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a businessman. She is a LAPO client. (Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa). She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S. est une femme de 77 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 9 ans et a bénéficié de 18 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien remboursés. Elle possède d'une table au marché où elle vend de l'oignon et différents produits alimentaires tels que de la moutarde, des épices, du vinaigre etc. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Coumba S. is a 77-year old woman who is married with ten children. She has been a member of the village bank in Petit Kandé for nine years and has 18 loans which she has always repaid without any problem. She has a stall in the market where she sells onions and diverse foodstuffs such as mustard, spices, vinegar etc.. She takes a share of her family's daily responsiblities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Tante

texts.en:
V. is married to Tante Nde Mathias and they have five children. She and her entire family are living in a house with three bedrooms. Being a very hard working woman, she has encountered some expenses in the family, such as the death of family members. 

She runs a poultry business and sells foodstuffs with the support of her children and her husband. She will invest the loan in buying groundnuts, palm oil, three-week-old chicks, and fowl feed. With previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with chickens for their social activities. 

This will be her third loan from GHAPE; she joined GHAPE in 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location in mile 11 Bambui, the quality of her food, and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
The part of the profits from this loan will be used to pay the school fees of her children; the other part will be used to expand the business. V. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization.

loans.use: To buy food for sale and chicks for raising and selling

loans.name: Shodibek

texts.ru: Курбонов Шодибек проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Курбонов Шодибек имеет высшее образование. Шодибек более 8 лет занимается пчеловодством т.е. производством мёда. Кредит просит для покупки пчело- семей.
texts.en:
Shodibek K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He's 53, married with 3 children, and has a college education. He has been a beekeeper, producing honey, for more then 8 years. He plans to use his loan to buy bee colonies.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bee colonies.

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa is a fashion designer and she makes lovely Nigerian and western designs for her customers. She also sells sarongs of various colors and prices. She hopes to design clothes that meet international standards in the future and she also hopes to own a fashion home. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 43 years old and a mother of five children. Her husband is a businessman and carpenter. Adesuwa is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 38 years old. He is married with five children. His children are still young and dependent. He owns a restaurant where he sells Nigerian cooked food and drinks. His wife also assists him in his restaurant business. He loves cooking and that is why he commercialized his cooking skills to make money. Joseph hopes to see his restaurant business grow bigger and attract more customers. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine A. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Zone 1 Pasel, Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, selling food and rice.

Geraldine’s husband, Ruel A., is 37 years old and works as a fisherman and earns about PHP 10,000 per month. They have two children who are  6 and 10 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Geraldine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in June of 2009, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family's income by engaging in her general store business, selling food and rice. Now, she earns an average monthly income of PHP 2,800 from her business activities.

Geraldine is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and food vending, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her second loan, the amount of PHP 6,000, which she intends to use to fund her general store, food vending and rice retailing business. Geraldine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B., 57, is married and lives in Prk Pag-asa, Brgy Zone 1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental in the Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store.

Irene’s husband, Rodrigo B., is  61 years old and works as carpenter and welder, and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. They have four children, who are between 32 and 38 years old, and six grandchildren. Three of the children have their own families, but still help their parents with some of the household expenses. The remaining single child also works and helps with the household expenses.

Irene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family's income by operating a general store and fruit vending. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP from her business activities.

Irene is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 14th loan, the amount of 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store and fruit vending business. Irene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

Rosalie’s husband, Ronie B., is 39 years old and works as a company driver, earning about 6,000 PHP per month. They have three children who are between 1 and 13 years old. Two of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Now, she is borrowing for her fifth loan, the amount of 13,000 PHP, which she intends to use on the general store. Rosalie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Analine

Analine P., 39, is separated from her husband and lives in Prk. Pasil, Brgy Zone1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by selling fish and potholders.

Analine is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing for her 15th loan, the amount of 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her fish vending business. Analine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Matilda works hard to support her husband to meet the family's needs. 

Matilda is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. Matilda has one apprentice in training. She has been in the business for five years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her business

Beatrice works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a seamstress by profession, working in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to her, she has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to expand her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-six years old. She is divorced and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

Janet works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community, procuring her goods from Accra. Janet has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 51-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Saleh has been selling wholesale fruits and vegetables since 1990. He is known for his competitive prices and his good and tasty merchandise. He also knows how to treat his clients who are his friends, neighbors, shopkeepers and others.

Saleh requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Saleh has requested a loan.

When he first started his business, Saleh had some financial issues which didn’t allow him to diversify his merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a forty year old married mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. She works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Jane is a merchant who sells ladies’ underwear and children's clothes. She sells door-to-door and treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures the goods from Accra. Jane has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mohamad has been working in construction for two years now. Mohamad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a van which will allow him to commute everyday to work and carry his tools. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 
Mohamad is talented in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mohamad decided to work in this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a van for his work.

Comfort works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. Comfort has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.  She also deals in dressing accessories.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 26 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Since 2004, Tarek has owned and operated a coffee shop where he offers billiards, cards, other entertainment games, and Internet access. He also serves narguileh (also known as 'shisha' in Egypt) which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Tarek requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and new narguileh for his shop. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan. 
Tarek is talented in his work because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop and enjoying a nice coffee or drink with their narguileh. His clients are his friends, neighbors, passers-by and people from his region. When he first started this business, he had difficulty purchasing all the necessary merchandise for his shop, and the shop did not have a nice decor. Tarek decided on going into this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa). She is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She owns a grocery stall where she sells drinks and groceries like sugar, noodles, bread, milk, butter, soaps, and detergent. She hopes to move from the level of a retailer to a wholesaler. She needs a loan amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Comfort

Comfort is fifty years old. She is a divorced woman and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Comfort has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

texts.en: Blessing is 25 years old and single without children. She is a part-time student in a higher institution. She is ambitious and hard working. Blessing went into business in order to support herself to pay her school fees, settle her bills, and take care of her younger ones. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Diariétou

texts.fr: Diariétou M. est une femme de 53 ans elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 9 ans et y a bénéficié de 18 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle possède d'une table au marché où elle vend des légumes et d'autre produits alimentaire tels que de l'huile de palme et des épices. Elle participe à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diariétou M. is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Petit Kandé for nine years and has already benefited from 18 loans. She has repaid all of her previous loans. She has a stall at the market where she sells vegetables and other food products like palm oil and spices. She helps pay for her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operational cash flow

loans.name: Janet

Josephine is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Rehema B., age 30, is married and has three children, who are 5, 7 and 10 years old. She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business since 2007. From the business, she is able to able to earn a monthly profit of around $110.

This will be Rehema’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business.
	
Rehema will share this loan with her loan subgroup, which includes two other members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Rehema is the woman in the middle of the picture.

loans.use: The loan will pay for fruits and vegetables to increase her stock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is thirty-nine years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. Lucy lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Lucy is a trader, trading in cereals: rice and beans. She procures bags of rice and beans from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for eighteen years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en la zona Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia, tiene tres hijos de los cuales la esposa se dedica a la crianza.

El señor trabaja en una empresa minera ya hace 15 años de la ciudad de La Paz. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra material de construcción para refaccionar su casa.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own house in the Villa Exaltación zone of the city of El Alto. He has three children, and his wife is dedicated to their care. For 15 years, Pedro has worked for a mining company of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for building materials (cement, sand, etc) to refurbish his house. This is Pedro’s fourth loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation has qualified him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials such as cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Imuentiyen

texts.en:
Imuentiyen sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future.

Imuentiyen needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Imuentiyen lives in Benin City. She is 27 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a press man.

Imuentiyen is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Gloria is a baker, procuring bags of flour from nearby communities. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Abena works very hard to provide for her children. She is a baker, procuring bags of flour from nearby communities. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers in her community. She also deals in pastries.

Abena has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Warumi Group

texts.en:
Bahati K., 29, is married with two children, aged ten and six months. She has a shop where she sells water, juice, and soda, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $210 USD. This will be Bahati’s first  loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. With her loan, she hopes to top up her stock in order to increase revenue, and start selling chips as well.
Bahati will share this loan with her loan group, Warumi, which totals 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Bahati is seated in the second row, third from the right, just behind the lady with the baby. She is wearing a black dress.

loans.use: To buy stocks of juice, water and soda, and to start selling chips

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is forty-four years old. She is a widowed woman and has given birth to nine children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Akua is a trader, trading in maize and groundnuts (peanuts). She procures bags of maize and groundnuts from nearby communities and then supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Nnenna

texts.en:
Nnenna is a hair stylist. She sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Nnenna needs a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

Nnenna lives in Benin City. She is 27 years old and single without children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Nnenna hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is fifty-seven years old. She is a widowed mother of eight children. Some of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Afua sells game meat, such as grass cutter (rodent meat that is a delicacy in Ghana). She procures the bush meat from hunters in her locality and in nearby communities. Afua supplies the meat to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for thirty years and wants a loan to expand her business. [Editor's Note: For more information about grass cutter meat in Ghana, see "Bushmeat boom benefits Ghana's farmers" in BBC News.]

loans.use: To buy game meat to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is forty-four years old. She is widowed and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Abena prepares and sells rice with beans from a table top by the roadside in her community. Abena buys the rice and beans from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans to prepare and sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is thirty years old. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Regina works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Regina sells groceries by the roadside in her community. Regina buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is a 52-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Afua works to help her husband provide for their family. 

Afua sells fried fish. She buys fresh fish from nearby fishing communities, fries it, and then sells it to food vendors and retailers in her community. Afua has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 52-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Victoria sells second-hand clothes. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to nearby towns to sell. She buys the goods in Accra. Victoria has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Irma tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene una hija llamada Katherine que tiene 9 años y estudia en el colegio. La socia Irma vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y su esposo y también limpia la casa. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa desde las 6am hasta 5pm tiene que estar en su pequeño negocio de venta de condimentos y menestras en el mercado modelo de Calca. La socia nos cuenta que antes ella viajaba a la ciudad del Cusco para traer los condimentos pero ahora tiene proveedores que le traen condimentos del Cusco.  Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar ají panca (Ají grande de color morado, se seca en la misma planta. Se usa entero o molido. Es un condimento muy usado en la cocina peruana) y va comprar 200 kilos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Irma is 29, married, and has a daughter, Katherine. Her daughter is nine and goes to school. Irma lives in the city of Calca in the Cusco department. She belongs to the Mamacha Asunta Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother. She gets up very early in order to do her household chores. For example, she makes breakfast for her children and husband, and she also cleans the house. After her household chores, she has to be at her small business from six a.m. until five p.m. She sells condiments and vegetables at the Modelo market in Calca. She tells us that she used to travel to the city of Cusco to get the condiments. Now she has providers who bring her the condiments from Cusco. She has been in the business for eight years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She needs the loan to buy chili peppers (large purple pepper that dries in the plant. It is used whole or ground. It is a condiment used frequently in Peruvian cooking). She will buy 200 kilos. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 200 kilos of chili peppers

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia, age 33, lives near the town of Samana in the Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Yessenia and her husband live with their three children in a simple home from which she also runs her small business. Yessenia sells necklaces, earrings, Avon beauty products, toiletries, and perfumes, and also makes custom clothing for her clients. With this loan, her ninth loan from Esperanza International, Yessenia plans to buy a new sewing machine and more inventory. 

As in most of the Dominican Republic, life in Samana can be very difficult. Running potable water is unavailable, electricity is scarce at best, and healthcare and infrastructure are inadequate. 

Despite these difficulties, Yessenia has bright hopes for the future. She plans to continue expanding her business with continued access to loans. Yessenia also hopes to improve life for her family by purchasing furniture for her home, finishing the construction of her kitchen, and buying a computer. In addition, the profits from her business will help Yessenia to buy shoes, books, backpacks, and other school supplies for her three young children. She hopes to send them to college one day, helping them become professionals and grow economically. 

Thank you for your loan to Yessenia and the Paz y Amor Group!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more inventory

loans.name: Los Esforzados De Nueva Imperial Group

texts.en:
This village bank is called “Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” (The Hard-workers of Nueva Imperial). The members are from the city of Nueva Imperial in the Temuco region of Chile. This city is approximately 415 miles south of Chile’s capital, Santiago. The region of Temuco is known for its natural springs and its native and eye-catching flora and fauna.

“Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” is comprised of 22 persevering members. The main activities of its members are the manufacturing and sale of various products, such as fabric, clothing, earrings, necklaces, wooden utensils, cooked food such as empanadas (folded and stuffed pastries), ice, and ice cream. There are also members who sell medicinal herbs and a member who runs a service center of telephone booths.

This village bank’s president is Pedro, who is pictured above in the center of the photo wearing a white shirt. He is an artisan who works with wood, making a range of items including kitchen utensils, earrings, brooches, yokes, and wagons. He sells these items in a shopping mall and various local markets with permission from the municipal government, similar to the other members of the village bank. With the loan, Pedro would like to purchase an electric saw to help him grow his production. His hope is to remodel his 59-year-old home where he lives with his mother, and his dream is to one day export his products to grow his sales.

For Pedro, Fondo Esperanza has meant great economic help for his business, because thanks to prior loans, he was able to purchase a copy machine and a key copier, which allowed him to offer more services and secure more economic stability. The rest of the members of “Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” also plan to invest their loans in machines and merchandise so that they can continue growing and reaching their personal goals.

loans.use: machines and merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Carla Veronica

texts.es:
Carla Veronica A. Monrroy tiene 34 años, actualmente es soltera vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en un barrio al Oeste de la ciudad.
 
Es profesion Psicologa, trabaja en una institucion de niños desde hace dos años, para los cuales debe presentar informes diarios sobre sus trabajos realizados, pero requiere de una herramienta indispensable para presentar dichos informes.

El credito sera destinado a la compra de una computadora portatil, con la cual realizara sus informes y trabajos de manera mas rapida y eficiente. Con la cual obtendra mejores resultados en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carla Veronica A. Monrroy is 34 and single. She lives in the city of Cochabamba in a neighborhood west of the city. She is a psychologist. She has worked in a children’s institution for two years. She needs to present daily reports about her work. However, she needs an indispensable tool in order to make those reports. The loan is to buy a laptop computer. She will use it to make reports and do her work more rapidly and efficiently. She will use it to get better results in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a laptop computer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Mary prepares and sells kenkey (corn or cassava dumplings) with fried fish. She sells them by the roadside in her community. She buys bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: To make a living in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria, Gift sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are mostly residents and friends. She hopes to expand her business in the future. During our visit to take her picture, she had run out of stock and was about to go to the market. Gift hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Cecilia works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Cecilia is a baker. She bakes bread and sells it to retailers in her community. She also sells maize. Cecilia buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 31 years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Felicia works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Felicia sells groceries by the roadside in her community. Felicia buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Francis Reiza

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Francis tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos: Jennifer tiene 17 años, Maite tiene 15 años y Karla tiene 8 años. La socia Francis vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y su esposo y también limpia la casa. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa por la mañana va enseñar en el PRONEI (programa de nacional de educación inicial) ya son 13 años como profesora del programa. En las tardes atiende su salón de belleza donde hace maquillajes, cortes de cabello y ondulaciones y también vende productos de belleza “Esika y Avon”. Ya son 12 años que se dedica al servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar instrumentos de belleza como tijeras y rulos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Francis is 37, married, and has three children. Jennifer is 17, Maite is 15, and Karla is 8. Francis lives in the city of Calca in the Cusco department. She belongs to the Mamacha Asunta Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother. She gets up very early to do her household chores. For example, she makes breakfast for her children and husband, and she also cleans the house. After doing her household chores, she goes to teach in the mornings at PRONEI (national program of early education). She has been a teacher in the program for 13 years. In the afternoons, she tends her beauty salon where she does make up, hair cuts, and styling. She also sells Esika and Avon beauty products. She has been doing this work for 12 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy beauty tools like scissors and hair rollers. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty tools like scissors and hair rollers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis C. N. esta casado con la Sra. Florentina Coria Guzman por 37 años, tienen 3 hijos y 1 hija. Los tres Varones son independientes y estan casados, la hija vive todavia con ellos y esta estudiando en un instituto. Viven en Mallco Chapi al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba a 23 kilometros de distancia en una zona agricola y lechera, tienen casa propia.

El Sr. Luis trabaja con el ganado lechero desde hace 26 años, entrega toda su produccion a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos para el mercado de Cochabamba. Tiene tierras en las cuales produce maiz.

Requieren el prestamo para poder comprar alimento para su ganado lechero y para poder realizar la construccion de un pozo y canales de agua para riego de sus tierras agricolas. Esto incrementara sus niveles de ingresos ya que su produccion de maiz mejorara y su produccion de leche tambien.
texts.en:
Luis C. N. and Florentina Coria Guzman have been married for 37 years and have 3 sons and a daughter. Their three sons are married and fully independent; whereas their daughter still lives with them and studies in an institute. They live in a house they own in Mallco Chapi, 23 kilometers west of the city of Cochabamba, in an agricultural and dairy area.

Luis has been working with dairy cattle for 26 years. He delivers all of his milk production to a company that produces all sorts of dairy products to sell in the Cochabamba market. He also has land where he grows corn.

They are requesting this loan in order to purchase feed for their dairy cattle and to build a well and irrigation channels for their crops. This would improve their income since it would increase their corn output and also their milk production.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle feed and build a well and irrigation channels

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 37 years old. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Hannah sells groceries by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods in Accra and nearby towns. Hannah has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is thirty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Sara sells beans and groundnuts. She buys bags of beans and groundnuts from nearby communities and sells them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works very hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Sophia is a baker. She bakes bread and pastries and sells them to retailers in her community. Sophia buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buyflour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty-one years old. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Comfort works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Comfort runs a grocery store by the roadside in their community. She buys her goods from Accra and nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama C. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CHATEAU D'EAU depuis 7 ans et demi et elle a eu 15 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la restaration et ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama C. is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Chateau D'Eau for seven and a half years, and she has had 15 experiences with credit. She is in the food catering industry, and her profits help her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote Commercial Activity

loans.name: Yessika Waleska

texts.es:
la Joven Yessika Waleska C. tiene 23 años de edad,  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Yessika se dedica al negocio de pulperia, tiene pocos años de tener su negocio, esta pulperia era de su madre y ahora es de ella. Yessika lo esta administrando bien, dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion.
Yessiika esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, desea comprar otro tipo de productos y asi tener mas variedad y que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que anden buscando,
 
nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que a su corta edad ya tiene un negocio propio y que lo piensa hacer crecer hasta llegar a tener un supermercadito.
su meta es poder darle los mejores estudios a su hijo que es lo mas importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Yessika Waleska C. is 23 years old, is single, and has one son. She is the proprietor of a general store. She is fairly new in this business; the store previously belonged to her mother. She is doing well with the administration of the store, which is located in her house. Yessika is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for the store. She wants to buy other types of products to have more variety, so her customers can always find what they are looking for. In particular, she will buy cough drops, chicken, pork, sugar, rice, cleaning products, cheese, fried snacks, soft drinks and juices. Yessika says she is happy to have her own business at such a young age. She would like to expand to become a small supermarket. Her goal is give the best education to her son, who is the most important thing in her life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro is 39 years old and married. She is a tailor by training. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to excel in her business and family life. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers and she also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero, tiene 34 años de edad, y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde que era muy joven, trabaja en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Esta actividad no le ofrece la estabilidad suficiente para solventar sus gastos personales y para ayudar a sus padres, por lo que desde hace un año empezó a trabajar adicionalmente en la crianza de animales y en la comercialización de leña.

Juan compra troncos de algarrobo recien talados a comercializadores de la zona y lo corta en trozos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes en “armadas” (atos de leña) de 30 unidades. Además también cría animales de corral para venderlos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona eventualmente.

El negocio de la venta de leña es de utilidad en la zona donde vive ya que la mayoría de familias cocinan sus alimentos con este producto, por lo que Juan está planeando ampliar su negocio, por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más troncos de algarrobo con los cuales pueda  captar más clientes.

Juan es un hombre muy conocido en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima. Su más grande anhelo es sacar adelante a sus padres y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is single and 34 years old. He lives with his parents in the small town of La Pava, Mochumí district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked as a farmworker since he was very young, and he works in various fields in the area. This work does not provide enough stability to cover his expenses and also help his parents. For this reason, for a year he has also been working selling firewood and raising animals. Juan buys the trunks of recently cut carob trees from sellers in the area and he cuts them in smaller pieces so that he can offer them to his customers in “armadas” (bundles of firewood) containing 30 units. He also raises barnyard animals to sell to merchants who visit the area from time to time. His firewood business is useful in the area where he lives because the majority of families there use firewood for cooking. For this reason Juan is planning to expand his business, and is requesting a first-time loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He will invest the money in the purchase of more carob tree trunks with which he can get more customers. Juan is well known in the area in which he lives. His neighbors and customers hold him in great esteem. His greatest wish is to help his parents get ahead and to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carob tree trunks in order to sell firewood.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna B. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Maria Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Nacaome, Reyna se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, vende camisas de vestir, cubayeras, camisetas, zapatos de dama, sandalias. tiene varios años de tener su negocio, las mayoria de las camisas que vende son para uniformes de escuelas y colegios de la localidad, en esta epoca de inicio de clases necesita comprar mas ropa para poder darse abasto con las ventas.
dice sentirse muy bien de salud y esta alegre porque todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
con las ganancias que tenga quiere hacerle unas mejoras a su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Reyna B. is 49 years old and lives in the Barrio Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. Reyna has a business selling clothing and shoes. She sells dress shirts, cubayeras [cuban-style shirts], t-shirts, women’s shoes, and sandals. She has been in this business for several years. Most of the shirts Reyna sells are for school uniforms. In this season of the beginning of the school year, she needs to buy more stock to keep up with the demand. Reyna says she is happy to be in good health, and that everything is going well. With her earnings, she would like to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dress shirts, t-shirts, cloth, shoes, and sandals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata M. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PROMOTION DE LA FEMME depuis deux ans et y a reçu 4 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés. Elle développe une activité de vente de bétail, elle achète ses sujets, les engraisse et les revend au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
