Aminata M. is a 29-year old woman who is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the "Promotion de la Femme" (Promotion of the Woman) village bank for two years and has received four loans from the bank which she has managed well. She is building up a livestock business; she buys her animals, fattens them up and sells them on after four to five months. She assumes a share of the family's responsibilities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her livestock selling business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is a hardworking woman and she is focused. She sells planks to make a living in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She also loves her business because it is highly profitable.

Helen is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She hopes to be a plank distributor in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Meile Yirabel

texts.es:
Meile B. de 27 años, vive en una casa de caña ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, no esta casada pero tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 años y otro de 8 años los dos estudiando en una escuela fiscal. 

Meile comenzó el negocio de la tienda  con unos ahorros que tenia así empezó vendiendo arroz y aceites poco a poco pudo surtir más su negocio, Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00 todos los días vendiendo la libra de pollo a $ 1.30, la libra de arroz $ 0.30, el litro de aceite a $ 2.00. Una de las dificultades que ahora último ha tenido son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, azúcar, pollos para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere surtir la tienda con productos de bazar y poder construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Meile B. is 27 years old. She lives in a house with walls constructed from cane, located on the Perimetral (ring road) of Guayaquil. She is unmarried but has two children, aged 6 and 8. Both of them attend a government school. Meile started her business, a store, with some of her savings. She began by selling rice and cooking oil, and she gradually added more products to her business. Now she works every day from 7:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night, selling a pound of chicken for $1.30, a pound of rice for $0.30, and a liter of oil for $2.00. One of the difficulties she has faced recently has been the heavy rains. With this loan, she would like to buy rice, oil, sugar, and chicken in order to expand her business. In the future, she would like to broaden her store's range of products to include bazaar-type items, and she would also like to rebuild her house using cement.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, cooking oil and chicken

loans.name: Maria Lino

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Lino R. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, vende huevos, manteca, aceite, sal, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, galletas, margarina, condimentos, harina de maiz y trigo, salsas. 
su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome.
tiene 5 años de tener su negocio.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que Maria es muy atenta con ellos, tiene un buen caracter, es my amable, por eso es que muchas personas compran en su negocio.
Maria necesita el credito para comprar mercaderia ya que en estos momentos no tiene surtido el negocio.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
su meta es poder graduar a sus hijos para que sean unos buenos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Lino R. sells groceries such as eggs, butter, oil, salt, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, margarine, spices, corn and wheat flour, and sauces. Her business is located in the municipal market of the town of Nacaome. She’s had this business for five years. Many customers choose Maria’s store to do their shopping in as she provides good service, is good-natured and friendly. She needs a loan so she can buy more merchandise as at the moment the store has no stock. It is her only source of income. Her goal is to have her children complete their education so they can get good jobs and do well in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr: Aïchatou W. est une femme de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et souhaiterait augmenter son capital. Ses revenus lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïchatou W. is a 52-year old woman who is married with five children. She has a beef fattening activity and would like to increase her capital. Her income will allow her to improve the living conditions, schooling and health of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out a beef fattening activity

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maribell tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: Justo tiene 12 años y Andree tiene 1 año. La socia Maribell vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y su esposo y también limpia la casa. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa lleva comida al mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 4 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, carne y verduras para preparar más platos de comida.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maribell is 30 years old, married, and has two children: Justo (12 years) and Andree (1 year). She lives in the city of Calca, in the department of Cusco, and is a member of the Arariwa Association’s Mamacha Asunta Community Bank. Maribell is a hardworking mother and businesswoman who gets up very early each morning to begin her daily activities such as preparing breakfast for her children and husband, and cleaning the house. After doing these chores, she takes food to the Modelo Market in Calca. She’s been selling food there for four years and has done very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, meat and vegetables for more meals. Maribell is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan, and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meal ingredients

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío San Isidro, distrito de Morrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace más de 10 años en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría patos, gallinas, pavos y diversas aves de corral en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los comercializa con los negociantes que eventualmente visitan el lugar en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y su esposa se dedica a realizar trabajos de artesanía para venderlos por pedidos.

Juan trata de sacar adelante a su familia esforzándose al máximo en su trabajo. El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el arreglo del techo de su casa ya que está muy debilitado y no soportaría las lluvias que se presentan en la zona durante los meses de verano.

El es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es bridarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar carreras superiores.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 and married. He lives with his wife and their three children in the San Isidro settlement in the Morrope district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years he has been raising and selling small animals. He raises ducks, hens, turkeys, and diverse poultry in back of his house. He sells them to businessmen who visit his place now and then. He also works as an agricultural worker. His wife makes handicrafts to sell by order. Juan tries to get his family ahead; he puts maximum effort into his work. For the first time, he is asking Edpyme for a loan for 1,000 PEN. He plans to use it to fix the roof of his house. The roof is very weak, and it will not support the rains that fall in the area during the summer months. He is a responsible father, and he is very devoted to his family. His greatest desire is to give his family a good quality of life and to give his children the opportunity of post high school career education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build the roof on his house

loans.name: Ndèye Khéwé

texts.fr: Ndèye Khéwé M. est âgée de 60 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures, et divers alimentaires. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Khéwé M. is 60 years old, married and has four children. She is active in the trade of cloth, shoes and various foodstuffs. Her aim is to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade of cloth, shoes, sugar and  other foodstuffs

loans.name: Nafi

texts.fr: Nafi M. est une femme mariée de 49ans. Elle fait du petit commerce de tissu et ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital. Son objectif est de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Nafi M. is a married woman who is 49 years old. She has a small cloth business and this loan will allow her to strengthen her capital. Her aim is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out a small cloth business

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
la joven Maria Rosibel V. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Nacaome,  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, con las ventas de la navidad se quedo con poca mercaderia y ahora necesita comprar mas para tener mayores ventas.
las ganancias que tuvo las invirtio en su casa de habitacion y en su hijo.
ahora necesita hacer crecer su negocio un poco para poder cubrir con los gastos mensuales de su hogar.
nos comento que este negocio es muy bueno ya que la ropa que viene en los fardos es ropa de marca y de buena calidad, la mayoria esta en buen estado.
dice que su meta es poder hacer crecer su negocio y hacerlo una tieda grande de ropa.
muchos clientes la prefieren porque vende su producto a un precio justo para las personas que viven en esta comunidad.
texts.en:
The young Maria Rosibel V. is 22 years old and lives in the San Jose neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She sells used clothing out of her home. The Christmas season sales left her with little merchandise, and now she needs to purchase more so that she can have greater sales. The earnings that she got were invested in her home and also in her son. Now she needs to grow her business a little so that she can cover the monthly expenses of her household. She tells us that business is good, and that the bales of clothing that come are brand-name and of good quality, and the majority of items are in good condition. She says that her goal is to be able to grow her business and make it into a large clothing store. Many customers prefer her business because she sells her products at a fair price for the people who live in this community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 47 years old and married with eight children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old. Her children all go to school and are still dependent on her. To make a living, Eunice sells cellophane bags in Benin City, Edo State. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. Her customers are mostly friends and local residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cellophane bags to sell. Eunice was about to go to the market when we visited her. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a trader and he also supports the home.

Mercy sells foodstuffs like crayfish, melons, cooking oil, stockfish (fish dried in the sun) and pepper. She supports her husband in providing their children with the basic necessities of life and hopes for a better tomorrow for her family.

Mercy needs the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Mercy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es:
la señora Melchi Susana R. P. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian y le ayudan en las tareas  de la casa, su esposo es policia preventivo. viven en El Barrio El Centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 
Melchi se dedica a la comercializacion de productos de plastico para el hogar, como ser platos, vasos, pailas, cestas, palanganas, tasas, etc. 
tambien vende lacteos los fines de semana como ser: mantequilla, queso, quesillo. 
 
este negocio lo realiza desde hace 11 años tiene casa propia y vende su productos a los vecinos de la comunidad en donde vive. 
esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio, ya que ahorita tiene poco producto y estos productos se consiguen mas baratos comprandolos al por mayor, asi logra tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melchi Susana R. P. is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. The children are in school and they help her with the household chores. Her husband is a policeman, and they live in the El Centro neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Melchi sells plastic products for the home, such as plates, cups, basins, baskets, bowls, etc. She also sells dairy products on the weekends including butter and a variety of types of cheese. She has had this business for 11 years. She has her own home, and she sells her products to her neighbors in the community where she lives. She is requesting a loan to stock her store, since right now she has few products and she can get these products at a cheaper price if she buys them wholesale. In this way she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plastic products for the home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou T. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis  02 ans. Elle développe une vente de tissus teintés. Elle achète en gros les coupons de tissus et les revend au détail. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Aïssatou T. is a 40-year old woman who is married and has five children. She has been a member of the village bank for two years. She is building up an activity selling dyed cloth. She buys rolls of cloth in bulk and sells them on retail. Her profits will allow her to take a share of the responsibilities for her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her business

loans.name: Albertina Cleotilde

texts.es:
la señora Albertina Cleotide Z. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en en union libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja en infop una institucion que se dedica a capacitar a personas en todos las areas, es una institucion gubernamental.
tienen una hija que depende de ellos al 100%.
Albertina se dedica a la comercializacion de ropa como ser: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, blumers, bikinis etc. Albertna realiza esta actividad desde hace varios años, es su unica fuente de ingresos. 
 
esta solicitando este crédito para comprar mercaderia al por mayor, ya que en estos momentos tiene poca mercaderia y al comprarla al por mayor obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales las utiliza para compartir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina Cleotide Z. is 42 years old and in a common law marriage. Her husband works at INFOP, a government organization that works to train people. They have a daughter who is 100% dependent upon them. Albertina works selling clothing, such as pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, swimsuits, etc. She has done this for many years, and it is her only source of income.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise in bulk, since she now has a small quantity of merchandise and buying in bulk provides higher income, which she will then use for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts, blouses, jeans, socks, and underwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reyna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reyna está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que han buscado la manera de salir adelante. Una de ellas es Marisol S. quien se dedica a vender cosméticos comerciales es decir productos del mercado y ropa. Esta señora cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo en el negocio y con sus dos pequeños hijos.

Su compañera Martha Lorena V. tiene una carnicería la cual está ubicada en la casa de su madre ya que tiene una mejor proyección. Ella es una señora soltera que trabaja para cubrir sus gastos. Además sus hijos son independientes y están casados. 

Mientras Sandra Lourdes tiene un tramo en el mercado Oriental de ropa el cual administra junto con su esposo. Ella vende ropa infantil, ropa interior y ropa de adulto por mayor es decir por docena. Este es un negocio muy prospero con el cual está muy contenta.
texts.en:
The Reyna Group is composed of 3 working women who have searched for a way to get ahead. One of them is Marisol S. who sells commercial cosmetics, market products and clothing. Marisol can count on the economic and moral support of her husband, in the business and with their two small children. Her companion, Martha Lorena V., has a butcher shop located in her mother's house. It seems to have a bright future. She is a single woman who works to cover her expenses. In addition, her children are independent and married. Meanwhile, Sandra Lourdes has a stall in the Oriental clothing market which she operates with her husband. She sells baby clothes, underwear, and clothing for adults wholesale. This is a very prosperous enterprise with which she is very content.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY COSMETICS TO SELL

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma trabaja como artesana; confecciona mantas de vicuña y alpaca que  comercializa en la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Villa Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materia prima (lana) para poder incrementar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Wilma works as a craftsperson; she makes blankets from vicuña and alpaca wool that she sells in the city of El Alto. This activity is her main source of income and it covers the support of her small son who is 2 years old. She lives in her parents house, which is located in the Villa Tahuantinsuyo neighborhood of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials (wool) so that she can increase her production and thus increase her income. This is her first loan with Kiva; the evaluation carried out by IMPRO approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vicuña and alpaca wool for her business making blankets

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Felipe de Jesus C. tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en la aldea el rebalce pespire, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, Felipe tiene un taller de reparacion de llantas, cambios de aceites a vehiculos pesados y livianos.
su negocio esta a la orilla de la carretera panamericana en la cual circulan muchos vehiculos todos los dias que necesitan de sus servicios.
arregla muchas llantas punchadas todos los dias.
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar llantas, aceite, parches, neumaticos.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe de Jesus C. is 33 years old and is married, with three children. He lives in the Rebalce neighborhood of Pespire.

Felipe runs his business from his home. He has a workshop for repairing tires and changing oil for both heavy and light vehicles. His business is alongside the Panamerican Highway, where many vehicles that need his services pass by every day. He fixes many flat tires every day.

Felipe is applying for a loan to buy tires, oil, patches, and tubes.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires, oil, patches, and tubes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Derly Hubert

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Derly tiene 22 años y es soltero. El socio Derly vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio estudia contabilidad en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y esta en el quinto ciclo. El socio viaja a la ciudad del Cusco a las 7 a.m. y permanece hasta las 3 p.m. en la universidad. El socio los domingos juega fútbol en el equipo “Humberto Luna” de Calca y nos cuenta que su equipo el año 2009 salio campeon. El socio administra su pequeño negocio familiar de venta de golosinas, galletas, etc., es un kiosco escolar que funciona en el colegio “Humberto Luna” de Calca. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un joven trabajador, emprendedor que saca adelante su carrera profesional. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como golosinas, galletas y refrescos para el kiosco escolar.    
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Community bank member Derly is 22 years old and is single. He lives in the city of Calca, in the Cusco region, and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" of the Arariwa Association.

Derly studies accounting at the National University San Antonio Abad del Cusco and is in his fifth semester. He travels to the city of Cusco at 7 a.m. and stays at the university until 3 p.m. On Sundays he plays soccer for the Calca Humberto Luna team, and he tells us that his team was the 2009 champion.

Derly runs a small family business that sells candies, cookies, etc., in a school snack stand at the Humberto Luna school in Calca. He has already worked at this business for several years and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the effort that he puts into his work. Our community bank member Derly is a young worker and entrepreneur who is advancing his professional career. He is seeking the loan to buy more products like candy, cookies, and soda for the school snack stand.

Derly is grateful for the opportunity offered by the loan, and he also promises to repay the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like candies, cookies, and sodas to sell at school snack stand

loans.name: Mame Mariéme

texts.fr: Mame Mariéme D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 05 ans. Elle développe une activité de vente de chaussures et de sacs à main pour dame. Elle est bien expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Son objectif est de mobiliser assez d'épargne afin de tendre vers une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mame Mariéme D., age 43, is married and the mother of six children. She's been a member of the Village Bank for five years. Her business consists in selling shoes and women's handbags. She's very experienced in this field, since she's been working in it for five years. Her goal is to gather enough savings in order to be financially autonomous.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to autofinance

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Isabel M. A. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Chocolate, Pespire. esta casada y tiene dos hijos su esposo se dedica a manejar un bus de la empresa San Benito
 
Maria viaja a san lorenzo para comprar mercaderia para vender en su negocio, el cual tiene 02 años de tenerlo, vende granos basicos y otros productos de consumo popular, tambien vende al por mayor a otras pulperias cercanas a su comunidad.
esta solicitando el credito para comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta en su negocio para poder atender bien a su clientela.
su meta es poder graduar a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Isabel M. A. is 33 years old. She lives in the small village of Chocolate, Pespire. She is married and has two children. Her husband drives a bus for the San Benito company.

Maria travels to San Lorenzo to buy merchandise to sell in her business, which she has had for two years. She sells basic foods and other popular consumer products. She also sells wholesale to other nearby grocery stores in her community.

Maria is applying for a loan to buy some products which she doesn't have in her business now in order to serve her customers better.

Maria's goal is to have her children graduate and have good careers. With the earnings she obtains, she helps her husband with the household expenses and also helps her children.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy eggs, lard, oil, rice, beans, pastas, salsas, soups, jalapeño chiles, disposable plates, coffee, margarine, juice in cans

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Omar tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene una hija llamada Mercedes que tiene 4 años.  El socio Omar vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio trabaja como técnico en informática en el Ministerio de Salud ya son 6 años que trabaja en el ministerio. El socio tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comestibles donde su esposa atiende. El socio nos cuenta que los domingos juega en el equipo de fútbol “Humberto Luna” de Calca donde es el capitán y nos cuenta que el año 2009 salieron campeones. Ya son varios años que él y su esposa se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosas para la tienda de abarrotes.     
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old, lives with his wife and his 4-year-old daughter named Mercedes. They live in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco and he belongs to the Mamacha Asunta communal bank of Arariwa. Omar has been working as an information technician in the health department for six years. He also has a small grocery business that his wife runs. He tell us that he also plays football on Sundays for the Humberto Luna team, the champions of 2009. Omar and his wife have operated the grocery business for several years and it has gone well due to the effort they put into their work. This loan will be used to buy more products such as rice, chicken, meat, cheese, and soft drinks for the grocery store. Omar is a hardworking father and entrepreneur who supports his family. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan, and commits to making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, chicken, cheese, soft drinks, etc. for grocery store.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise S. est âgée de 53ans, mariée et mère de 9enfants. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de miel et d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Louise S., age 53, is married and the mother of nine children. Her business consists in selling honey and palm oil. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital, in order to better provide for her family's healthcare and school expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell honey and palm oil

loans.name: Coumba Radio

texts.fr: Coumba  Radio N. est une femme de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de divers produits tels que chaussures. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba Radio N., age 54, is married and the mother of three children. She sells various items such as shoes. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital, in order to provide for her family's healthcare and school expenses, and to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes and other items

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Bautista F. R. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos.
Juan  tiene una pulperia en donde vende productos de la canasta basica familiar. 
 
este negocio opera desde el año 2003 hasta la fecha le a ido bien, de este negocio saca los gastos del hogar, ahora esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que se a quedado con poco prodcuto y necesita comprar al por mayor para tener mayores ganancias.
la epoca de navidad fue buena en sus ventas y las ganancias que tuvo las invirtio hacer unas pequeñas remodelaciones a su casa.
necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Bautista F. R. is 47 years old, and lives unmarried with his partner and their two sons. Juan owns a small store where he sells basic grocery items. This business has been open since 2003, and has done well since it began. From his business, Señor R. earns enough to cover his household expenses. He is now requesting a loan to help him develop his business further, since he currently has little merchandise left, and needs more money than he has in order to purchase products wholesale. The Christmas season was very good for his sales, and he put the earnings that he made toward making a few small remodels on his house. Señor R. needs this loan to be able to continue improving the success and well-being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de tortillas, huevos, harina de maiz y trigo, leche, churros, cereal, condimentos, pan, galletas, pastas dentales, papel higienico, jabones, cloro, jabon en polvo.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio tiene 47 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de enderezado y pintura. Hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio como aprendiz desde muy joven y ahora es su fuente de trabajo, Wilfredo tenia la responsabilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos el alimento diario por lo que se preocupaba por aprender muy rápido, además el estaba muy alegre con su actividad económica, el expresa que los financiamientos han sido de mucha ayuda pues son muy importantes para que su negocio salga adelante. El solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Antonio is 47 years old. His economic activity is providing vehicle bodywork and painting services. For more than seven years he has worked in this business, in which he started out as an apprentice when he was very young. Now it's his source of work. Wilfredo had the responsibility of providing daily food to his children, for that reason he was concerned about learning his business quickly. Furthermore, he has been very happy with his economic activity. He says that the loans have been a lot of help, as they are very important for his business to move forward. He is requesting the loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est une dame de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine  et de la vente de crème glacée. Ce prêt lui permettre d’augmenter son capital et de plus participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D., age 52, is married and the mother of four children. She raises cattle and sells ice cream. This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital, and to help her improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her businesses (raising cattle and selling ice cream)

loans.name: Yessica Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Yessica tiene 37  años de edad es casada  tiene 3 hijos de 11,9 y 5 años de edad ,su conyugue es maestro de construccion civil. Cuenta con  casa propia   de material noble semi construida en barrio Los escates, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en local alquilado en el centro comercial  Grau ubicado en la primera cuadra de la calle cajamarca, se inicio en este negocio hace 3 años, se inicio como ayudante, ahora cuenta con negocio propio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mas mercaderia. La Sra. Yessica tiene muchos sueños y esperanzas una de ellas es poder crecer  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yessica is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children; ages 11, 9, and 5. Her husband is a master of civil engineering. She has her own house, made of sturdy materials, in the neighborhood Los Escates. She makes a living by selling clothing in a rented space in a mall named Grau, located on the first block of Cajamarca Street. Three years ago, she started in this business as an assistant, and now she has her own business. With the money that she is requesting, she will invest in more merchandise. Yessica has many hopes and dreams, one of them being to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, merchandise

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène M. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son activité consiste à faire du petit commerce d’huile de palme, de balaie et de poisson séchés. Elle voudrait augmenter son capital et avec les revenus générés participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Hélène M., age 46, is married and the mother of eight children. Her business consists in retailing palm oil, brooms, and dried fish. She would like to increase her working capital and use her income to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retail palm oil, brooms, and dried fish

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS D. CONFRATERNIDAD”; nuestros socios son en su mayoría residentes en la ciudad del Cusco y naturales D. diferentes departamentos del Perú.

Debido a que la ciudad del Cusco no cuanta con fábricas D. ropas, juguetes, y otros estos miembros del grupo son comerciantes que traen mercadería D. diferentes partes del país, por ejemplo del norte del país traen zapatos, D. la capital ropa y juguetes, del sur del país materiales D. construcción. Nuestros socios trabajan en el centro comercial D. confraternidad, ellos son comerciantes minoristas; los socios solicitan el préstamo D. dinero para poder viajar a traer mayor número D. mercadería para implementar sus stands.

Nuestros socios agradecen la oportunidad brindada y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Urpis D. Confraternidad Communal Bank. Most of our members resiD. in the city of Cusco, and they are from different departments in Perú. The city of Cusco does not have clothing or toy factories, and some members of the group are merchants who bring their merchandise from other parts of the country. For example, they bring shoes from the northern part of the country, clothes and toys from the capital, and construction materials from the south of the country. Our members work at the collective shopping center, and they are merchants with small businesses. The members are asking for a loan to be able to travel to bring a larger amount of merchandise to stock their stands. Our members are grateful for the opportunity, and they value the loan. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to stock their stands

loans.name: Janette Elissa

texts.es: Janette es madre casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo el mayor que  cursa el 5 año de secundaria y el menor de 5 años que cursa el primer grado. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos y piñatas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad, sus inicios se dan porque su mama se dedicaba anteriormente a este medio de vida, por lo que ella fue aprendiendo poco a poco a realizar cada una de las destrezas  para la elaboración de sus productos ya que no fue muy fácil porque anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero esto le generaba muy pocos ingresos mas tarde decide continuar con el negocio de su Mama que le favorecía mucho mas ingresos para su familia. Actualmente ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, papeles, bordados, tijeras, cintas, globos
texts.en:
Janette is married and is a mother caring for two children. Her older son is in the last year of high school and her younger son is 5 and is in first grade. Janette works making and selling decorations and piñatas. She's been in this line of work for more than 3 years. She began because her mother had previously done the same sort of work, so little by little she learned the techniques needed to make her products. It wasn't easy because previously Janette had worked selling cosmetics. However, that business generated very little money and so she then decided to continue with her mother's line of business. This provides a much better income for her family. She is currently asking for a loan for working capital in order to buy fabric, paper, embroidery, scissors, ribbons and balloons.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy fabric, paper, embroidery, scissors, ribbons and balloons.

loans.name: Egalasse

texts.fr: Egalasse S. est une dame de 64 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle commercialise des produits halieutiques et du haricot. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de contribuer à la prise en charge sanitaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Egalasse S., age 54, is married and the mother of 8 children. She sells sea products and beans. Her goal is to improve the standard of living of her family, and to help support its healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell sea products and beans

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
el sr. Raul R. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su casa de habitacion esta ubicada en la colonia 17 septimbre, vive en union libre y no tiene dependientes.
se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que posee desde hace unos 12 años en donde vende jabon, frescos, maiz, churros, pasta dental, papel higienico y todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar
 
esta solicitando el crédito para comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta para cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
Raul es un sr. de edad y esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, este credito lo necesita para salir adelante con su compañera de hogar y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
su sueño es tener un negocio grande en la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Raul R. is 56 years old and lives in the city of San Lorenzo. His home is located in the September 17th neighborhood. He is in a common law marriage and has no dependents.

Raul sells popular consumer products. Twelve years ago, he opened his store where he sells soap, soft drinks, corn, churros (fried pastries similar to doughnuts), toothpaste, toilet paper, and other basic household products.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that he can continue to meet the needs of his customers. Raul is an older gentleman and this is his only source of income. This loan is needed so that he and his wife can continue to support themselves and have a better quality of life. His dream is to have a bigger business in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rumichaka Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rumichaka, inicia su sexto ciclo con 17 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Jesús Nazareno que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Rumichaka es un pequeño valle.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, frutas, ropa, animales menores, repuestos, y la mayor parte a la agricultura D. verduras.

Como es el caso D. la señora Maria que es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.

Mientras que Elizabeth es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras, además se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como cuy y gallina que venD. en los recreos y mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 11,350 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. cuy, semillas, abono, ropa, frutas, azúcar, arroz, carnes y para el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, mejorar su casa, tener capital propio.
texts.en:
The Rumichaka Communal Bank is staring its sixth loan cycle with 17 members. They are from the Jesus of Nazareth District, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Rumichaka is a small valley.

The members have different businesses selling food, fruit, clothing, small animals, and spare parts. The majority of them grow vegetables.

One example is Sra. Maria who is 42 years old, married, and has seven children. Maria and her husband grow vegetables and then sell them at the local farmer’s market.

Elizabeth is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She grows vegetables and also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which are sold at the fairs and markets in Ayacucho.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles. The entire Communal Bank will receive a total of 11,350 soles in loans. The money will be used to buy guinea pigs, seeds, compost, clothing, fruit, sugar, rice, and meat. Some of the money will be used to pay workers’ salaries.

The members have dreams of seeing their children finish their education, making home improvements, and building up their own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their various businesses

loans.name: Llesica

texts.es:
LLesica, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 34 años, Es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de su motocarro y a la venta de prendas de vestir, ambas actividades las realiza desde su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es enfermero de profesión. LLesica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Sabias”, desde hace un año.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de lencería.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 300 soles, que será nuevamente utilizado en la compra de lencería. La meta de LLesica es tener una tienda de ropa bien surtida.
texts.en:
Llesica is a dynamic woman who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children. She rents out a motorcycle taxi and also sells clothing. Llesica manages both businesses from home and has the support of her husband, who works as a nurse. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Sabias” (The Wise Women) for one year.

The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy lingerie. She is now a requesting another loan of 300 soles in order to purchase more lingerie. Llesica’s goal is to have her own clothing store that is well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie K. est marié, 59 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient une boutique où elle vend divers denrées alimentaires comme sucre, riz, huile. Elle compte améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille avec les revenus générés par son activité mais aussi faire face à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie K., age 59, is married and the mother of five children. She runs a shop where she sells food staples, such as sugar, rice, and oil. She intends to use her profits to improve the standard of living of her family, and to pay for her children's school expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retail food staples such as sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es: Maura Rosa tiene 48 años de edad, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercaderia en general, este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha solicitado, por lo que han sido experiencias diferentes y muy importantes, ella disfruta mucho de conversar con sus clientes y así ofrecerles lo que necesitan y le solicitan. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es poder continuar trabajando a pesar de las dificultades de salud que ella presenta.
texts.en:
Maura Rosa is 48 years old and sells general merchandise. This is not the first loan that she has requested. She has taken out loans on a number of occasions and they have been very important to her.

Maura enjoys talking with her customers and providing them with what they need. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials. Her desire is to continue working despite suffering from health problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jorge Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Roberto B. E. es originario de san Juan de Limay comunidad de tranquera se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de  tres novillos de engorde su negocio comenzó con la siembra de sorgo y maíz trabajando con su papa luego se dedico a comprar toretes para engorde que es una de las principales actividades a las que se dedica por ahora. 

 Roberto a trabajado en este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años trabaja todos los días además todavía se dedica la siembra de sorgo y maíz en época de invierno el cual le genera mas ingresos para comprar animales, el espera que con e crédito le vaya muy bien para seguir trabajando. Jorge es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad ambos están estudiando primaria sus pedrés viven en una casa aledaña a la de el  cual se mantiene al pendiente de ellos.

Este es el segundo crédito que se le otorga en un periodo de dos años. Don Jorge expresa que le a ido muy bien con el crédito y piensa obtener mayores ganancias con este que se le otorgo para seguir creciendo y poder darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos a través del estudio y de esta forma tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Roberto B. E. is a native of the gated community of San Juan de Limay. He was granted a loan in order to purchase three steers for fattening. He started his business planting sorghum and corn and worked with his father. Later he decided to buy bulls for fattening, which is one of the businesses he now operates.

Jorge has worked in this business every day for over the past ten years. He still spends time planting sorghum and corn during the winter season in order to generate income to buy more animals. He hopes his loan will be invested well so that he can continue working. Jorge is married and has two young children who are in elementary school. He parents live in the house next door so that he can continue to look after them.

This is the second loan he has received within the past two years. Don Jorge says his experience with his previous loan went very well and was able to generate better earnings. It enabled him to continue growing and provide a better life for his children through their education. Likewise, he was able to provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steers for fattening

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desD. hace 3 años, vive en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, provincia D. El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos, todos independientes. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne.

Aurora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar carne al por mayor.

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne D. porcino, alpaca y ovino.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas y  hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for the past three years. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Aurora is 60 years old, married, and has five children who are all independent. She has an elementary school education and operates a business buying and selling meat.

Aurora says her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital for buying meat in bulk. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3000 soles in order to buy various types of meat such as pork, alpaca, and mutton. Her dreams for the future are to increase her sales and grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the training courses provided by her loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different meats

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
la señora Gladys F. C. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y se dedica a la compra y venta de refrescos en varios tamaños, agua en bolsa y botes. 
los fines de semana elabora golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas, tortilla con quesillo que son un platillo tipico de esa zona. 
 
Gladys tiene 04 hijos,  dos de ellos estan viviendo en los estados unidos y 02 en honduras.
sus hijos le ayudan economicamente con algunos gastos del hogar.
 
desea el credito para invertir en su negocio, comprar mas refrescos y agua ya que los carros repartidores de estos productos solo pasan una vez por semana y a veces se queda sin vender por no tener refrescos.
texts.en:
Gladys F. C. is 48 years old and a single mother. She buys and sells soft drinks in various sizes, as well as water in bottles and containers. On the weekends, she prepares snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, plantain chips, and tortillas with cheese, which are traditional dishes of the area.

Gladys has four children. Two of them live in the United States and the other two are in Honduras. They help her financially with some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Gladys plans to buy soft drinks and water. The distribution trucks pass through her area once a week and sometimes she runs out of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaye

texts.fr: Yaye S. est une dame de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour s’activer dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires au marché. Les revenus qu’elle aura lui permettront d’assurer à sa famille la nourriture, le scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
Yaye S., age 54, is married and the mother of eight children. She would like to use this loan to sell food products at the market. Her income will enable her to provide for her family's food, schooling, and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food products at the market

loans.name: Olga Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desD. hace 10 años, vive en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, provincia D. El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa,  se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne.

Olga nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar carne D. ovino.

Ahora ella solicitará un nuevo crédito  D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne D.: avino, alpaca, porcino y res.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su emporio en Tacna y obtener su capital propio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las facilidades para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga has been a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank for ten years. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 59 years old, married, and has four children. She has an elementary school education and operates a business buying and selling meat.

Olga says her first loan from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy sheep. Now she is requesting a new loan of 1000 soles to buy a variety of meats such as poultry, alpaca, pork, and beef. Her dream for the future is to open an emporium in Tacna and build up her own capital.

What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings account and the ease of obtaining credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of meats

loans.name: G.s. Alisson Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Alisson esta conformado por Julio Ramón y Carlos ambos son jóvenes muy trabajadores y que disfrutan mucho de sus actividades económicas como es la venta de artesanías. Julio inicio este negocio como una fuente de ingresos necesaria el tiene 1 hijo a su cargo por lo que actualmente ha sido muy difícil encontrar un lugar estable para trabajar por lo que decide buscar un medio de vida con la ayuda de su compañero Carlos deciden realizar un financiamiento para la compra de sus productos ya que tienen que viajar a los diferentes departamentos como Managua, esteli, jinotepe, nandaime y además ofrecerlos  por lo que es algo muy cansado, pero la recompensa que ambos obtienen cuando vuelven a sus hogares y se sienten muy feliz por lograr proporcionar aportes económicos para su hogar. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo como floreros, vasos, vestidos típicos, camisetas, cuadro entre otros productos. El sueño de ambos es obtener su propio medio de transporte para viajar a los diferentes lugares.
texts.en:
The Alisson communal bank is comprised of Julio Ramón and Carlos. Both of these young men are very hard-working. They really enjoy their business activity, selling handicrafts. Julio started this business as a source of necessary income. He is raising one child. It was very difficult to find a stable place to work, so he decided to look for the means to earn a living with help from his colleague, Carlos. They decided to ask for a loan to buy their products because they have to travel to different departments like Managua, Estelí, Jinotepe, and Nandaime. They also sell them, which is tiring. But, the recompense they both get when they return to their homes makes them feel very happy that they are able to support their homes. The loan they are requesting is for working capital to buy vases, glasses, typical dresses, t-shirts, and paintings among other products. The dream they both have is to get their own means of transportation to travel to the different places.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Joel lives with his common-law wife and 3 year old child in Patria.  Though he is only in his early 20s, his communal bank has chosen him as their president.

Joel works as a woodcutter in the forests around Patria.  The area where he finds the best quality wood is located some distance from town so Joel often spends several days in the forest with his two business partners: his brother and his friend.  Joel is requesting a loan to pay for gas, a truck and day laborers to help bring wood he has chopped to market, where it will be sold largely to furniture-makers.

Joel appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Day laborers and transport to bring wood to market

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 12 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa,  se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible.

Angélica nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar kerosén (combustible).

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar gasolina y asi aumentar su capital.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un grifo en Mazocruz.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad que existe en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ms. Angélica has been a member of the Communal Bank “Generación 2000” for 12 years. She lives in the Santa Rosa district, El Collao province and Puno department. She is 29 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and she has 03 children. She completed her secondary school studies. She works buying and selling fuel. Angélica tells us that with her first loan requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she could buy kerosene (fuel). She is requesting a new loan of S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy gasoline, and then increase her capital. Her dream for the future is to have fuel filling station in Mazocruz. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the punctuality of the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gasoline

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO”; los socios provienen en su mayoría D. diferentes provincias D. L. ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos viajan a diferentes provincias del Perú a traer ropa, juguetes, zapatos, materiales D. construcción en L. modalidad ferretería y otras novedades que debido a L. geografía D. L. ciudad del Cusco no se encuentran, nuestros socios pertenecen al centro trinitarias, son centros D. comercio y expendio D. ropa a bajo costo y D. toda calidad, Los socios solicitan el préstamo D. dinero para así viajar y traer mayor número D. mercadería para implementar sus stands.

Nuestros socios agradecen L. oportunidad brindada y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Juntos Para el Progreso Communal Bank. Most of the members are from the different provinces of the city of Cusco. Our members alternate their activities between the home and their small businesses. They travel to different provinces in Perú to bring clothes, toys, shoes, hardware, and other items, which due to the geography of the city of Cusco, cannot be found there. Our members belong to the Trinitarian Centers, which are business centers that sell quality clothes at low cost. The members are asking for the loan to be able to travel to get a greater amount of merchandise to stock their stands. Our members are grateful for and value the loan. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater amount of merchandise to stock their stands

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, es una mujer muy responsable y puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien posee un negocio independiente. Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de venta de bebidas refrescantes.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que utilizará en la compra de bebidas refrescantes como néctares, refrescos, gaseosas, yogurt, etc. La meta de Lastenia es seguir adelante en su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a very responsible and punctual woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 44 years old, has two adult children, and sells refreshing beverages from her home. Her husband, who has his own business, supports her in her work. Lastenia has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for three years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in her beverage business. She now needs 2500 soles that will be used to buy refreshing beverages like: fruit nectars, beverages, soft-drinks, yoghurt, etc. Lastenia's goal is to continue in her work and to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages like: fruit juices, soft-drinks, sodas, yoghurt, etc.

loans.name: Alba Agustina

texts.es: Alba tiene 40 años, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio que nace con la enseñanza  quien inicio este negocio y decidió hincar su propia actividad económica en su vivienda por lo que juntos emprendieron este medio de vida, ya que le instruyo a su esposa para que le ayudara a pintar y realizara la elaboración de los diseños, por lo que han trabajado juntos para aportar en lo necesario en su familia es así que su esposa se encarga de empezar a ofrecer sus productos en su humilde vivienda y también venderlos de manera ambulante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de yeso, pintura, ciner, brochas, pinceles entre otros productos que son necesarios para la elaboración de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Alba is 40 years old, and dedicated to selling artisan crafts. She has done this for more than 18 years. Alba began soon after learning the skill, and began this economic activity in her own home. Alba and her husband made a living together in this manner, after she taught him to help her paint and elaborate the designs. They have worked together to achieve what's necessary for their family. She is in charge of selling the products, both in their humble home and on the streets. The financing she solicits is to buy plaster, paint, ash, and artist's and painter's brushes, among other products, which are necessary for the elaboration of the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS TO MAKE ARTISAN CRAFTS TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Pérez de 65 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento, es divorciada hace 12 años con su ex cónyuge tiene 6 hijos de 47 años, 44 años, 42 años, 37 años, 32 años, 25 años todos ya casados y trabajando.

María comenzó con la ayuda de una de sus vecinas la que le enseño todo con respecto a costura. Ahora ella trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando camisas, sacos, pantalones, blusas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades que tiene es la inseguridad de su sector.

El préstamo lo quiere para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en el futuro quiere tener ya un negocio bien establecido con sus propios modelos de ropa para poder hacer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Maria P. is 65 years old, and lives in semi-urban zone in the perimeter of Guayaquil. Her home is made of concrete. Maria got divorced 12 years ago; she has 6 children with her ex-husband, ages 47, 44, 42, 37, 32, and 25 years old. Each is married and working. With the help of her neighbors, Maria started to learn everything she could about sewing. Now she works at home everyday, making shirts, jackets, pants, blouses and so on. One of the biggest challenges Maria faces is the insecurity of her industry. Maria is seeking a loan to improve her home; in the future, Maria wants to have well-established business in her home, with her own line of clothing to sell as a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
la señora Trinidad F. C. tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Tiene un negocio en una parada de buses que van hacia Coyolito.
En su negocio vende refrescos y huevos. a los turistas que viajan para esa zona paran a comprar refrescos. 
 
Trinidad esta solicitando el crédito para comprar mas refrescos y tener un buen invetario ya que los fines de semana vende bastante, Coyolito es el lugar en donde se sale para ir a Amapala.
 
Trinidad es una sra. muy amable y ella desea que este nuevo año  traiga consigo paz, amor y esperanza a todos los habitantes del mundo.
texts.en:
Ms. Trinidad F. C. is 58 years old, and single with 2 dependent children. She has a small business nearby the bus stop for buses heading to Coyolito. In her business, Trinidad sells soft drinks and eggs to the tourists who pass through. Trinidad is seeking a loan in order to buy more soft drinks and increase her inventory, as she sells quite a bit on the weekends. Coyolito is the place from which people travel to Amapala. Trinidad is a very friendly woman, and hopes that this new year brings peace, love, and hope to everyone across the world.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aidalina De Mercedes

texts.es:
El señora Aidaliana De Mercedes M. calderón es originaria del municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí su principal actividad de trabajo es el comercio ella tiene una pulpería donde los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en su finca además se dedica a actividades ganaderas como compra venta de ganado.

Doña Aidalina utilizara el crédito para la retención de novillos de engorde desea retener sus novillos para buscar una mejor ganancia en ellos y poder venderlos de pesa, su negocio comenzó vendiendo comida en un restaurante con su mama luego se dedico a poner una pulpería y rento el local donde tenia su restaurante hoy en día dice que compro una pequeña finca con ayuda de sus hijos y su esfuerzo propio donde también se dedica a compra venta de ganado dice que ella siempre a trabajado con crédito y que lo que tiene es gracia a ello por lo que piensa que con este crédito le baya muy bien.

Aidalina es una madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos tres mayores de edad y una menor que es la que depende de ella el cual entrara a la universidad este año dos mil diez. Este es el tercer crédito que Aidalina tiene con ceprodel en un periodo de dos años y medio expreso que con los créditos que se le han dado en ceprodel a obtenido buenas ganancias ya que a invertido en su negocio y su finca además platea que piensa seguir trabajando con ceprodel porque ella se a superado a través del crédito y esta muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aidaliana De Mercedes M. Calderón comes from the San Juan de Limay municipality in the administrative district of Estelí. Her main job is in business; she owns a small store and invests the income she earns into her farm. She also sells cattle. Doña Aidalina will use the loan to keep young bulls for fattening. She wants to keep the young bulls in order to obtain a better price for them and to be able to sell them at a good weight. She started her business by selling food in a restaurant with her mother. Later she began to set up her little store and rent out the location where she had her restaurant. Today she tells us that she has bought a small farm where, with the help of her children and with her own efforts, she will also sell cows. She tells us that she has always worked with credit and that she is thankful for it because she believes that with this loan she will do very well. Aidalina is a single mother with four adult children and one younger child who is still dependant on her. Her youngest will start university this year, 2010. This is the third loan that Aidaline has with Ceprodel over a period of two and a half years. With the loans obtained through Ceprodel she has earned good profits as she has invested in her business and her farm. She is planning to continue working with Ceprodel because the loans have brought her success and for that she is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 young bulls for fattening

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Modesto is married and has five children, the youngest of which still lives at home and attends high school in Patria.

Modesto works as a carpenter in Patria.  He specializes in making and installing doors and windows and he also makes some furniture out of his workshop in his home.  Modesto’s business has been growing over the past 3 years and he is requesting a loan to buy additional wood and materials to expand his business.

Modesto appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Wood and other construction materials

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
Exilda, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de un hijo (menor de edad) ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y abarrotes, esta actividad la realiza en el mercadillo de la Hoyada, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la misma actividad. Exilda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de Ucayali”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de verduras.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será invertido en la compra y posterior venta de abarrotes y verduras.La meta de Exilda es tener su tienda propia y surtir el negocio de abarrotes en general para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Exilda, 29, is a very punctual woman who lives in the Manantay district, Ucayali region. She has one minor son and she sells vegetables and groceries in the Hoyada market. Her husband, who is in the same line of work, supports her work endeavors. Exilda has been a member of the "Las Brisas de Ucayali" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy vegetables. She now needs 1200 soles to buy groceries and vegetables to sell. Exilda's goal is to have her own, well-stocked, grocery store in order to have higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and vegetables.

loans.name: Gaudecia

texts.es:
Gaudencia tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso que adquiere por sacos en la ciudad capital. Para ello, viaja a Lima cada 15 días y en algunas ocasiones envía por encomienda su mercadería. Sus mejores ventas se dan en épocas de feria comercial y en las festividades de las zonas rurales de su localidad.
En sus momentos libre, su esposo y su hija mayor la ayudan en el transporte de su mercadería, para Gaudecia este trabajo le ha permitido tener las ganancias necesarias para apoyar la economía de su familia, sumando a la remuneración por el trabajo que realiza su esposo.
Para el futuro, ella desea tener un puesto más estable donde tenga mayor comodidad e incremente sus ventas.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está contenta de tener un impulso en su capital para mejorara su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gaudencia is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. For the last 12 years she has devoted herself to selling second hand clothes that she acquires from the capital city. To get the bags of clothing, she travels to Lima every 15 days and on some occasions she has her merchandise sent to her. Her best sales take place during commercial markets and during festivals in rural areas of her locality. In their spare time, her husband and her oldest daughter help transport the merchandise. For Gaudecia, this work has allowed her to have the necessary earnings to support her family, and adds to the money her husband. For the future, she wishes to have a more permanent stall where she can conduct her sales more comfortably and with higher frequency. This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP and is happy to have a boost in her capital to improve her business. With the money, she will buy more clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Lux Estela

texts.es:
la señora Lux Estela L. M. tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa de la mama, tiene una hija que depende de ella y la tiene estudiando.
Lux tiene un negocio de pulperia que tiene 10 años, ahi vende maiz, arroz, frijoles, harina de maiz, manteca, aceite y varios productos de consumo popular.
Lux esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio, desea tener mayor inventario de productos ya que en el lugar en donde tiene su negocio solo llegan una vez por semana los vendedores y ahorita no tiene mucho capital para comprarles mercaderia, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito...
Su deseo es que dios reine en los corazones de todos los habitantes de Honduras.
texts.en:
Ms. Lux Estela L. M. is 43 years old, is a single mother and lives in her mother’s house. She has a daughter who depends on her, who is studying. Lux has a grocery store business that she’s had for 10 years. There she sells corn, rice, beans, corn flour, butter, oil and other popular consumer products. Lux is requesting a loan in order to stock her business. She wishes to have a greater inventory of products in the place where she has her business. The venders only come once a week and right now she doesn’t have much capital to buy merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting the loan... Her wish is that God reigns in the hearts of all of the inhabitants of Honduras

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, razors, toilet paper, tooth paste, powdered soap, sugar, rice, beans, tortillas, margarine, butter, oil, eggs, bread, cookies, churros, soft drinks, canned juices, dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandra Lucia

texts.es: Sandra tiene 34 años, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que actualmente no tenía un trabajo para mantener a su familia. Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, cuando inicio no tenia el capital suficiente y además no tenia la mercadería suficiente para  ofrecer solamente tenia pinturas de uñas, base, pinturas de labios, por que tenia muy pocos clientes. Pero con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado para interactuar con sus clientes ya que antes no tenía esas habilidades por su poca experiencia pero ella ha logrado mejorar lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, pinturas de labios y base. Su deseo es obtener  ingresos para  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34 years old and has been involved with her business of selling cosmetics for more than five years because did not have a job to support her family at the time. When she began, she did not have the sufficient funds and, in addition, she did not have sufficient merchandise to sell. She only had nail polish, foundation, lipstick to begin, because she had very few customers. However, with time, she has improved her interaction with her customers. She did not previously have those skills because of lack of experience, but she has been able to improve them as necessary. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of perfume, cream, cologne, lipstick, and foundation. Her wish is to obtain income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sr. Mercedes M. T. se dedica a  la elaboración de ladrillos de barro para construcción de estructuras como casa de habitación, etc. El solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el cual será utilizado para la compra de un zinc.

El Sr. Mercedes M. T. empezó a dedicarse a esta labor desde hace 6 años y hasta entonces ha seguido con la elaboración de este producto el cual es de muy buena demanda en estas zonas, el trabaja desde las 7 am hasta las 12 del medio día ya que es el tiempo estimado que el dilata en producir un estimado de producción diaria que a el le piden. Este cliente antes de dedicarse a esta labor trabajaba en la agricultura.
