El Sr. Mercedes M. T.   espera mejorar las condiciones físicas de su casa con la compra del zinc una vez otorgado el crédito, ya que su techo esta bastante deteriorado.

El Sr. Mercedes M. T.   es casado y tiene 2 hijas una de ellas en edad escolar a la que le costea los estudios.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que el Sr. Mercedes M. T.  tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años. Mercedes M. T.  expresa que con los financiamientos de Ceprodel el a podido llevar a cabo varios proyectos familiares que de manera propia no los habría podido logra como es la compra del zinc para la reparación del techo ya que les brindara mejor seguridad a el y su familia antes los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. T. has a business making clay bricks for the construction of structures such as houses, etc. He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL that will be used to purchase corrugated metal sheeting. Mr. T. began this line of work 6 years ago, and since then he has continued to make this product, which is in high demand in these areas. He works from 7am until noon, since this is the estimated time that it takes to make up the daily orders. Prior to this, he worked in agriculture. Mr. T. hopes to improve the physical condition of his house with the purchase of corrugated metal roofing materials, since the roof of his house is quite deteriorated. Mr. T. is married and has 2 daughters, one whom is school-aged, and he must pay for her studies. This is the 4th loan that Mr. T. has taken with CEPRODEL over a period of 5 years. He says that with the financings from CEPRODEL he has been able to bring about various family projects on his own that he never would have been able to manage, like the purchase of metal roofing materials for the repair of his roof, which will provide better security for his family before the rainy season comes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated metal roofing material)

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Avelina lives with her husband and children in a home on the outskirts of Patria.

Avelina dedicates her time to the raising of cuy (guinea pigs), which are a delicacy in Peru.  She started her business last year and it was not easy – no one in her town had successfully raised cuy in the hot and humid weather before (cuy are typically raised in the Andes, where it is much cooler and drier).  She succeeded by building special cages to control humidity, carefully choosing and breeding cuys that can endure the tropical climate and by growing various types of grasses on her land to give her cuys a balanced diet (she uses the cuys’ droppings as fertilizer for her garden).  Avelina now wants to borrow funds to improve her project – she wants to build more cages to raise more cuy. Her daughter helps her with the animals but Avelina is also searching for responsible business partners in Patria to really expand the business.

Avelina appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buy materials to construct cages for cuys

loans.name: María Cornelia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Cornelia G. H. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz a los pobladores aledaños a su vivienda en la zona urbana de Condega. 

La Sra. María G. H. solicita el crédito ara la compra de materia prima para la elaboración artesanal de tortillas 

Este negocio empieza con la necesidad de aumentar los ingresos familiares desde hace unos 8 años y ha tenido muy buena demanda por los consumidores debido a la calidad e higiene del producto y dicho negocio a ido creciendo debido al aumento de la demanda, La Sra. María G. H. se dedicaba a las labores de su hogar antes de dedicare a este negocio.

La Sra. María G. H. espera que con el financiamiento que Ceprodel le brinde compras mas materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas y así satisfacer la demande existente y seguir siempre con dicho negocio. 
María G. H. es viuda y tiene 4 hijos quien son totalmente independiente y solo una hija vive con ella la que le ayuda también en dicho negocio.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que ella tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 2 años, dichos créditos le han contribuido positivamente en el crecimiento de su negocio y así poder obtener buenos ingresos los que de alguna manera le han ayudado a mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
María Cornelia G. H. makes corn tortillas and sells them to the residents who live near her home in the urban area of Condega. She is requesting a loan to purchase the raw materials that she uses in producing her hand-made tortillas. She started this business 8 years ago as she needed to increase her family's income. She has had very good demand from consumers due to the quality of her products and the hygiene she uses in their production; this business has been growing due to the increase in demand. Mrs. Hernandez completes her household tasks in addition to working on this business. Mrs. Hernandez hopes that this loan from CEPRODEL will allow her to buy more raw materials for the production of tortillas and in this way satisfy the existing demand so that she can continue with this business. Mrs. Hernandez is a widow and has 4 children who are totally independent; only one daughter lives with her and she helps her with the business. This is her 4th loan with CEPRODEL over a period of 2 years. These loans have contributed positively to the growth of her business, and have allowed her to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material such as corn and firewood

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
el señor Margarito A. C. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en union libre y depende de el una niña de un mes de nacida,  su compañera de hogar le ayuda en la pulperia mientras el trabaja por las noches en una propiedad como vigilante.

Margarito esta solicitando el crédito para surtir un poco mas su negocio, ya que de este negocio y con lo que le pagan como vigilante logra cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y de su hija recien nacida.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante a su familia. 
Margarito es una persona honesta y con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, dice que quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito A. C. is 31 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and he has a one month old baby girl. His household partner helps in the grocery story while he works as a security guard for a property at night. Margarito is requesting the loan to stock up his business a little more. Since with this business and what he earns as a security guard, he manages to cover all of his household expenses and the expenses of his recently born daughter. He needs the loan so that he can make progress for his family. Margarito is an honest person and he is very eager to work and move ahead. He says he wants to give his daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, churros, candy, instant soups, condiments, corn flour, rice, sugar,  flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Arnulfo

texts.es: Luís tiene 42 años de edad, este hombre ha trabajado fuertemente para proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de molino, por lo que ha sido satisfactorio para el pues su único hijo ha logrado apreciar el gran esfuerzo que hace para proporcionarle estudios y lo mas necesario. Hace mas de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio cundo fue por cuenta propia que fue muy difícil porque no tenia el capital suficiente, pero esto no permitió que el desistiera de seguir luchando ya que recurrió a diferentes lugares como Fundación León 2000 que le brindo la ayuda necesaria. El financiamiento será utilizado para proporcionarle mantenimiento a los molinos y así brindar un buen servicio. El deseo de Luís es continuar apoyando a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. This man has worked hard in order to provide his family with their daily bread. He provides grain mill services, which has been a fulfilling job since his only son appreciates the efforts he makes to provide him with the necessities and an education. He has been in business for over 21 years. He launched this business on his own account, which was very difficult because he did not have enough capital. However, this did not cause him to give up struggling, so he sought help from places like Fundación León 2000, which gave him the necessary aid. He will use this loan for grain mill maintenance, thus providing better service. Luis’ wish is to continue supporting his son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.en:
Eufracio is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Eufracio, 60 years old, lives with his common-law wife in a home in Patria near his children and many of his grandchildren.

Eufracio is a meat distributor.  He learned his trade providing meat to the Peruvian army for many years in Quillabamba in his youth.  He has been living in Patria for 30 years and distributes meat mainly to local restaurants.  Eufracio is requesting a loan to buy livestock and a meat cutter so that he can improve and expand his business.  He hopes to increase his income to be better able to provide for his large family.

Eufracio appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Eufracion is pictured with some of his grandchildren.

loans.use: Buy livestock and a meat cutter

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Julia R. tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, y ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y le ayuda con la comida y otros gastos.
Maria tiene una pulperia en donde vende pollo, menudo, mantequilla, queso, jugos, frescos etc. esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio debido a la epoca de navidad vendio muchas cosas y ahora necesita surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias que le dejaron las ventas las ocupo para hcaer unos arreglos en su casa de habitacion.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Julia R. is a 45-year-old married mother with children who are no longer dependent. Her husband is a fisherman who helps her with food and other living expenses.

Maria has a general store in which she sells chicken, tripe, butter, cheese, juice, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to restock her shop because during the Christmas season, she sold many of her products and now needs to increase her inventory. She used the profits for home improvements. She needs this loan in order to help her business move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, lard, cooking oil, soap, soup, pasta, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Eufracio, 42 years old, lives with his common-law wife and five children in a home in Patria.

Eduardo is a farmer.  He has several small plots of land around Patria (some are located a couple of hours walking distance from his home) where he grows pineapples, yucca, rice and coca.  Eduardo is requesting a loan to hire day laborers to help him with his harvests and with bringing his produce to market.  He hopes that with the income he earns this year, he will be able to put a roof over his home and finish its partly-built second level.  

Eduardo appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help with harvesting and bringing produce to market

loans.name: Ndi

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Ndi J. F. is married to Taku Michael, and has five children.   She is a hard working woman. She says being a mother of five is more difficult than being a spinster. Upon the death of her supportive parents, she has had to start doing some of those things her parents always did with her husband, which she took for granted. Challenged by these realities, she has doubled her efforts towards meeting the needs of her children. This made her join GHAPE. 
With this loan, she plans to expand her business and use the profit to pay school fees for her children. Her community stands a chance of benefiting from her activities as she will have to provide them with necessary food items. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: purchase of chicks, feed and firewood

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Oscar, 41 years old, lives with his common-law wife and three children in Patria.

Oscar dedicates his time to his trucking business.  He owns a truck which he uses to pick up produce from farmers and wood from loggers which he then transports and delivers in town.  Oscar sometimes delivers cargo and sometimes buys the supplies directly from the farmers or loggers which he then transports and sells at market.  When he travels to Cusco, he also brings back fuel which he sells in the neighboring communities of Patria and Pilcopata.  Oscar is requesting a loan to buy wood and fuel to deliver and sell in Patria.  He hopes to increase his earnings to be better able to provide for his family.  

Oscar appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy wood and fuel to sell in Patria and neighboring communities

loans.name: Mbah

texts.en:
H. was born on  May 25, 1964. She is a widow who is blessed with four kids, none below 15 years of age  Being a hard working lady, she has faced so many challenges in life including being a widow at a young age, ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in 2008. In this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS and the repayment was done promptly. With a loan of 150,0000FRS, she plans to buy palm oil, water fufu and eru (a popular Cameroonian dish) and cultivate a small yam farm. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long period of time. She has a good location for that particular business. And she has a lot of customers.
Her neighbors are happy her business is right beside them, because they don't have to go to the market and they can buy from her late at night. She plans to use the profit to plough back into the business, cater for her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her son. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers and the comfortable repayment method. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy and sell palm oil, water fufu, and eru

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria S. es madre soltera y tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad, y le quiere dar lo mejor.
Es solicitando un crédito para empezar un negocio de novedades (bolsas para dama, cintos, cartera), ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para el inicio del un negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Maria S. is a single mother with one daughter under her care, and she wants to give her the best. She is requesting a loan in order to launch a small business (selling handbags, belts and wallets) since she does not have the money necessary to start a business at this time. She plans to repay her loan using a portion of the income that she earns as a security guard for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to launch a business

loans.name: Ngang J

texts.en:
Rose was born 08/07/1966. She is married to Angoudu Emmanuel and has three kids below 15 years of age. Being a hard working lady, she has faced so many challenges in life including ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in the year 2008.I n this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS, and the repayment was done promptly. 
         With a loan of 200,0000FRS, she plans to buy seven tins of corn, five tins of beans, 4 tins of garri, and 5 buckets of cocoyams. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long  time. She has a good location for her business and she has a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy the business is located next door because they don't have to go far to the market and can buy from her late at night. She plans to use the profits to plough back into the business, cater for her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her children. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers and the convenient method of repayment.
             The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy and sell corn, beans, garri, and cocoyams.

loans.name: Reyna Estela

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Estela G. es madre de familia, tiene dos hijos de mediana edad que actual mente están estudiando.
Con dos crédito anteriores de FVP ha construido dos cuartos pero le falta construir un baño. Tiene el proyecto de construir de material ya que es más seguro y duradero. 
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlos con una parte de los ingresos de su esposo que trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de camión de carga. 
Su dedeo es que sus hijos tengan bien acondicionada la casa y este cómodos donde vive.
texts.en:
Ms. Reyna Estela G. is a middle-aged mother whose children are currently in school.

With two previous loans from FVP, she has been able to build two rooms, but she still needs to build a bathroom. She plans on using sturdy and durable material for construction.

She is requesting this loan for construction and plans to pay it back with some of her husband’s income since he works for a transport company as a truck driver.

Her wish is that her children have a well-equipped and comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Waji

texts.en: C. was born in 1958, and is happily married with six children, of whom none is below 15 years of age. Being a very hardworking woman with a large family, she has faced some challenges in life such as ill health, poor harvests and school dropouts because of inadequate finances when she is not able to pay her children’s school fees. In 2001, because of all these challenges, C. saw GHAPE as a source of relief. In that same year C. received her first loan and has received seven other loans since for which repayments were made promptly. With the loan of 200,000 FRS, she plans to buy firewood for 70,000 FRS, wood for timber for 80,000FRS, and pay for transportation of the wood and timber costing 50,000 FRS. C. will start repayment from the fourth month after the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because she has experience in the business and has a ready market for the goods. Because of the progress of the business she plans to use the profit to pay school fees for her children, give good medical attention to her family, and also provide good food. C. prefers to receive her loans from GHAPE as opposed to other organizations because she is a member of GHAPE and also, GHAPE has taught her how to manage the loan and the method of repayment is comfortable. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy firewood and timber for her business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 24 años, es una joven muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Julia de 54 años y su hermano Edgar de 28 años, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Ella tiene un stand de ropa y zapatos muy bonito en una de las galerías más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde con muchas ganas y alegría ofrece a sus clientas los hermosos vestidos que vende. Todos los fines de semana viaja rumbo a la ciudad de Tacna (sur del país) para comprar los modelos más novedosos y llamativos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre el vestido que mejor le quedará, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su stand sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Claudia con MFP y está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más vestidos nuevos para implementar mejor su stand.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 24-year-old woman who is sincere and very hard-working. She lives in her own home with her 54-year-old mother named Julia and her 28-year-old brother named Edgar. What she most wants is to excel in life.

She owns a nice clothing and shoe stand in one of the most important shopping malls in Juliaca, where she eagerly and cheerfully sells lovely outfits to her customers. Every weekend, she travels to Tacna (in the southern part of the country) to purchase the most innovative and eye-catching designs.

What she likes most about her job is being able to advise her customers on which dress looks best on them. She has been in business for 4 years and considers the most difficult aspect of her job to be having to stay in her stand all day long without being able to go out.

Over time, she hopes that her business will grow and that it will yield bigger profits.

This is Claudia’s first loan with MFP, and she is determined make her payments on time because she would like to request more loans in the future. She is a very active member who gets along well with other members of her communal bank. With this 500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more clothing to restock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Buena Vista es residente en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres miembros que siempre han trabajado juntos, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Carlos Antonio N. tiene 29 años de edad y vive con sus padres, se dedica a la compra y  venta de agua en coche y leña que el acarrea en su propia carreta de dos ruedas y un caballo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Carlos esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar mas leña. la leña en esta comunidad es muy utilizada casi por todos los pobladores ya que la mayoria de las personas utilizan fogones para cocinar. Carlos sale a vender la leña a diferentes localidades y caserios retirados y en los cuales no muchas personas venden este tipo de producto.
 
Vicenta I. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en union libre, no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos estan casados, Vicenta se dedica a la compra y venta de leña, esta la vende con sus vecinos y amigos
este negocio lo realiza desde hace 08 años esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña, necesita comprar 8 carretadas de leña ya que despues se pone mas cara y casi no tiene ganancias.
 
Gustavo Eduardo R. tiene 25 años de edad es soltero se dedica a la venta de leña, ademas trabaja de turnos por la noche en una empacadora de camaron, es muy trabajador, vive con sus padres. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace unos 6 años esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña.

La Leña en este lugar se vende muy bien, es, por no decir la unica fuente de calor para la mayoria de los fogones de todos los hogares de esta comunidad.
texts.en:
The Buena Vista Solidarity Group is located in the city of San Lorenzo and is made up of three members who have always worked together. Here are some details about the different activities they are involved in: Mr. Carlos Antonio N. is 29 years old and lives with his parents. He buys and sells water and firewood that he hauls in his own two-wheeled cart and horse. He has done this for the past 10 years. Carlos is soliciting the loan in order to buy more firewood. The firewood in this community is used by almost all the inhabitants as the majority of people cook over a fire. Carlos goes out to sell firewood in different locations and in isolated villages where not many people sell this type of product. Vicenta I. is 60 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has no dependants as all her children are married. Vicenta buys and sells firewood to her neighbors and friends. She has done this for the past 8 years. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy more firewood. She needs to buy 8 cartloads of firewood now as the price will soon increase which makes it hard to make a profit. Gustavo Eduardo R. is 25 years old and single. He sells firewood. He also works nightshift at a shrimp packing plant. He is very hard working. He lives with his parents. He has had this business for the past 6 years and is seeking a loan in order to buy more firewood. The firewood in this area sells very well as the fireplace is the only source of heating in the majority of homes in this community.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy carismática y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Edgar de 28 años y Claudia de 24, a quienes desea dejar bien asegurados en el futuro.
Desde muy joven se ha preocupado por su futuro, es así que decidió incursionar en una actividad que conocía muy bien, el comercio. Es por eso que actualmente ha logrado abrir una tienda de ropa, en una de las galerías más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde con mucha persuasión logra convencer a sus clientas de llevarse uno de sus vestidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y aconsejarles sobre el vestido que mejor le quedará, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es traer los vertidos desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del país), ya que el viaje es muy largo y agotador. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el primer préstamo de Julia con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más vestidos, con lo cual espera implementar mejor su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old and mother of a very charismatic and happy family. She lives in her own home next to her two children: Edgar (28 years old) and Claudia (24 years old). She hopes to leave them well secured in the future. Since she was young she has worried about her future. Because of this, she decided to take advantage of an activity that she knew very well – business. She opened a clothing store in one of the most important shopping centers in the city of Juliaca. With a lot of persuasion, she was able to convince her customers to buy her outfits. What she most likes about her work is talking with her customers and giving advice about the clothes that would most suit them. She has been doing this for the past 30 years. The hardest thing is bringing the clothing from the city of Tacna (in the south of the country) as the journey is long and exhausting. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store where she can bring her customers an even better service. This is Julia’s first loan with MFP and she plans to be very prompt in her repayments. She is well loved by the members of the communal bank as she brings joy to the group. With the 500 Nuevos soles that she is seeking she will buy more clothing which she will use to better stock her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Mama Mary T. is married to Mr. T., and they have five children . Due to the fact that it is too difficult to take care of the family singlehandedly and that her husband could not provide for the children's basic care alone, Mary decided to joint GHAPE in 2000. She has been having many marital problems with her husband’s brothers, which has made her sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small for her children. Mary's inability to get investment capital to generate income to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.
.
With this loan, Mary plans to buy a two wheeled motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she has a good rider for the motorcycle. In addition, Mary has saved money that she can now withdraw to purchase her bike. This is the reason that she asks for only 50,000 XAF. She plans to use the profits generated by the business to sponsor her children in school and to provide for her family's basic needs. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month of loan disbursement. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a two wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 35 años, vive con  su esposo Julio de  47 años, junto a sus 3 hijos; Eliel de 15, Miguel de 10 y Selena de 4 años, juntos habitan su casa que es propia.Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa, maíz, habas en sus tierras ; realiza esta actividad con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras con el abono adecuado para asegurar su productividad; así vende sus productos con facilidad en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene fieles  clientes, para el futuro tiene planeado  sembrar habas, arveja y papa en mayor cantidad, además se proyecta aperturar una panadería dentro de su localidad porque quiere generarse mayores ingresos , que le permitan brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y aS. que será puntual en sus pagos para acceder a más créditos.Con el dinero del préstamo, Mayela piensa comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de habas, 2 botellas de insecticida y varios sacos de abono orgánico además de  fertilizantes para cuidar sus cosechas y su productividad.
texts.en:
Mayela is 35 years old and lives with her husband Julio, 47, along with their three children, Eliel, 15; Miguel, 10; and Selena, 4; in a house they own. For the past 20 years Mayela has made a living harvesting peas, potatoes, corn and beans. She carries out this work with the unconditional help of her husband, and what she likes most about her job is cultivating the lands with adequate fertilizers to ensure productivity. Then she can sell her products with ease at the city's wholesale market, where she has faithful clients. For the future, she plans to harvest beans, peas and potatoes in higher quantities. She also has plans to open a bakery inside her home because she wants to generate more income, which would allow her to provide an adequate quality of life for her children. This is the second loan she has had from Kiva partner MFP, and she assures us that she will be punctual with her payments so she can gain access to more credit. With the money she is requesting, Mayela plans to purchase three sacks of bean seeds, two bottles of insecticide, and various sacks of manure and other fertilizers so she can care for her crops and ensure their productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es socio del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Armando es soltera, tiene 27 años, Armando vende libros cristianos, sus ventas los realiza mediante pedidos y son al crédito y contado.
Armando necesita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de libros cristianos.
Los sueños de Armando son mejorar sus negocios y tener una librería en un local estable.
texts.en:
Armando is a member of the Alegría Huamanga Community Bank. He is single, 27 years old and makes a living selling Christian books on order with cash or credit. Armando is requesting 1000 soles (approximately $350), which he plans to invest in the purchase of more Christian books. Armando's dreams are to improve his business and have a bookstore at a stable site.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christian books

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Tania es soltera, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Tania tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en un local alquilado, actividad que inicio hace 1 año en asociación con su hermana, Tania tiene proyectado hacer uniformes y buzos para la campaña escolar.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Tania son tener una empresa de confecciones y contar con un local propio.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Alegría Huamanga Community Bank. She is single, 37 years old and has one son. Tania has a sewing shop making clothes at a rented site, an activity she started one year ago along with her sister. Tania plans to make uniforms and sweatshirts for the school season. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to invest in the purchase of fabrics. Her dream is to have a larger sewing business on a space she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Humberto de 40 años y sus dos hijos; Edson de 18 y Yesica de 15, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Aunque sabe que la mecánica es un trabajo duro, no se amilana y trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio, el cual le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo Nelida ha logrado que su taller de mecánica se gane un buen nombre en su localidad, es por eso que es muy concurrido.
Lo que más le gusta es trabajar con los carros y ayudar a arreglarlos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que necesita para arreglar los autos. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar el espacio de su taller y así poder atender a más clientes a la vez.

Este es el primer préstamo de Nelida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más repuestos para autos, con lo cual desea brindar un mejor servicio para los carros de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelida is 34 years old and is a mother in a very happy and loving family. She lives in a house she owns along with her husband Humberto, 40, and their two children, Edson, 18, and Yesica, 15, who are the motive for all her efforts. Although she knows that being an auto mechanic is hard work, she does not shy away and works arduously to make headway for her business, which has provided the necessary income to support her family. With a lot of effort, Nelida has given her auto repair shop a good name in her area, and as a result it gets a lot of business. What she likes most about her job is working with cars and helping fix them, something she has been doing for six years. The thing she considers the most difficult is loading the heavy parts needed to make the repairs. In the future, she hopes to expand the size of her workshop so she can be able to serve more customers at a time. This is Nelida's first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she has to make all her payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is always active in the meetings. With the loan of 1,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more auto parts with the hope of providing a better service for her customers' cars.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Raquel es casada, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Raquel vende frutas variadas en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, Además Raquel hace bordados de carteras, correas que vende en el mercado artesanal.
Raquel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos y materiales para el bordado.
Los sueños de Raquel son tener una empresa y vender sus productos fuera de la región, y tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Alegría Huamanga Community Bank. She is married, 26 years old and has one son. Raquel sells various fruits in front of her home every day. Furthermore, she also embroiders handbags and belts that she sells at the artisan market. Raquel is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase thread and other embroidery materials. Her dreams are to have a business and sell her products outside of her region, and to have a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread and embroidery materials

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 31 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Berty de 30 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.


Su stand de ropa es uno de los más concurridos por las jóvenes juliaqueñas, ya que los modelos que vende son muy bonitos y modernos, esto ha logrado que su negocio poco a poco crezca más y se convierta en una actividad muy rentable, que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comprar vestidos en la ciudad de Tacna (sur del país), ya que tiene muy buen gusto y siempre elige bonitas prendas. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en espera de los clientes. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda más grande, donde pueda vender una mayor variedad de ropa.

Este es el primer préstamo de Silvia con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más vestidos para implementar mejor su stand.
texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Silvia is a very loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, Berty (age 30), and what she most wants is to improve her quality of life.

Her clothing stand is one of the most frequented by young women of Juliaca because her styles are very lovely and modern. This has allowed her business to grow little by little, turning into something very lucrative that brings her the income she needs to support her family. What she likes most about her job is purchasing dresses in the city of Tacna (in the southern part of the country) because she has good taste and always picks out the prettiest styles. She has been in business for 3 years and thinks that the most difficult aspect of her job is having to wait for customers all day long.

In time, she hopes to have a bigger shop where she can sell a wider selection of apparel.

This is Silvia’s first loan with MFP, and she hopes to make her payments on time. She is a well-respected member of her bank because of the responsibility she has demonstrated. With this 300.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more dresses to restock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: San Francisco De Totos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Francisco D. Totos, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Totos, distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad se ubica a 3,500 msnm y a 154 Km D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, se dedica principalmente a la ganadería y la agricultura.

Margarita, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Margarita se dedica a al venta D. animales menores, las cuales compra en caseríos y ferias, los cuales venD. en su comunidad, negocio en el cual es ayudada por sus hijos. Margarita requiere D. un préstamo, el cual invertirá en su negocio adquiriendo más animales. Ella trabaja arduo, ya quiere que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.

Hilda es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Hilda tiene por negocio una bodega, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales compra en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y venD. en su comunidad.
Hilda, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual abastecerá su negocio. Hilda, quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida, y tener una casa propia, para lo cual ya se encuentra ahorrando.
texts.en:
The San Francisco D. Totos Communal Bank is located in the Totos community, in the district by the same name, province of Cangallo, department of Ayacucho. This community is located 3,500 meters above sea level, some 154 km from the city of Ayacucho. This community is involved chiefly in cattle farming and agriculture.

Margarita is a married mother with 5 children. She sells small animals, which she buys at farmhouses and fairs. She then sells them in her community, and her children help her out with the business. Margarita needs a loan, which she will invest in purchasing more animals. She works arduously because she wants her children to become professionals.

Hilda is a married mother with 3 children. She owns a general store in which she sells basic need items, which she purchases in Ayacucho and sells in her community.

Hilda needs a loan with which she will restock her business. Hilda would like to improve her quality of life and have her own home, for which she is now saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their small businesses

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Maria es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la ampliación de su local.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea surtido y tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Alegría Huamanga Microfinance Institute.

Maria is a 39-year-old mother with 4 children. She runs a store from home in which she sells general goods, vegetables, and meat every day with the help of her children.

Maria needs a 1,250.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in expanding her business space.

Maria dreams of her children becoming professionals, of having a well-stocked business, and of boosting sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business space expansion

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia, de 44 años, es una madre muy sincera y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sebastián de 44 años y sus dos hijos; Wilber de 23 y Maribel de 21, quienes la apoyan para sacar adelante a su familia.
El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de lubricantes para autos, junto a sus queridos hijos, trabaja todos los días vendiendo toda clase de lubricantes a su amplia lista de clientes, quienes prefieren comprarle a ella por la calidad de los productos que vende. 
También abaste a  pequeños empresarios que llevan los lubricantes a otras provincias de la región para venderlos.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, es muy buena vendedora, muy persistente y convincente, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es comprar los lubricantes, ya que tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Tacna (sur del país) para traerlos. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar su tienda y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad más amplia de productos.


Este es el primer préstamo de Teodosia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Asimismo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y colaboradora. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lubricantes para implementar mejor el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Teodosia is a very loving and sincere mother who lives in her own home with her husband, Sebastian (age 44), and their two children: Wilber age 23, and Maribel, age 21. They both support their mother in order to help the family get ahead.

Teodosia sells motor oil for a living. She and her beloved children work every day selling all types of car lubricants to their long list of customers, who do business with her because of the quality of the products that she sells.

She also supplies motor oil to other small business owners, who sell it in other provinces of the region.

What she likes most about her job is selling. She is a very good seller because she is persistent and convincing. She has been in business for 6 years, and she considers the most difficult aspect of her job to be purchasing the motor oil because she has to travel all the way to Tacna, in the southern part of the country.

In the future, she hopes to expand her shop so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products.

This is Teodosia’s first loan with MFP. She understands that she has to make her payments punctually, and she is willing to do so. She is a very cheerful member of her bank who works well with others. With the 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more motor oil to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Ana es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Ana junto a su esposo tienen un estudio jurídico en un local alquilado, su esposo es Abogado y ella se encarga de la secretaria.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora y hacer instalar Internet en la oficina.
Los sueños de Ana son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Alegría Huamanga Microfinance Institute.

Ana is a 34-year-old married mother with 4 children. Ana and her husband have their own legal office in a rented space. Her husband is a lawyer and she takes care of the office work.

Ana needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be used for purchasing a new computer and connecting it to the internet.

Ana dreams of her children having a quality education and of home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer and internet installation

loans.name: Veronika

texts.es:
Verónika tiene 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres Dionicio de 60 y Paulina de 50 años, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares.
Su stand de ropa está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahí ofrece a sus clientes novedosos y bellos vestidos, los cuales son muy solicitados por las jovencitas, sobre todo para asistir a sus bailes de promoción. Los vestidos que vende los trae desde la ciudad de Tacna (sur del país), es por eso que los modelos son muy novedosos y llamativos; pero también ella misma confecciona algunas prendas que vende directamente en su puesto.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a las jovencitas que vienen a comprar, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que traer los vestidos, ya que el viaje es muy largo y agotador. 
Para más adelante, espera poder tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Verónica con MFP y a su corta edad ya es muy responsable con su trabajo, por lo que sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras, ya que es la más joven del grupo y es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para elaborar más vestidos y así ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Verónika is 20 years old. She is a hardworking and cheerful young woman who lives at the home of her parents, Dionicio (age 60) and Paulina (age 50). Verónika desires to help them with the family expenses.

She operates a clothing stand in central Juliaca. Verónika offers her customers the latest and most stylish clothing, which are mainly requested by teenage girls especially when they attend their prom. Her clothing is acquired from the city of Tacna (in the southern part of the country), which explains why her clothing is trendy and in fashion. In addition, Verónika manufactures some of the outfits that she sells from her stand. What she enjoys most about her job is giving advice to the young girls who buy from her. She has been in this business for three years and says the hardest part is transporting her inventory because the trip is long and tiring. In the future, she hopes to have a larger shop where she can provide better service to her customers.

This is Verónika’s first loan with MFP. At such a young age, she is very responsible at her job. She knows she has to make her payments on time. Verónika is well-liked by the other members of her Communal Bank for her cheerful disposition and because she is the youngest member of the group. With her loan of 1000 soles, she plans to buy material for producing more dresses to sell so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for making dresses

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Huanupampa, distrito D. Totos, provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad se ubica a 3,800 msnm y se caracteriza por su dedicación  a la ganadería y la agricultura.

Melania es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Melania se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, los cuales adquiere en la ciudad y venD. en su comunidad, negocio que comparte con su esposo. Melania requiere D. un préstamo, el cual invertirá en su negocio adquiriendo mercadería. Melania tiene como meta el adquirir un carro, para lo cual ya trabaja arduo.

Gregoria es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Gregoria se dedica a la venta D. quesos y algunas frutas, los cuales venD. en la comunidad D. Totos, negocio en el cual es ayudada  por sus hijos y esposo. Gregoria, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual abastecerá su negocio. Gregoria, se encuentra ahorrando para poder pagar los estudios D. sus hijos, ya que quiere que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Carmen” Communal Bank is located in the Huanupampa community in the District of Totos, Cangallo Province, Department of Ayacucho. This community is located 3800 meters above sea level and is known for being a center for raising livestock and farming.

Melania is married and has two children. She sells groceries, which she acquires in the city and then sells in her community. Her husband helps with managing the business. Melania is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise for her business. Her goal is to purchase a car to help with her hard work.

Gregoria is married and has three children. She sells cheeses and fruit in the community of Totos. Her husband and children help her with the business. Gregoria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business. She is saving money to pay for her children’s education because she want them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their businesses

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, es cosmetóloga, Maria trabaja en un salón de belleza, actividad que realiza todos los días. Maria tiene proyectado implementar su propio salón.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles para su salón.
Los sueños de Maria es tener su salón de belleza y acceder a una línea de crédito mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Maria is a cosmetologist who currently works every day at a beauty salon. She has plans to start her own business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy furniture for her own beauty salon.

Her dreams include running her beauty salon and accessing a larger line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es: Doña Elvia C. se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Ella actualmente es casada, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene dos hijos los cuales están trabajando por su cuenta. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 22 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, ya que para ese tiempo su esposo estaba sin trabajo por enfermedad, que era lo que mayormente le impedía realizar labores. Sin embargo, este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pudieron prepararse en la universidad. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de mercancías principalmente desea invertir en los granos básicos, ya que para esta fecha es cuando puede aprovechar para vender más y de contado. La señora posee el sueño de tener un negocio grande en el mercado nuevo que brinde mayores ingresos a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Elvia C. manages a grocery business out of her home. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children who work on their own. Elvia started her business 22 years ago selling sweets to children. She gradually reinvested into her business and added basic grains to her inventory, which is what most people buy from her. Elvia says the objective behind starting her business was to look for an alternative source of income to support her children. Her husband was out of work at the time due to illness, which prevented him from securing permanent employment. However, this business has helped her family get ahead and prepare her children for college.

At the moment, Elvia is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise, mostly basic grains which she is able to sell more of in exchange for cash payments. She dreams of opening a larger business at the new market so that she can generate more income for her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Angélica es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Angélica tiene un pequeño taller de composturas en su casa, además Angélica brinda servicios de bordados de bolsas y correas. El esposo de Angélica tiene una carpintería.
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de Angélica es mejorar el taller de su esposo, comprar mas maquinarias.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Angélica manages a repair shop in her home. In addition, she provides embroidery services for purses and belts. Angélica’s husband is a carpenter. She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy wood.

Angélica dreams of improving her husband’s workshop by purchasing more machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 47 años, vive con su esposa Rosalina de 45 años. Tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo vive con 4 de ellos: Mariela de 22, James de 19, Kevin 15 y Kitty de 11 años; por quienes se desvive para brindarles un futuro mejor. Su casa es propia y la pudo conseguir luego de haber pasado muchos sacrificios que parecían interminables.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy joven aprendió todo lo necesario para estas labores, lo cual le permite sembrar papa, olluco, alverja y habas. Con esta actividad logra cubrir actualmente  las necesidades de su familia. Sus 3 hijos mayores lo ayudan en la actividad agrícola y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene unida a su familia.
Paralelamente, se dedica paralelamente a la venta de leña, aunque este trabajo es algo sacrificado sigue adelante porque quiere asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, además los ingresos que percibe son bastante rentables por lo que planea invertir en la siembra de más terrenos para obtener una mayor productividad.

Su puntualidad de pago en su banco comunal, ha logrado que trabaje con mucho entusiasmo y ser un ejemplo a seguir para sus compañeros; tal es así que este es su noveno crédito consecutivo con MFP. Bernardo tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de alverja, habas y flores de melón, para empezar con su proyecto de producir en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 47 years old and lives with his wife Rosalina, who is 45. They have six children, but only four live with them: Mariela (age 22), James (age 19), Kevin (age 15), and Kitty (age 11). Bernando struggles in order to provide them with a better future. He purchased his own home after spending many years making sacrifices that appeared to be endless.

Bernardo is engaged in agriculture. As a young man, he learned everything about farming so that he could grow potatoes, ulluco, peas, and beans. Farming enables him to cover what he currently needs for his family. His three older children help with the agricultural duties. What he enjoys about his work is having his family together.

In addition, Bernardo sells firewood. Although this business is somewhat of a sacrifice, he continues with it because he wants to secure his children’s future. His earnings are quite profitable, so he plans to invest in more land for higher productivity.

Bernardo has been punctual with his payments to his Communal Bank. He managed to work with great enthusiasm and become a role model for his peers. This is his ninth loan with MFP. He plans to use the money to purchase several bags of seeds to grow peas, beans, and melon flowers so that that he can produce these crops in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Sibia

texts.es:
Sibia tiene 29 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su padre Nicolás, de 64 años, su madre Adelaida, de 53 años, y sus hermanos; Elmer de 22 y Yosmi de 11 años, también tiene una pequeña hija de tan sólo 3 años.

Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir, calzado y productos de belleza. Sus hermanos menores suelen cuidar de la pequeña hija de Sibia mientras ella trabaja todo el día en una entidad pública.
Sibia siempre lleva a su lado una fotografía de su hija, la cual observa cada vez que siente que no tiene fuerzas para continuar, su pequeña se convierte en el motor que la impulsa para luchar y echar al olvido las malas experiencias. También dice que con la separación de su pareja aprendió a valorarse más como mujer y a independizarse sin miedo, y está logrando surgir porque su actividad comercial es bastante rentable y le permite cubrir las necesidades de su familia, además de ahorrar.
Para el futuro esta trabajadora mujer desea ampliar aún más su negocio, abastecerse con mercadería de moda  y comprar vitrinas donde exhibir sus prendas, porque considera que sería una buena estrategia de marketing.

Sin miedo ella supo asumir su papel de madre y padre para que su hija no sienta ningún vació y está muy agradecida con MFP, tanto así que esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito con la entidad, porque sabe que económicamente está creciendo junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes les gusta trabajar porque está comprendido por mujeres luchadoras como ella. Con el dinero que solicita, tiene planeado comprar decenas de prendas de vestir y calzados, porque la mercadería que adquirirá prácticamente ya está vendida porque son sólo pedidos.
texts.en:
Sibia is 29 years old and lives at home with her parents Nicolas (age 64) and Adelaida (age 53), her two siblings Elmer (age 22) and Yosmi (age 11), and her three year old daughter.

For the past nine years, Sibia has been selling apparel, shoes, and beauty products. Her youngest sibling looks after her daughter while she is at her job working for a public company. Sibia always keeps a photograph of her daughter with her to look at whenever she feels that she does not have the strength to continue. Her daughter motivates her to continue fighting and forget about her past struggles. She says that after separating from her husband, she learned how to value herself more as a woman, become independent, and live without fear. Sibia has been able to succeed because her business is profitable enough for her to cover her family’s expenses and set aside some savings. In the future, she wants to expand her business, acquire more apparel to add to her inventory, and purchase display cabinets for showing off outfits. She thinks this will be a good marketing strategy.

Sibia fearlessly assumes her role as both mother and daughter so that her daughter does not feel like a part of her is missing. She is grateful to MFP because she and the other members of her Communal Bank have grown financially as a group. Sibia enjoys working with them because they understand her because they struggle just like she does. She is requesting her fifth loan from the Institution. With the money she will receive, Sibia plans to buy clothing and shoes by the dozen because her existing merchandise is already sold and she has outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Segundina es viuda, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Segundina vende desayunos en su casa y en algunas oportunidades vende cebiche, actividad que realiza todos los días. Segundina tiene proyectado implementar una fuente de soda.
Segundina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Segundina son equipar su fuente de soda, tener un restaurante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundina is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 41 years old, widowed, and has four children. She sells breakfasts from her home and on some occasions sells ceviche. Her business is open every day. Segundina also has plans to open a soda fountain.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy tables and chairs. Segundina dreams of equipping her soda fountain, opening a restaurant, and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un joven trabajador de 28 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Teodora, de 40 años; su padrastro Juan, de 37 años; y con una de dos sus hijas, la pequeña hija Ximena de 4 años. 

Este hombre ejemplar trabaja brindando servicio de transporte en motocarro dentro de una ciudad pequeña ubicada en la selva central del Perú. Este oficio lo desarrolla desde hace 9 años y es muy rentable porque le permitió construir su casa, amoblarla y hasta abrir tener ahorros para asegurar su futuro y el de su familia. Pero lamentablemente su dicha no es completa, puesto que hace algunos meses su pareja lo abandonó llevándose a una de sus hijas, a la que no ha visto hasta hoy, pero él no pierde la esperanza de encontrarla muy pronto. Al recordar a la menor de sus hijas se desanima, pero basta una sonrisa o un abrazo de su hija Ximena y reacciona, pues sabe que debe luchar por ella.
Para el futuro tiene proyectado comprar terrenos, continuar ahorrando y aperturar una librería, además de un restaurante de comida rápida. 

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque es muy activo y porque ve a los integrantes como una familia. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar las herramientas y materiales necesarios para reparar su motocarro y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus exigentes pasajeros.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a young worker who is 28 years of age. He lives in his own home, with his mother Teodora (age 40), his stepfather Juan (age 37), and one of his two daughters, little Ximena (age 4).

This gentleman works to provide exemplary motorcycle transport services in a small town in the central jungle of Peru. He developed his business over the past nine years, which has become profitable enough for him to build his house, furnish it, and acquire savings to secure his future and that of his family. Unfortunately, Wilfredo says his life is not complete. Some months ago, his girlfriend left him and took one of their daughters, whom he has not seen to this day. He does not lose hope and is optimistic that he will get to see her soon. Wilfredo remembers his younger daughter being disheartened, but a smile or a hug for his little Ximena makes her feel better. He knows that he must continue to struggle on her behalf. In the future, Wilfredo has plans to buy land, continue saving money, and open a bookstore and fast food restaurant.

This is his third loan with MFP. Wilfredo promises to continue making his payments on time. He enjoys working with his Communal Bank because the members are very active and have become like family. With the money he requested, Wilfredo will purchase tools and materials needed to repair his motorcycle taxi so that he can provide better service to his demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anselma Josefina

texts.es:
Anselma es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Anselma es casada, tiene 61 años y 5 hijos, Anselma venD. frutas en el mercado central D. la ciudad D. manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Anselma se dedica a la crianza D. animales como cuy y gallina.
Anselma necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas y una remalladora para su hija.
Anselma sueña con que su hija tenga un taller granD. y ampliar la crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Anselma is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 61 years old, married, and has five children. Anselma sells fruit every day at the city central market as a traveling merchant. In addition, she raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

Anselma needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy fruits and an overlock stitching machine for her daughter. She hopes to raise more animals and that her daughter will have a larger sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & an overlock stitching machine for her daughter

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hija, Julia junto a su esposo tienen una librería en un local alquilado ubicado a una cuadra de la plaza principal de Ayacucho, vende libros, artículos de escritorio, juguetes, mochilas y por época de carnavales venderá talcos, globos. Además los días sábados y domingos vende ropa en las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de globos, talcos.
Los sueños de Julia son que su hija sea profesional y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Alborada Community Bank. She is married, 49 years old and has one daughter. Julia, along with her husband, has a bookstore at a rented site located one block from the main plaza of Ayacucho. She sells books, written articles, toys, backpacks and, during festivals, she plans to sell powders and balloons. Furthermore, on Saturdays and Sundays, she sells clothes at the regional flea markets. Julia is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles (approximately $525), which she plans to invest in the purchase of balloons and powders. Julia's dream is for her daughter to be successful and to own her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balloons and powders

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Teodosia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. ropa D. niños, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima a donD. viaja cada 15 días. Además Teodosia los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donD. también venD. ropa.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa D. niños.
Teodosia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Alborada Community Bank. She is married, 49 years old and has three children. Teodosia has a post at the 12th of April Market where she sells children's clothing every day of the week. She acquires her products in the city of Lima, where she travels every 15 days. Furthermore, on Saturdays and Sundays, she travels to the regional flea markets to also sell clothing. Teodosia is requesting a loan of 1,050 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of children's clothing. Her dream is for her children to be successful and to expand her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
El Sr. Sebastián G. Z. trabaja para una institución del estado, el es el responsable de mantenimientos y cuido de las instalaciones de dicha institución.

El crédito que solicita lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como hierro y ladrillos de cuarterón, estos serán utilizados para la elaboración de las cerca de su casa de habitación.

El Sr. Sebastián G. trabaja en esta institución desde hace 13 años, y realiza sus labores desde las 8 de la mañana que es su hora de entrada hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días de la semana, antes de dedicarse a este trabajo el era comerciante.

El espera que con la compra del hierro y los ladrillos va a completar los materiales para poder construir un muro que rodee sus casa y le des mas seguridad y protección ya que su cerca esta construida de manera rustica y en mal estado.

El Sr. Sebastián es soltero y tiene 4 hijos tres de ellos trabajan por cuenta propia y  la hija menor estudia en la universidad cuyos gastos los costea Don Sebastián.

Este es el cuarto crédito que Don Sebastián tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 2 años y dice que dichos créditos le han beneficiado bastante ya que a través de estos a logrado adquirir su muebles y utensilio de trabajo que por cuenta proa se le harían imposible obtenerlos.
texts.en:
Sebastián G. Z. works for a state institution and is responsible for the maintenance and care of the facilities. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to purchase construction materials like iron and bricks to make a fence for his home. Sebastián has worked at the institution for 13 years and works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening every day of the week. Before this job he made a living as a merchant. He hopes that the purchase of the iron and bricks will complete the materials he needs to build a fence that surrounds his house and will give him more security and protection since his current fence is in very bad shape. Sebastián is single and has four children, three who work on their own, and his youngest daughter studies at the university thanks to his financial help. This is the fourth loan for Sebastián through Kiva partner Ceprodel over the past two years, and he says that he has greatly benefited from the loan, through which he has been able to acquire furniture and work tools that would've been otherwise impossible to get.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron and bricks to make a fence

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of shellfish, shrimp, and fish.

loans.name: Maura Melva

texts.es:
Maura Tómala de 55 años, vive en una zona periurbana su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de ladrillos tiene agua y luz como servicio básicos, tiene ya 10 años de estar separada de su esposo con el tubo 1 hija. 

Maura comenzó siendo costurera en su casa con los pocos ingresos que tenia haciendo esta actividad pudo ponerse un pequeño puesto de venta de dulces, ahora ella trabaja todos los días vendiendo colas, dulces, snack etc. Una de las mayores dificultades que tiene en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar snack, dulces, colas, gelatinas para poner tener más surtido su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner un bazar en su casa y poder así mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maura Tómala, 55, lives on the outskirts of the Perimetral de Guayaquil, in a brick house with water and light as her basic services. She has been separated for 10 years from her husband, with whom she had a daughter.

Maura started working as a seamstress in her house and, with the little income she earned from doing this activity, was able to set up a small stall selling sweets. She now works every day, selling colas, sweets, snacks etc. One of the major difficulties that she has in her business is the crime in her area.

With the loan, she would like to buy snacks, sweets, colas, jellies, to have a greater range in her business. In the future, she would like to set up a goods store in her house and thereby be able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, colas and snacks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Rosa es soltera, tiene 50 años y 1 hija, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de conjuntos de mujer.
Los sueños de Rosa son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro para la movilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a partner of the Communal Bank Alborada. She is single, 50 years old and has one daughter. Rosa has a stall in the 12th of April Market where she sells various clothes every day. She buys her products in Lima city.

Rosa needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in buying women's collections. Rosa dreams of improving her business and buying a car for her family's mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's collections.

loans.name: Luz Marlene

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
