Luz es soltera, tiene 37 años y 1 hija, trabaja en el hospital regional como personal administrativo, Luz tiene un kiosco al frente del hospital en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su hermano.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Luz son terminar sus estudios de Administración y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 37 years old, single, and has a daughter. She works in the regional hospital in an administrative capacity. She has a stand across from the hospital where she sells food and drink. Her brother helps her with her business. Luz needs a loan of 900 soles, to buy rice and sugar. Her dream is to complete her studies in management and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Yani Flor

texts.es:
Yani es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Yani es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Yani junto a su mama tienen una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza por las tardes porque en la mañana estudia contabilidad en un instituto.
Yani necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fideos, galletas, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Yani son terminar su carrera y tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Yani is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She and her mother have a store in the home, selling groceries, produce, and meat. She runs the business in the afternoon, because in the morning she studies accounting in an institute. Yani needs a loan of 1,050 soles, to purchase pasta, cookies, and soft drinks. Yani’s dream is to finish her studies and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, cookies, soft drinks

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Marisol tiene un taller de confecciones en un local alquilado que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad , cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan. Además Marisol viaja a las ferias los días sábados y domingos en donde vende ropa.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Marisol sueña con tener un taller grande, terminar los acabados de su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. Marisol works as a seamstress, using rented premises in the center of the city, and with the help of 2 employees. Marisol also travels to bazaars on Saturdays and Sundays, where she sells clothing. Marisol needs a loan of 1,050 soles, to be used to purchase fabric. Her dream is to have a large shop, finish the work on her house, and for her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Los Ganaderos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario los Ganaderos esta integrado por tres personas, las cuales
se conocen desde hace varios años. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que elloe realizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:

el señor Mateo P. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con Brenda Yanez, tienen 5 hijos y tres dependen de el, Mateo se dedica a transportar materiales de construccion en su carreta con bueyes, tiene 8 años de realizar este tipo de actividad.
esta solicitando el credito para arreglar su carreta, algun dia desea comprar un carro pick up para que su trabajo sea mas facil y mas rapido.
 
el señor Ramon Antonio A. es un joven de 20 años de edad que acaba de unirse con la joven Eda P., estan esperando su primer bebe, el se dedica a la fabricacion de balcones y puertas de metal, cuando no trabaja la soldadura. Esta solicitando el credito para comprar un buey ya que tiene una carreta y desea utilizarla para jalar o transportar materiales.
 
la señora Maria Victoria L. tiene 36 años de edad vive en union libre con Juan Carlos Aguilar, juntos han procreado 3 hijos a quienes tienen estudiando, Maria se dedica a la panaderia, tiene 7 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, vende su producto en los barrios cercanos a su domicilio. 
Maria vive en el barrio Nueva Esperanza de nacaome valle, esta solicitrando el credito para 
poder agregar fabricar otro tipo de pan dulce a su venta. tiene pensado hacer tortas.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para crecer con sus negocios y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Los Ganaderos" consists of three people, who have known each other for some years. The following describes the different activities that they carry out to earn their daily living: Señor Mateo P. is 36 years old and is married to Brenda Yanez. They have 5 children, and 3 depend on him. Mateo transports construction materials with his wagon and oxen. He has done this type of work for 8 years. He is applying for a loan to repair his wagon. One day he wants to have a pickup truck so that his work will be easier and faster.

Señor Ramon Antonio A. is a young man of 20 who has just united with the young woman Eda P.. They are expecting their first baby. He works in the construction of metal balconies and doors when he is not doing soldering work. He is applying for a loan to buy a ox, since he has a wagon and wants to use it to haul materials.

Señora Maria Victoria L. is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband Juan Carlos Aguilar. Together they have 3 children, who are all in school. Maria works in the baking business. She has done this type of work for 7 years. She sells her products in the neighborhoods close to her home. Maria lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of Nacaome, in the Valle district. She is applying for the loan to be able to add other types of sweetened breads to the products she sells. She is thinking of making cakes. All the group members need the loans to expand their businesses and thus be able to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sand, stone, firewood, iron, bars for soldering, basic ingredients for making bread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Omar Abel

texts.es:
el sr Omar Abel A. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con Deysi Yamileth Avila,  
tiene 04 hijos. Su compañera de hogar trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y el vende productos de uso personal, tambien vende controles remotos universales para televisores, extensiones electricas, focos, baterias. estos productos los vende en el Amatillo frontera con El Salvador, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus productos son vendidos ya que muchas personas que viajan necesitan de este tipo de mercaderia. esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Omar Abel A. is 33 years old. He lives in common law marriage with Deysi Yamileth Avila. He has four children. His partner at home works in a shrimp packing plant and he sells personal products. He also sells universal remotes for televisions, extension cords, lightbulbs, and batteries. He sells these products on the Amatillo border with El Salvador. He has little time to spend on this type of activity. His products sell because many people who travel need this type of merchandise. He is asking for the loan to purchase more merchandise wholesale and thus have more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of toothpaste, toothbrushes, creams, razors, soap.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina P. is 24 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Christina has 5 years of experience in this business.  Christina needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Christina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Christina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Christina P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paula Francisca

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo en el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Paula M. se dedica arduamente a laborar en la venta de ropa siendo este el negocio que ella posee y el que le permite obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo. Ellas a diario vende tanto en su casa y sale a las afueras y los fines de semana se dedica a la compra de la ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes.
El destino del crédito será para la compra de camisas, pantalones, camisetas, zapatos, entre otros. Es por esta razón que ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera logrará satisfacer a sus clientes en la venta de la ropa.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula M. dedicates herself arduously to selling clothing in the El Viejo municipality of Chinandega. This is the business she owns, which allows her to generate income. She sells clothing from her home during the day, and on weekends she travels around to market her products and fulfill her customers’ needs. The loan will be used to buy shirts, pants, t-shirts, shoes, and other items. It’s for this reason that she hopes her loan will be granted, and this way she will be able to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Asoleaga

texts.en:
Asoleaga I. is 39 and married with 7 children (ages 8 - 19 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish . Asoleaga has many years of experience in this business.  Asoleaga needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 255 tala or US $106 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Asoleaga joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asoleaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Asoleaga I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.55 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.64 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, la señora Susana D. se dedica a su actividad de venta de hielo, helados y refrescos elaborados por ella misma con mucha dedicación y con un toque de mucho sabor que hace que los clientes le compren dichos productos.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de linaza, cebada, azúcar, bolsas, canela, entre otros. Esta materia prima la utilizará para la elaboración de los refrescos y helados. Ella espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así continuará manteniendo a sus cuatros hijos en edad escolar a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Susana D. dedicates herself to selling ice, popsicles and refreshments in the El Viejo municipality of Chinandega. She makes these products herself with much dedication, and with such flavor that her customers like to buy her goods. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of linseed, barley, sugar, bags, and cinnamon, among other items. These are the primary ingredients she uses to make her refreshments and popsicles. She hopes confidently that her loan will be granted, which will help her to continue supporting her four school-aged children who she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase linseed, barley, sugar, bags, cinnamon.

loans.name: Nele

texts.en:
Nele  S. is 44 and married with 3 children (ages 15- 22 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Nele  has many years of experience in this business.  Nele  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 125 tala or US $52 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Nele  joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Nele 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nele  S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yadira Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Yadira Vanegas vive en el municipio El Viejo en Chinandega y se siente muy satisfecha porque ha logrado suplir las necesidades para el desarrollo intelectual de su hija que hoy en día está finalizando sus estudios universitarios.
Doña Yadira ha sido fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo realizado créditos anteriormente los que han sido utilizados para el pago de la universidad de su hija. Hoy en día el crédito que solicita lo utilizará directamente para el pago del título universitario de su hija para así sentirse satisfecha que ha apoyado a su amada hija en este largo camino y que ahora espera gozar de los privilegios de tener una hija profesional a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Yadira Vanegas lives in the El Viejo municipality of Chinandega. She feels very satisfied for having been able to provide her daughter, who is now completing her university studies, with an education. Ms. Yadira has been a faithful client of Ceprodel, having had previous loans that were used to pay for her daughter’s schooling. The loan she is requesting today will be directly used to pay for her daughter’s college degree. This way, she will feel very content to have supported her beloved daughter on this long road. She hopes to now enjoy the benefits of having a professional daughter whom she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's college degree.

loans.name: Petrona Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Petrona S. se dedica con mucho ahínco a la actividad de venta de ropa como camisas, pantalones, trajes para niños, entre otros. Tiene 6 años de dedicarse al negocio de la venta de ropa y ha sabido administrarlo por lo que ha llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación. 

Hoy en día ella está solicitando un crédito el cuál lo invertirá en la compra de la ropa ya que requiere obtenerla para continuar vendiéndola y así obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo. Espera que Ceprodel le beneficie grandemente y así saldrá adelante en su negocio en el municipio de El Viejo.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona S. dedicates herself eagerly to selling clothing such as shirts, pants, children’s outfits, and other items. She has been dedicated to this type of business for 6 years, and has known how to run it well since it has helped support her household. She is requesting today’s loan to invest in more clothing, as she needs it to continue selling these products to generate income. She hopes that Ceprodel will benefit her greatly, and she will be able to continue growing her business in the El Viejo municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Marina tiene 40 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos: Darly tiene 22 años, Romel tiene 20 años y Cesar tiene 2 años. La socia Marina vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa va atender el cafetín escolar en el colegio “Humberto Luna” de Calca.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como galletas, dulces, gaseosas, refrescos, hamburguesas y pasteles.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, Marina, is 40 years old, divorced, and has three children: Darly, who is 22 years old, Romel, who is 20, and Cesar, 2 years of age. Marina lives in the city of Calca, in Cusco, and belongs to the “MAMACHA ASUNTA” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. Marina is a hard-working mother and entrepreneur that rises very early each morning to tend to her household chores, such as making breakfast for her children. After finishing these tasks, she goes to work at the school cafeteria at the Humberto Luna School in Calca. She has been in this business for several years, and things have gone well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work. This member needs a loan to buy products such as cookies, sweets and snacks, sodas and refreshments, hamburgers, and cakes. She is very grateful for the financial opportunity presented her via this medium, and commits to repaying her loan as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as cookies, sweets, sodas, refreshments, hamburgers, and cakes.

loans.name: Nelson Yobany

texts.es:
el señor Nelson Yobany C. A. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en union libre, su casa de habitacion esta en la colonia la Nueva Caucara en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Nelson se dedica a la compra y venta de articulos personales, sus ventas las realiza en la frontera del Amatillo. muchos viajates necesitan comprar este tipo de productos. 
ahora el necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, comprando al por mayor obtiene mayores ganancias pero no tiene capital suficiente para poder comprar variedad de productos al por mayor.
Nelson necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson Yobany C. A. is 36 years old. He lives in a common-law relationship. His house is in the suburb of Nueva Caucara in the city of San Lorenzo. Nelson works in the purchase and sale of personal items. His sales take place on the border of Amatillo. A lot of travelling is necessary to purchase these types of products. Now he needs a loan in order to supply his business; buying wholesale gets greater profits, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to buy a variety of products wholesale. Nelson needs the load in order to do well for his family and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothpastes, soaps, toothbrushes, flashlights, nail clippers, batteries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en:
Terisa T. is 23 and married with 1 child (9 years-old).  She owns a business venture, selling general handicrafts and elei materials to tourists and local community members.  Terisa has 5 years of experience in this business.  Terisa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 215 tala or US $90 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Terisa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Terisa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Terisa T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase paints, fabrics and elei board for her elei printing

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
el señor Edilberto R. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, su compañera de hogar trabaja en la empacadora ibermar (empacadora de mariscos).
Edilberto se dedica a la compra y venta productos de uso personal, su producto lo vende ambulante en diferentes colonias y caserios cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
tiene  4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
las ventas en la epoca de navidad fueron buenas para el y ahorita se quedo con poco producto y desea surtir mas su negocio. las ganancias que obtuvo en navidad las invirtio en su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Edilberto R. is 37 years old he lives in a civil union and he has a three year old daughter. His companion works in the packing plant Ibermar, she packages seafood. Edilberto buys and sells personal use products which he sells on foot in different towns and at farms near his home, he has had this business for four years. Sales during the Christmas season were good for Edilberto and now he is left with few products and he wants to resupply his business. What he earned at Christmas he invested in his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothbrushes, deodorants, toothpaste, nail clippers, creams, flashlights, bateries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cigarros y tabaco, la elaboración la realiza en su casa con el apoyo de sus hijos, luego los lleva a vender en el mercado Bellavista, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Nery forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la elaboración de cigarros. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de tabaco. La meta de Nery es tener una bodega en su casa que le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nery, 53, is a very hard-working woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has five children, two of whom are adults. She makes and sells cigars and tobacco, an activity she undertakes in her own home with help from her children. She then takes the products to the Bellavista market to sell. Her husband, who is a farmer, supports her work endeavors. Nery has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for four years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in cigar manufacturing. She now needs 500 soles to buy tobacco. Nery's goal is to have a store in her home that will allow her to earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tobacco.

loans.name: Claudia Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Josefina A. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder elaborar las bardas de su casa ya que tiene miedo que le pueda pasar algo a ella y a su pequeño hijo. 
Doña Claudia Josefina tiene ya más de seis años con su negocio de belleza, esta es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y quiere lo mejor. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es una hermana que trabaja con la señora Claudia en el salon de belleza ya que cuando fuimos a la visita doña Claudia se encontraba haciendo las comprar de los productos que necesita para el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia Josefina A. has had three loans with FVP and repaid all punctually. She is seeking a loan to build a fence around her house because she is afraid that something could happen to her and her little boy. Doña Claudia Josefina has had her beauty salon for more than six years, this is the source of income that she has to support her family, as she is a single mother and she wants the best for her family. She plans to repay this loan with part of the income from her business. This photo is of Claudia's sister who works in the salon, when FVP loan officers went to visit Claudia she was out buying products that she needed for the salon.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence around her house

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió superior completo, se dedica a la compra y  venta de ladrillos.

Nelly nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar mas mercadería y así aumentar su capital y ganancias

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda mas grande de productos para la construcción.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nelly, 39, has been a member of the "Brisas del Lago" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in the district, province and department of Puno. She is married and has two children. She finished high school and she is a brick merchant. Nelly tells us that she used her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement in increase her capital. She now needs 3000 new soles to buy more merchandise and thus increase her capital and profits. Her dream for the future is to have a larger building supplies store. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of butter, rice, beans, coffee, sugar, bread, cookies, soup, pasta, soap, cleaning supplies, bateries, flashlights, flour and corn flour, and wheat, chiles, juice, milk, bug spray, condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finishing the interior and exterior of his house

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la venta de comida, a su vez a la compra y venta de golosinas y refrescos.

Benita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella requiere un nuevo crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar arroz, fideos, galletas, dulces etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de préstamo y la rapidez de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Benita, 37, has been a member of the "Manuela Ramos" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has 5 children. She finished elementary school and sells prepared meals as well as sweets and soft-drinks. Benita tells us that she used her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now needs funding in the amount of 1000 new soles to buy rice, pasta, cookies, candies, etc. Her dream for the future is to work more efficiently to help her business grow. What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease and speed in getting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, cookies, candies, sugar.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 25 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a trabajar en su peluquería y paralelamente a la venta de lácteos, ambas actividades lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a ser chofer de su propio motocarro. Sandra forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de lácteos.
Ahora ella necesita 1300 soles, que será invertido una parte en la compra de lácteos y la otra parte en artículos para su peluquería. La meta de Sandra es tener un salón de belleza bien implementado.
texts.en:
Sandra, 25, is an enterprising and hard-working woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She has two, minor children and she works in her beauty salon as well as sells dairy products; both activities occur in her home. Her husband, who is a taxi driver, supports her work endeavors. Sandra has been a member of the "Damas de Oriente" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy dairy products. She now needs 1300 soles to buy dairy products and items for her beauty salon. Sandra's goal is to have a well-equipped beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products and items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Rocio pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 47 años es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.
 
Rocio es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se las ingenio para hacer su propio negocio de venta de chocolates, nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella misma elabora las chocotejas (La chocoteja es un delicioso y agradable chocolate, inventado en el Perú). La socia también se dedica a la venta de juguetes de recreación en la puerta del colegio “Uriel Garcia” del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al negocio de venta de chocolates y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como chocolate, manjar, envoltura y moldes para los chocolates.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Rocio is a part of the Communal Bank “COMUZONE” of Asociación Arariwa. She is 47 years old and has three children. Rocio is a hardworking and enterprising mother who supports her family and has the ingenuity to create her own business of selling chocolates. She told a loan officer that she makes the "chocotejas" (A delicious and enjoyable chocolate invented in Peru). She also sells toys at the entrance of the Uriel Garcia high school in Cusco. She has had the chocolate sale business for four years which has done well thanks to the efforts that she puts into her work. Rocio will use this loan to buy ingredients like chocolate, manjar (caramel), wrappers and molds for the chocolates. She is grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and she is committed to keep the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like chocolate, manjar, wrappers and moldes for the chocolate

loans.name: Zully

texts.es: Zully, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Zully forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de prendas de vestir, ahora ella necesita otro crédito de 300 soles, que será invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor. La meta de zully es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir bien implementado y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zully is a very punctual woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She doesn't have any children. She sells clothing in her house. Her husband supports her work endeavors. Zully has been a member of the "Damas de Oriente" communal bank for a year. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy clothing. She now needs another, 300 sol, loan to buy clothing at wholesale. Zully's goal is to have a well-stocked clothing store to produce higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Santos Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Catalina F. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el barrio Flor del Campo de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Santos se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que tiene de realizar hace varios años atras, Santos se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar a hacer su produccion diaria de tortillas. las tortillas tienen que estar listas a las 6 de la mañana porque a esa hora sale a venderlas en varios lugares cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
este alimento es un acompañante en los tres tiempos de comida en la zona en donde ella vive, es por eso que tienen que estar temprano para poder venderlas para el desayuno. 
Santos necesita el credito para comprar mas maiz, leña, cal y agua para tener una mayor produccion ya que ahora tiene que producir mas porque sus clientes le estan haciendo pedidos mas grandes.
dice sentirse feliz porque este nuevo año le esta pidiendo mas tortillas y asi tendra mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos Catalina F. is 34, and she lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Santos has been making and selling tortillas for several years. Santos gets up at four every morning to start her daily tortilla production. The tortillas have to be ready by six in the morning because that is when she leaves to sell them at various places close to her home. This food accompanies the three daily meals in the area where she lives. That is why they need to be ready early, to be able to sell them for breakfast. Santos needs the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water in order to produce more. She now needs to produce more because her customers are making larger orders. She says that she is happy that they are ordering more tortillas in this new year. That way she will have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, lime, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desD. hace 4 meses, vive en 
el distrito D. Chucuito, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 07 hijos, D. ellos 3 se encuentran a su lado. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa y zapatos.

Anastacia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar ropa y zapatos.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse mejores cosas para su casa, hacer crecer su negocio y vivir tranquila. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Anastacia, 58, has been a member of the “Santa Bárbara 2” communal bank for 4 months. She lives in the Chucuito district, Puno province and department. She is married and has 7 children, 3 of whom are still with her. She finished elementary school and she is a clothing and shoes merchant. Anastacia tells us that she used her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital and buy more products. She now requests 500 new soles to buy clothing and shoes. Her dream for the future is to buy better things for her house, to see her business grow, and to live in peace. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Dina Nora

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 10 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de calzado.

Dina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar zapatos y zapatillas de diversas tallas y modelos.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las compañeras.
texts.en:
Dina, 30, has been a member of the "Alto Alianza" communal bank for 10 years. She lives in the Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is married and has 3 children. She finished elementary school and she is a shoe merchant. Dina tells us that her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement increased her capital and she bought more products. She is now asking for 800 new soles to buy shoes and sandals in various sizes and styles. Her dream for the future is to have her business grow and together get ahead with her family. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia, es una mujer responsable, muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes (gaseosas y néctar), esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es empleado de una empresa. Ofelia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de gaseosas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1700 soles, que será invertido en la compra de bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Ofelia es tener una distribuidora de bebidas refrescantes bien implementada donde pueda generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 46, is a responsible, very dynamic, woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has two adult children. She sells refreshing beverages (soft-drinks and fruit nectars) in her home. Her husband, who is employed by a firm, supports her work endeavors. Ofelia has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for three years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, she needs 1700 soles to buy refreshing beverages. Ofelia's goal is to have a well-stocked beverage distribution center where she can generate higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages.

loans.name: Guldane

texts.en: Guldane I. is a 55-year-old retired accountant. Ten years ago, Guldane started keeping poultry, and her geese and chickens are most popular in the area where she’s living.  Guldane is married and has three children. She works hard to provide them with the best education and make savings from all her income. But it is very hard to cover the basic needs of her family and at the same time put some money aside. Her profit is small and just enough for food. Guldane applied for a 1200 AZN loan to purchase more poultry and increase her income. Let's do our best to help this hard-working woman.

loans.use: purchase more chickens and geese to increase profit

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
 
Maria es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la municipalidad del Cusco en el proyecto “Retama” (Referencia tecnológica apropiados para el Medio Ambiente). La socia nos cuenta que en sus horas libres vende vinos que le manda su hija de la ciudad de Ica y por campaña escolar vende mochilas. Ya son nueve años que se dedica al negocio de venta de mochilas y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mochilas y útiles escolares. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 45, married, and has four children. Maria is a hard-working entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead. She works in the Cusco municipality on the Retama Project (a project to get the general population to participate in correct waste management). She tells us that during her free time she sells wines that her daughter, who lives in the city of Ica, sends her. During the school year she sells backpacks. She has been selling backpacks for nine years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy more backpacks and school supplies. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy backpacks and school supplies

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, se dedica a la compra y venta de jabones, detergentes y otros.

Hermelinda nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar detergente, jabón, jaboncillo.

Ella requiere un nuevo crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar jabon, detergente, cuchillos, champú, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda de chifles y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 33, has been a member of the “La Juleñita” communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has 2 children. She did not complete secondary school and she sells soaps, detergents and other products. Hermelinda tells us that with her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to increase her capital and buy detergent and soap. She needs a new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy soap, detergent, knives, shampoo, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a fried plantains store and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, detergent, knives, shampoo.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Vanessa es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 1 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de animales.

Vanessa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para comprar ganado.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio  y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las participaciones de cada socia en las capacitaciones que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 22, has been a member of the "Alto Alianza" communal bank for a year. She lives in Yunguyo district and province, Puno department. She is married and has no children. She completed secondary school and raises cattle. Vanessa tells us that her first, 500 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy cattle. She now requests 800 new soles to buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to see her business grow so that her family can make progress with it. What she likes best about her communal bank is the participation of each member and the training they get.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Buenaventura pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 65 años y es casada. 
 
Buenaventura es una madre trabajadora y se dedica alquilar habitaciones D. su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al servicio D. alquilar habitaciones y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar uso personal desea comprar medicamentos. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Buenaventura belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 65 and married. Buenaventura is a hard-working mother. She rents out rooms in her house. She has been renting rooms for several years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan for personal use; she wants to buy medicine. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine for personal use

loans.name: Clara Quispe

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos.
 
Clara es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y después D. hacer sus actividades del hogar atienD. su tienda D. venta D. comestibles. Ya son 8 meses que se dedica al negocio D. venta D. comestibles y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leches, gaseosas y cervezas.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clara belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 49, married, and has six children. Clara is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead. She gets up very early to do her household chores. For example, she makes breakfast for her children. After her household chores, she tends her grocery store. She has been in the business of selling food for eight months. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy food like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, and beer. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Salemalama

texts.en:
Salemalama P. is 33 and married with 2 children (ages 3-months and 6).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Salemalama has 4 years of experience in this business.  Salemalama needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Salemalama joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Salemalama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Salemalama P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.54 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.55 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

Lima needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 255 tala or US $106 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Lima joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lima's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

Moevao needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 355 tala or US $148 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Tineimu has 6 years of experience in this business.  Tineimu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl H. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actual mente están estudiando.
Con unos ahorros que tenía empezó la construcción de un cuarto mas para la vivienda, pero le esta haciendo falta colocar el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
El está solicitando el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en  el departamento de producción. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Raúl H. is the head of a household and he has 3 adolescent children who are currently in school. With some savings he began building an additional room onto his home, but he still needs to add the roof. He wants to build the roof from a concrete slab, so that it will be more secure and durable. He is requesting a loan for this construction, and he plans to pay if off with the income that he earns working in the production department of a factory. He wants his children to have their own room so that they can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a concrete roof

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Nohemi S. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a que su negocio creciera más. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación en este otro crédito para comprar mercancía que le esta haciendo falta y que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ya que es la tienda de abarrotes de la colonia.   
Entre Doña Nohemi y  su esposo el señor el Federico Mascorro, son los que atiende el negocio.Planea pagar este crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nohemi S. is very grateful for your cooperation in a previous loan which helped her to grow her business. She is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise that she needs and that her customers have been asking her to sell, since her business is the neighborhood grocery store. Both Nohemi and her husband, Federico Mascorro, attend to the business. She plans to pay off this loan with the earnings that she gets from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Lorena G. y su esposo el señor José Antonio Puentes, tiene ya mas de diez años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de tacos.
Pero en este momento tiene un problema que la camioneta que utilizan para estar la venta se les descompuso, es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y planean pagarlo con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.  
Desean tener su camioneta listo lo mas pronto posible ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor José Antonio Puentes, esposo de la señora Blanca Lorena, ya que ella se encontraba en comprar las cosas para la venta de tacos.
texts.en:
Blanca Lorena Gonzalez and her husband, José Antonio Puentes, have been making and selling tacos for more than 10 years. Recently, however, the truck they use to transport the necessary merchandise for their business has broken down. The couple are, therefore, asking for a loan and plan to repay it using the profits made from their business. They both hope the truck is repaired as soon as possible since their taco-selling business provides the principal means of household income. The photo is of Blanca’s husband, Jose Antonio Puentes. Blanca is absent from the photo as she is busy procuring the necessary goods for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the truck that is used to transport merchandise for business

She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 tala or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, May joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are May's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.name: Esvin

texts.es:
El señor Esvin N. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Esta solicitando un crédito para colocar una techo de concreto al frente de la casa ya que tiene nietos pequeños y quieren salir a jugar. 
Don Esvin trabaja para una compañía de gasolina en el departamento de despachador, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito. Ya que su hija la señorita Nancy N. se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso que obtiene como asesora de servicios de una compañía de autos. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señorita Nancy N., hija del señor Esvin, ya que el se encontraba en horario de trabaja cuando se realizo la visita.
texts.en:
Señor Esvin N. has already had four loans through FVP, all of which he has repaid punctually. He is requesting a loan to build a concrete roof out in front of the house, because he has small nephews who want to go out and play. Don Esvin works as a dispatcher for a gasoline company, he will use this income to repay his loan. His daughter, Nancy N., is also responsible for family expenses from her income as service consultant for an auto company. Nancy N., daughter of Señor Esvin, is the person who appears in the photo, since the visit was during his working hours.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing for the patio in front of the house

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Lorenzo G. le está haciendo falta el techo de enfrente de la vivienda ya que el actual está en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidenté a su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder poner el techo de concreto para que sea más duradero y segura para sus hijos. 
Don Lorenzo tiene mas de diez años con su negocio de herrería, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The roof on the front of Lorenzo G.'s house is in such poor condition that he is afraid his family could be injured by it. For this reason he is asking for funding to install a concrete roof that will last longer and be safer for his children. Lorenzo has had an iron-working shop for over 10 years and this is his family's sole source of income. He will use part of his earnings to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front of the house.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina R. tiene ya más de siete años de dicandose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poner le vitropiso en el negocio, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de abarrotes en general. 
Desea que su negocio tenga una mejor presentación y así sus clientes se sentirán con más confianza para ir a comprar.
texts.en:
Guillermina R. has had a grocery store for over 7 years. She is asking for funding to install tile flooring in her store because she doesn't have enough capital to make this improvement. She plans to repay the loan with some of her profits from the store. She wants her store to be more presentable so that her customers will feel more attracted to buy from her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou S., 49, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a construction worker in the city, earning US$2 per day.

S. has a business producing doormats at her home, and she is able to earn US$3 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2008.

S. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her products

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Marilou is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables. Marilou has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house and to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

texts.en: Suorng R. is a farmer who has raised many types of crops on her land since early 2000. She also buys rice in bulk when prices are low and sells it when prices are high. She was married, but divorced her husband when their three children were veR. young. One of her children now helps support the family by working in construction, while other two attend school. Recently Suorng R. has lacked sufficient funds to buy rice for resale, and has applied for this loan to make these rice purchases possible.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Ms. Juliana P. is 48 years old, single and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. For the last five years, she has operated her shop even in hard times, and has consistently earned enough money to help support other family members, such as her parents and siblings and their respective families. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she was interested in the products and services we offer and aware of an award our organization won in 2006. She has applied for her first loan, for PHP 7,000, to expand her store. She will also use the income made possible by this loan to meet her daily needs, pay bills and set money aside for the future. She is committed to see her business continue to grow and develop.

loans.use: to expand a sari-sari (or variety) store

loans.name: Tenisi

texts.en:
Tenisi A. is 73 and married with 7 children (ages 16 - 34years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  Tenisi has 5 years of experience in this business.  Tenisi needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Tenisi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tenisi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tenisi A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.89 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.99 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.99 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Mrs. On Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. On D. leads a loan group made up of 14 people who hope to use their funds in maN. different ways. All of the members live in Preaek Khmaer village in Kandal province. Mrs. On D. is a farmer who owns a plot of land. Her husband, Mr. Thy Chum, is a fisherman who makes a small income. Although they tried to save some money to plant a crop this year, they were unable to do so. That is why Mrs. On D. has decided to apply for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and fuel. This couple has four children, all of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and fuel.

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Ernalyn E. is 35 years old, married, and lives in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Tomas E., who is a farmer and laborer. They have been blessed with a child, who is now in elementary school. Mrs. E. has helped her husband support their child by running a sari-sari (or variety) store. Her business has done well for more than three years, and she is earning enough money to meet her goals. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she was interested in the products and services we offer, and aware of an award we won in 2006. She has applied for a new loan, for PHP 4,000, to expand her store, care for her child, and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to improve her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina G. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marina has recently opened a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and other products in the local community. 

Last year, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mrs. Savin Sareun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin S., 39 years old, is a village bank president. She has three children who attend the local school.  This village bank loan will be shared by 25 members who all live in Tauth Ma village in Kandal province, and will be used for different purposes by the borrowers. 

Mrs. Savin S. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Man Mak, is a farmer and fisherman.  This famiL. works hard in their field and business, but still need additional money to support the famiL.. Mrs. Savin S. has applied for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell.

loans.use: To apply for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell

Asufaaniutu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 25 tala or US $10 per week) to improve/expand the business.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita T. is from the village of Caputol. She is thirty-eight years old. Juvita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juvita owns and operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle-for-hire) business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Juvita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Juvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Juvita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service to her customers. This loan will be the eighth loan Juvita has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan is for a group of twenty-two people who all live in Taok Ma Village in Kandal Province. The other members of the loan selected Mrs. Phal M., who is thirty-seven years old, to be the president of the village bank. All of the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Phal M. is a farmer who owns a piece of land for growing rice to make a living. Her husband, Mr. Sok San, is a construction laborer. In the rice plantation, Mrs. Phal M. has a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, Mrs. Phal M. decided to apply for a loan so she can hire laborers to harvest the rice field. The couple has four children; one is employed in a garment factory, two are attending the local public school, and the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice field.

texts.en:
Mersulita P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is forty-four years old. Mersulita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mersulita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish in the local community. Mersulita is just starting this business.

Mersulita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mersulita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is forty-eight years old. Cecilia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing party services to local community members. Cecilia earns approximately 500 PHP daily for these activities.

In 2009, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan Cecilia has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
Momoe S. is 25 and married with 1 child (11 monthsold).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Momoe has 3 years of experience in this business.  Momoe needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 tala or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Momoe joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Momoe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Momoe S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.12 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.52 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous S. O. is a young married woman who currently cares for a small kid. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for the family. At present, she buys and sells grocery items in the busy local market and earns $4 each day. Also, she relies on income from her husband, who works in the construction field. 

Rous S. O. has an older house that is surrounded by pollution affecting her health and her daily living conditions. Therefore, she has requested a loan to clean up and repair her house. With any remainder from the loan, she intends to increase her inventory for grocery sales.

loans.use: To clean up and repair a house
