loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona J. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is thirty-three years old. Rona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan Rona has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. P. Mom is twenty-nine years old and she lives in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pheng Non, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this farming, they now face small problem because their field is infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. P. Mom is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field. With the remaining funds from the loan, she will buy pesticides and gasoline. Aside from farming, she is a Khmer noodle seller who can earn a small income to help her family. Mrs. P. Mom is a mother of two children who are too young to study or work. Mrs. P. Mom was busy with her work so her husband, Mr. Pheng Non, came to take out the loan on her behalf.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field and to buy pesticides and gasoline.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap K. is 39 years old and she lives in Melong Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Vann Cheam, sells candy. Since his business is going well, he wants to sell candy door to door. Thus, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a small cart for him to use to sell candy in the local village. Mrs. Pheap K. is a mother of three children who all attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell candy.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo K. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Paulo is single. To make a living, Paulo owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport to passengers in the local community. Paulo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paulo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulo is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Paulo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Mrs. Hok Peach is 58 years old and lives in Melong Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. She has a small problem because her field is infertile and her field is far from the irrigation system. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a water machine. With the rest of the loan, she would buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She also makes Khmer cakes to earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Hok Peach is widow with six children. One of her children is a laborer in Korea, two others are farmers and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, a water machine and pesticides.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun S. is 58 years old and lives in Dak Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her coconut business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to sell. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a cart for transporting her coconuts to sell door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Touch Nget, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to help his family. Mrs. Yun S. is the mother of two children. One of the children sells coconuts and the other sells clothes in the local market. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and a cart for selling door-to-door

loans.name: Mrs. Lon Mea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon M. is a village bank president in Prey Pnhi village in Takeo province. This village bank consists of 11 people.  Mrs. Lon M. is a silk weaver and her husband, Mr. Ney N., is a construction laborer in the local village. He also catches a little fish to sell to support his family. In order to expand his fishing business, Mrs. Lon M. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to make fishing tools to catch more fish to sell for more income. 
Mrs. Lon M. is 31 years old and the mother of three children who are all too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy bamboos to make fishing tools

To make a living, Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food & daily use products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. loans.name: Me

texts.en: C. is 37 years old and resides in Takmao, the capital of Cambodia. To earn a living, C. sells fresh fish that she either buys in bulk from her suppliers or gets from her husband who fishes at the river. This couple has two children; both are students and depend on their parent’s money. C. and her family’s daily living situation is not comfortable because their old house needs repair and some changes. Because of this problem, C. is applying for a Kiva loan of $1,200 through HKL. She will replace the broken part of her existing house and build a restroom for the family.

loans.use: To replace the broken part of her existing house and build a restroom

texts.en: Chona O. runs a travelling beauty salon, focusing mostly on manicures and pedicures. She is 47 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental and visits her clients' homes around her village. She can be seen on the right in the photo with her client as well as one of her children (who was extremely insistent on being part of the picture!). Chona has been providing her services for 25 years now and earns 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She joined PMPC in 2008 and previously took out a loan of 5,000 PHP. This is her third loan cycle. She is now requesting another loan of 5,000 PHP. She intends to use this loan to buy more supplies for her business. She will use the profits to repay the loan and, hopefully, to make sure she can put enough away to continue sending her children to school. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her travelling manicuring/beauty salon business

loans.name: Ieni

texts.en:
Ieni P. is 20 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, raising cattle for sale.  Ieni has many years of experience in this business.  Ieni needs a loan of WST $1500 to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 tala or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Ieni joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ieni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ieni P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Um Nak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Um N. is village bank president. Her village bank loan group consists of 14 people who live in PraSat Village in Takeo Province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sa Um N. is 41 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Sa Um N. is a farmer who grows rice on a plot of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Sovann Tous, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family. Although she and her family work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cattle-breeding business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., age 51, is a widow and the mother of a married daughter. Her daughter, who still lives with her at home, works for a private company and provides her with a small income to meet her family’s food needs. 

Pen S. is an internal staff member for a company and earns a salary of $250 per month. She now has a problem with transportation. She takes a taxi to work because she doesn’t own a vehicle. She is requesting a Kiva loan of $800 to buy a used motorcycle so she can ride to her workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en:
Inosia P. is 44 and married with 6 children (ages 15 - 27 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Inosia has 5 years of experience in this business.  Inosia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Inosia joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Inosia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Inosia P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maria Leanie

texts.en:
Maria Leanie A. operates a fishing business. She is 42 years old and married, and she has six children, all of whom are school-aged. Her fishing business is only a year old and she earns PHP 500 per month from her business. She joined PMPC in 2009 and has since taken out one loan from PMPC. She is currently requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. 

Maria plans to use her loan to buy more equipment for her fishing business. She then wants to use her profits to save and repay her loans and she hopes  to see her children as university-educated professionals one day. 

In the photo, Maria Leanie is shown with a foam case that she uses to carry fish and a fish scale, both of which she wants to update to improve her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk S., 50, is married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children. Her son graduated from school and works as an office employee in a private port. Her daughter is studying in the university. To earn a living, she built a grocery shop under her wooden house. She sells different types of grocery items to her nearby neighbors for a profit. Ouk S. hopes to earn additional income by starting a tailoring service, but this service requires a sewing machine. Because of her lack of money, she is looking for a loan to purchase the sewing machine. With the remaining loan money, she will buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma Comeda is 45 years old and married with two adult children. She has been raising pigs for three years now – an enterprise she enjoys very much. Thelma started out with two pigs; now she has seven and she earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She lives in the village of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Thelma joined PMPC in 2007. She has taken out a previous loan from PMPC of 3,000 PHP and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. Thelma plans to use her loan to buy another pig and more hog-fattening products for her pigs. Although she currently lives in a hut by the sea, Thelma would like to build a better house for herself and her husband one day. She hopes that she can use the profits from her business to do just that. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy one more pig and more hog-fattening products

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Ly Kuoy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Ly K. is 40 years old and she is a village-bank president. This village-bank loan consists of eight people who all live in Ang Roveay village in the Takeo province. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Koem Ly Kouy is the mother of five children, two of whom are silk weavers while the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Koem Ly Kouy is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to cultivate rice. Aside from her plantation, she is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy silks to weave. Her husband, Mr. Un Oeun, is a traditional singer who is invited to sing in wedding ceremonies and parties. All the members are shown in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy silks to weave

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Бобиева Саодатхон проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее техническое образование. Бобиева Саодатхон работает более чем 6 лет в области торговли. Она покупает вещи и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет на увеличение товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saodatkhon B. lives in the Khroson region. She's thirty-seven, married with four children, and has a secondary technical education. She's been a vendor for over six years, buying merchandise and reselling it from her own stand. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthoeun Thun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthoeun Thun is 36 years old and lives in Russei Srok village in the Kandal province. She is a group leader of five people who will be using the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Bunthoeun T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land with banana trees. Her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Bun, helps her with the farming. Although they try to work, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Bunthoeun T. is applying for a loan to buy more banana trees to grow. 

This couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy banana trees

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en: Emelie is 49 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are adults and one is school-aged (pictured). Emelie lives in the village of Danao, Plaridel. Emelie has owned and operated a sari-sari or grocery store for 30 years and she earns 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from her business. Emelie joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, in 2006 and has taken out a previous loan of P20,000. This is her seventh loan from PMPC and she intends to use the loan primarily to purchase more stock for her store. She would also like to use the leftover amount from the loan to repair and enhance her bathroom. Emelie also plans to save the proceeds for her bathroom project, to purchase food for daily consumption and to start saving for Christmas gifts for her family! About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for her store and use the remaining balance for repairing her toilet

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mrs.Yeng T. is 48 years old and lives in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of six children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another two are students in the local school and the youngest are too young to study or work.

Mrs. Yeng T. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field for cultivating rice. She has a problem with the farming because her field has infertile soil. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, using the rest of the loan to hire a laborer to plow. Her husband, Mr. Vith Vark, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire a laborer to plow

loans.name: Vouch Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vouch Heang C. lives in Mok Sinath village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough water to support the field. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer while with the rest of the loan she will hire a water machine to water her crops.

Her husband, Mr. Sinart Mok, is a farmer who is shown on the right of the photo. Mrs. Vouch Heang C. is the mother of six children one of whom is a construction worker, another is a farmer while three are students in the local school and the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a water machine to water her crops.

loans.name: Bujjutabi Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Madinah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a married lady with four children aged one to ten years who are all in the primary section as she takes care of her parents. She has a retail shop in Nyenga trading centre that has been in existence for five years and although there is a lot of competition from all the other shops, she is able to make 70,000 UGX as profits every week.

Madinah hopes to become a wholesaler as well as educating her children for a brighter future. She needs a loan to be able to add more capital to her business to provide a steady supply of products. Madinah is such a determined lady.

loans.use: To recapitalize her shop with more goods that will bring in more profits.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry C. is the group leader of four people who will all use the loan for different purposes. She is 38 years old and lives in Preak Char village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.6-hectare field where she cultivates both rice and vegetables. She faces a problem with the farming as  her field has infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. 

With the rest of the loan, she will buy gasoline for her water machine to water her crops. Her husband, Mr. Chanthy Huy, is a construction worker who earns a small income to help his family. Mrs. Ry C. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her water machine to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie V. runs a fishing business. She is 28 years old, married and has two children who are currently attending school. She lives in the village of Lao Sta Cruz in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental and has been fishing for two years now. She earns about P15,000 a month in the business.

Elvie joined PMPC in 2008. She was interested in the various products and services offered, as well as the opportunity to expand her business. She has taken out a previous loan of P15,000 and is now at her fourth loan with PMPC. Elvie is requesting a loan of P30,000 and looks forward to using the loan proceeds to purchase more equipment for her fishing business. She hopes to use her profits to repay her loan, as well as to make sure she can provide for her children. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for her fishing business

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn Y. is 47 years old and lives in Sambour village in the Takeo province. She is a group leader of five people who will all use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhorn Y. and her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Thuch, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this farm, Mrs. Sokhorn Y. now faces a small problem because her field has a lot of insects; thus, she is requesting a loan to buy pesticides to kill all the insects. She will use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline for her watering machine. This couple has a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and to buy gasoline for her watering machine

loans.name: Tusuubira Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Kulusum is 40 years old and a single mother of five children aged 22 – 12 years. They are all in secondary and primary schools. She also takes care of other siblings. Kulusum has a retail shop in Lugazi central market from which she is able to make 150,000/= profit a week although there is a lot of competition from other retailers. She is grateful for her loans and the good customer care she gives her clients. These have made her successful. She hopes to turn her shop into a wholesale shop for better sales and more profits as well as making personal businesses for her children and siblings since she is divorced. Kulusum needs a loan to be able to buy more shop items to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Меликова Зебунисо проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 38 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Меликова Зебунисо работает более чем 4 лет в области торговли. Она покупает товар и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zebuniso M., a thirty-eight-year-old widow with two children, lives in the Khuroson region. She has a secondary education. For over four years she has worked in sales, buying merchandise to sell from her stand. She'll use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 30 years old. Charlene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Charlene owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charlene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Charlene from HSPFI.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rhyan

texts.en:
Rhyan is 19 years old and married. He is from Danao in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. His principal business is fish vending and trading, weighing and selling the fish he buys using the scale and foam box pictured. He's been doing this for four months now. He earns about P2,000 from his business.

Rhyan joined PMPC four months ago. A neighbor told him about their products and services, as well as their ability to help him start  his business. He took out his first loan of P3,000 and now is taking a loan of P10,000. He plans to use his loan proceeds to buy more foam boxes for his fish vending business and will use the profits to help support his mother financially.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy more foam boxes for fish vending business

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Бобоева Улан проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Бобоева Улан работает более чем 14 лет в области торговли. Она покупает товар и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ulan B., 46, lives in the Khuroson region and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. For more than 14 years she's been a vendor, buying merchandise to sell from her stand. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Rolenda

texts.en:
Ma. Rolenda L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Ma. Rolenda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Rolenda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ma. Rolenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Rolenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Rolenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Rolenda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Rolenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Suom

texts.en: Suom P., 50, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has three children who are married and live independently, and the other two live at home and are local carpenters. Her husband is a builder and is also hired by people to build their new houses. Suom P. plants rice and vegetable crops on her land next to her house, from which she earns a daily income. Every year she always farms a rice crop that she sets as her annual business, and harvests at least two times per year. This great season of harvesting has arrived and Suom P.'s crop has matured. Suom P. lacks the money to hire laborers to harvest her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL. She proposes to use the remaining loan to buy piglets to breed in order to get extra income.

loans.use: To hire laborers.

loans.name: Zonie

texts.en:
Zonie L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old. Zonie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Zonie owns & operates a business selling snacks, processed food, fruit juices and soft drinks in the local community. Zonie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zonie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make his products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zonie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mischel

texts.en:
Mischel S. is 26 years old and married with three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has owned and operated her fishing business for seven years with her husband. She is pictured above holding her walkie-talkie while her boat on the left of the picture is anchored in the background. Mischel earns P2,000 a month from her business. 

Mischel joined PMPC in 2007 and has taken out a previous loan of P10,000. This is her second loan, again in the amount of P10,000. She wants to use the loan proceeds to repair her fishing boat and to make some additional improvements. Mischel intends to use the profits from her business to repair her house. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat and make additional improvements

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mrs. Kuch K., 28, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few chickens in a stall at her home. She is married to Som Nang, age 37, who assists her in the business. (Kuch K. was busy working in the field when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.) The couple has been married for years but they do not have a child. To improve her poultry trade, Kuch K. is taking out her first loan to purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.use: To purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Marcelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $88 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Marcelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marcelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to advance her undertaking. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is 44 years old, currently single and has three school-aged children. She lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Grace has a fishing business, which she has owned and operated for twenty years now. She earns about $337 a month from her fishing business. Grace is pictured above with the battery engine for her fishing boat which, she says, no longer works very well, and she would very much like to replace. 

Grace joined PMPC in 2008 and has taken our a previous loan of 7,000 PHP. She is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP and would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a new battery and other equipment to enhance her fishing boat. She is planning to use the profits to pay back her loan. She is also trying to save some money so that she can renovate her house sometime in the future. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy a new battery and other equipment for her fishing boat

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en:
Presentation G. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Presentation is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Presentation owns and operates a weaving business. She sells specialty hand-woven products called "nipa hut" (products woven from the leaves of the Nipa palm) in the local community. Presentation has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $25 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Presentation joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Presentation has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to broaden her efforts.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Or M. was born in 1956. She is a widow and mother of five children. One of her children is married and started a new home. Or M. has a son who helps provide for the family’s food by driving a trailer-taxi and a daughter who assists her in selling clothing. To earn a living, Or M. rents a simple place at a reasonable price located outside the local market, where she sells used clothes to people who come to buy everything they need at the market. She is able to make $6 each day, which is her great contribution to her family. Or M. wants a loan to buy a sewing machine so she can either repair her clothes or sew sets of new clothes.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en:
A seaman’s wife with a passion for cooking and food processing is our featured entrepreneur in this story. She is Mrs. Vanessa Claire L., 29 years of age, married and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. They were blessed with two children, one who is now three years old and the other only nine months. 

Vanessa is skilled at cooking, so she decided to open a restaurant at the city food court. At the same time, she provides catering services for birthdays, weddings, anniversaries and other occasions. 

For her, it is better to earn on her own rather than depending on her husband’s allotment every month. For seven years she has been able to manage her business, and now she is earning an average net income of not less than $220 a month. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and in our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. Paglaum MPC received an award for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

As a 5th cycle loaner, Vanessa has the privilege of borrowing 50,000 PHP to add to her capital for her eatery business and catering services. She is hoping that her business will continue to prosper. She is also happy that she was able to give employment to jobless friends and relatives.

loans.use: Additional capital for her eatery business and catering services

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

("Polvoron" is a common dessert in the Philippines, a powdered milk candy similar to shortbread.) Perla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for making polvoron. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has been working as a sewer since 1996. He repairs and produces all types of clothes. Mahmoud decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and likes sewing. He is exceptional in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. However, at first he had some difficulty building networking, to make himself known to the public.

Mahmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine for his work, which will allow him to improve his productivity. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for his work.

loans.name: Chheurn

texts.en: A small wooden house located in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province belongs to Mr. Chheurn K., age 26. He lives with his two school-aged kids and his wife, who works in the garment industry. From day to day, Chheurn K. works on his farm, planting rice and vegetable crops which he will sell to buyers when they are matured. In the past, Chheurn K. has hired a villager’s cow to plow his land but now he wants to reduce this expenses by taking out a loan to buy his own cow to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow his field.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
With excellent skills in dressmaking, house curtains and accessories-making, Mrs. Rosalinda T. is our featured entrepreneur. She is 50 years of age, married and a resident of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She and her spouse, Cristito, a skilled cutter and tailor, and at the same time her partner, have been able to maintain and make progress in their business for sixteen years. At this time the couple is earning an average net income of not less than $117 a month, this being the minimal amount only during recession time.  

Rosalinda joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she was very much interested in our products and services and for being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. Paglaum MPC was awarded for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award in 2006. 

As a 4th time loaner, and with an excellent credit record, Rosalinda was given the privilege to apply for the same amount as her previous loan (15,000 PHP) to add to her capital for her dress shop business. She is hoping that they can expand their dress shop to other cities and also be able to send her child on to college for a good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her dresshop business
