loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is 32 years old. She is an Igbo by tribe but she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children. Three of her children are in nursery and primary school, while her eldest child just gained admission into secondary school. Ifeoma owns a grocery store where she sells drinks and groceries such as biscuits, wine, noodles, candies, and body and hair creams. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old and married with two children, ages nine and four and half. Both of the children are attending school. He is a dairy farmer in Kilima in the Central Province of Kenya. He's been in the business for twenty years and sells his milk at the local market and through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns income from small-scale farming of tea, passion fruit, and vegetables. He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 20,000 to purchase a chuff cutter, a device used to cut feed for dairy cows. 

In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming and milk production by increasing his number of dairy cows and expand into poultry farming. He hopes that he will not always be struggling to provide for his family.

About Juhudi Kilimo:

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya. It has a unique approach to financing agribusiness value chains, from production of raw products to processing and delivery of goods: by providing asset financing and technical assistance funding to smallholder farmers and rural enterprises. This approach to poverty alleviation supports sustainable wealth creation in rural communities, establishes local engines of income generation, and generates employment, economic growth and dynamism as well as demand for inputs.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter to cut fodder

loans.name: Arouna Sékinatou

texts.fr: Cette dame habite  dans le quartier d’agoè zélikpato avec son époux et ses 06 enfants. Son mari est un mécanicien et son revenu ne leur permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, pour l’aider elle s’est engagée dans le commerce de bois de chauffage depuis 1996, elle y a associé plus tard la vente de maïs. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de 02 tas de bois de chauffage et 08 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This mother of six children and her husband live in the Zelikpato neighborhood of Agoe. Her husband is a mechanic and his earnings do not completely cover all the family expenses. To help, Arouna Sékinatou started selling firewood in 1996 and then later went into the business of selling corn. Facing a shortage of supplies, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 2 loads of firewood and 8 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of firewood and corn

loans.name: Abdumurod

texts.ru: Кенджаев Абдумурод проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Кенджаев Абдумурод имеет среднее образование. В области животноводства он работает 3 года. Кенджаев Абдумурод откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
K. Abdumurod lives in the Khuroson region. He's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. K. Abdumurod has a high school education. He has been breeding cattle for three years. He fattens and then sells the cattle. He's asking for a loan in order to buy new cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther has a restaurant and bar where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian dishes. She started this business three years ago and she says the major challenge she is facing is insufficient capital to expand her business. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is an architect and he also supports the home. She is an LAPO client (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa). She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Guinassoa

texts.fr:
Cette femme a une formation de secrétaire, mais son revenu étant insuffisant, elle a abandonné son emploi en 2006 pour se lancer dans le commerce de détail de pagnes, chaussures, sacs dames, mèches et autres. Ce commerce lui a réussit très bien et elle a gagné de nouveaux clients grâce à son dynamisme. Elle fait face en ce moment à une demande élevée. Pour pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 05 lots de pagnes Hi Target, 15 sacs dames, 20 paires de chaussures, 03 lots de mèches et divers.
Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who was trained as a secretary, but her income was not sufficient. She quit her job in 2006 in order to start a business selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), shoes, women's handbags, hair extensions, and other items. This business is succeeding very well for her and she has gained a lot of customers thanks to her dynamism. She's currently facing high demand. In order to satisfy all her customers, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy five batches of pagnes "Hi Target", 15 handbags, 20 pairs of shoes, 3 batches of hair extensions, and various other items. She's married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 batches of pagnes, 15 handbags, 20 pairs of shoes, 3 batches of hair extensions, and other items

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
30-year-old Dan is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He works hard so he can provide, food, clothes and his family’s other needs. One of his motivations is his children’s future. He wants all of them to finish school and be successful someday. In farming, he experiences failures and successes, and accepts both as part of life.

Dan recently joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. He is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase farming needs like seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan will be really helpful to Dan’s farming.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Koubouratou

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve qui a un enfant à sa charge, l’activité génératrice de revenu  qu’elle exerce pour subvenir à ses charges et  à celles de son enfant est le commerce de détail de produits génériques auquel elle a associé le commerce de détail de trousseaux de bébé. Elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local  d’agoè. Son stock a diminué, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 06 cartons de produits génériques et 13 douzaines de trousseaux de bébé.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow with one child under her care. To meet her own needs and those of her child, she generates revenue through the retail of generic products, to which she has added the retail of baby layettes. She runs her business in the local market, Agoé. She needs to replenish her decreasing stock of merchandise, and therefore requests a loan from WAGES to buy six boxes of generic products and 13 dozen baby layettes.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy generic products and baby layettes

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a 37-year-old woman from a town in Agusan Del Sur, farms for a living. She has three children, and the oldest is only eleven years old. She plants rice and works all day to ensure that her crops are growing healthy. She works hard to provide food, clothes and her family’s other needs. She also wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

Melanie is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny is a Yoruba by tribe. He is 49 years old and is married to a Bini woman. They live in Benin City, Edo State. He has four children, and his eldest child is 18 years old. His children are still dependent on him and are in school. He is a LAPO client (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa). He is a printer and he also sells stationery and printing materials. Sunny is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more printing materials to improve his printing work. He hopes to become the CEO of a big publishing company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials to improve his printing work.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mr. Khuon L. is a farmer whose main activity is to cultivate rice. He has been working in the farming sector since he was single. Now he has a partner in his wife, who assists him in planting crops. (Khuon L. was busy working on his farm, so his wife is pictured instead.) This couple is married and has been blessed with five children, of whom two are living separately and others are employed as garment workers and fishermen. Khuon L. has a son who doesn’t have a job and he desires to encourage him to invest as a noodle seller, but he doesn’t have enough money to get started. Khuon L. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for his son to use as capital to begin a noodle sale enterprise.

loans.use: To begin a noodle sale enterprise.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children; the oldest is aged thirteen. She is involved in rice farming. Currently, she owns a hectare of rice field. She hopes that someday her farm will grow. She also shares that she is in need of capital right now. She asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use this loan to finance her farm. She will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Backatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de beignets appelés « KLUKLU » faite à base de farine de blé, d’huile et de sucre, ce beignet est très apprécié au Togo et est utilisé pour boire de la bouillie. Les matières premières qui interviennent dans la cuisson de ces beignets sont épuisées. Elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite son premier crédit pour l’achat de 10 sacs de farine de blé, 05 bidons d’huile, 04 sacs de sucres.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son époux est un instituteur.
texts.en:
This woman's business consists in selling fritters called "KLUKLU" and made out of wheat flour, oil, and sugar. This kind of fritters is very much appreciated in Togo, where they are used to drink porridge. Her stock of fritters ingredients has run out. She would like to resupply and she's seeking her first loan in order to buy 10 bags of wheat flour, 5 cans of oil, and 4 sacks of sugar. She's married and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of wheat flour, 5 cans of oil, and 4 sacks of sugar

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan is 36 years old. She is a Bini by tribe but she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She is married to an accountant and they have three children. Her children are still dependent on her and they are in school. Suzan owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks such as biscuits, wine, noodles, candies, body and hair creams, soft drinks and beer. She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: Née en 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, M. Nicole réside depuis trois ans à Dèkoungbé dans la commune d’Abomey-Calavi. Nicole est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Nicole vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Nicole est vendeuse de tubercules (localement appelés « Agonté ») et de noix de coco à son domicile, une activité qui lui permet d’assurer les charges familiales. Nicole vend aussi du maïs et de l’arachide, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Nicole s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Cococodji dans la commune d’Abomey-Calavi. Nicole exerce cette activité depuis 30 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité, Nicole ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus. Pour ce fait, Nicole sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face à ses différentes charges.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. M. Nicole has been living for three years in Dèkoungbé in the community of Abomey-Calavi.  She is a widow and the mother of five children, who are all in school and in her care.  Nicole lives alone with her children and is the sole provider for the family.  She sells tubers (locally called Agonté) and coconuts in her home.  This is a business that allows her to make sure that family expenses are covered.  She also sells corn and peanuts, and this allows her to diversify her revenue sources.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also at Cococodji in the community of Abomey-Calavi.  She has been in this business for thirty years.  Nicole is a past client of ALIDé who repays her loans.  Despite the passion she has for her work, she lacks enough funds to carry out her work and to earn more income for herself.  Because of this, Nicole is requesting a fourth loan to bolster her business in order to cope with her various responsibilities. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of "Agonté" tubers and some coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, containers of oil, boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Khoshimkul

texts.ru: Урозов Хошимкул проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Урозов Хошимкул имеет среднее образование. Работает более чем 7 лет в области животноводства. Урозов Хошимкул откармливает и продает скот. Берет кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Khoshimkul U. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 47 years old. Married with 3 children. Khoshimkul has a high-school level education. He has been working for over 7 years in livestock breeding. Khoshimkul fattens up and sells cattle. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is of the Bini tribe and she lives and works in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a hard-working and friendly woman. She is 34 years old and married, with a child. She owns a beer parlor where she sells drinks. She is also a hairstylist and she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more drinks as well as hair extensions to sell. She appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Tusuubira Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en: Yayeli K. is the leader of her loan group in Lugazi. She is divorced from her husband, with five children all still in school as she takes care of her other siblings. She is a business lady dealing in the sale of agricultural produce, although sometimes she is faced with the scarcity of the produce to sell due to the ever changing seasons. She says that she has found great value in her loans because they have enabled her to have enough stock as well as having quality produce to sell. She hopes to become a wholesaler in future so that she can supply to fellow traders as well as build a house for her children for comfort. Yayeli needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes, and greens for resale.

loans.use: To buy more matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and greens for resale.

loans.name: Murodbegim

texts.ru: Фозилова Муродбегим проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Фозилова Муродбегим работаеет в области торговли 2 года. Она приобритает товар и продает в своем собственном магазине. Кредит берет на приобритения тавара.
texts.en:
F. Murodbegim lives in the Khuroson region. She's thirty-nine years old, married and has three children. She has a high school education. F. has worked in the field of trade for two years. She buys goods and then resells them in her own store. She's requesting a loan to buy new goods.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.fr: V. Dorothée est née le 06 Février 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dorothée réside depuis 40 ans à Tonato, à Cotonou. Mariée à TCHENOU Théophile, un couturier, Dorothée est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Dorothée vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Dorothée est vendeuse de tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dorothée mène cette activité depuis cinq ans, une activité qui lui procure des revenus et lui permet de faire face à ses charges. Dorothée s’approvisionne à Missèbo à Cotonou, et à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Dorothée a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dorothée souhaite que son étalage s’accroisse davantage. Mais actuellement, Dorothée éprouve de difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C’est la raison pour laquelle Dorothée sollicite un second prêt afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et d’élargir son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
V. Dorothée was born on February 6, 1969 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  For forty years, she has been residing in Tonato, in Cotonou.  Married to TCHENOU Théophile, a clothier, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  She lives together with her children and husband.  Jointly, the couple ensures that family expenses are covered. Dorothée is a fabrics retailer at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for five years, and it brings in the revenues that enable her to cope with expenses.  She stocks up on goods at Missèbo in Cotonou, and in Lomé, Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  Dorothée once obtained a loan from ALIDé and completed the repayment of it.  She wishes to expand her display of goods.  But right now, she is exhibiting some problems with supplies of her goods.  This is why she is requesting a second loan, so as to satisfy customer demands and to widen her field of business.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lengths of cloth

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn farms for a living. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Her oldest is only 10 years old. She currently owns a hectare of rice field. She shared that despite the difficulties her family experiences, she is still thankful that God sustains them.

Jemelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used for the farm; she will purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere is 45 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children. She takes care of her children alone. She has a vegetable farm; after harvest, she takes the vegetables to the market to sell to vegetable sellers. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Porisa

texts.en: Porisa, 38 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and her oldest is 17 years old. Porisa is a farmer. She owns a carabao, which helps her cultivate the land for rice crops. She is now preparing the land for planting. She will need supplies for the farm. She applied for a loan of PHP 5, 000. With this loan, Porisa will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Saihantuya

texts.en: Saihantuya is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her oldest son who is 16 years old lives in the countryside with his grandparents; the second son is in a local secondary school; and the youngest is in kindergarten. Her husband has his own car which he uses for taxi services. Saihantuya operates a sausage trading business out of a rented stall at a local market. To supplement her earnings she also began to sell other grocery products such as canned vegetable and eggs etc. Saihantuya started her business in 2000. She has gained much selling experience and knowledge of her trade over the years, and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. For the future, she hopes to grow her business and move out her renting stall, which is a very uncomfortable workplace. She says, "I hope to build a bigger and more comfortable house for my family." Narantuya is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan in order to purchase more grocery products such as eggs, chicken meat, canned vegetable to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products such as eggs, chicken meat, and canned vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of eleven people is located in Pump Edth village in Takeo province. These members will each use the loan which they obtain for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sopheap O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

In this farming, Mrs. Sopheap O. now faces a small problE. because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and to hire a water pump to water her crops.

Mrs. Sopheap O. is the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. D. Sokhom, is a bed maker in the local village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to hire a water pump to water her crops

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. sells cooked beans served with fried plantain at Memepeasem near Elmina. Agnes has received junior high education. She is married and has two children.

Agnes has been selling cooked beans and fried plantain since 2004, supporting her husband in paying school fees and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more beans and plantain for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy more beans and plantain for her business

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en: Buyanhishig is a 56-year-old single mother who lives with her 26 year old son in Khovd province, Mongolia. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Her husband, whom used to help with the family business, died recently. Buyanhishig operates a grocery business with the help of his son at the local market in her town. She started her grocery service in 2004 and quickly made good progress with her business. Her earnings have enabled her to have a better quality of life. Buyanhishig is very hardworking and is focused on operating an honest business. She says, "I will work hard to some money for my son to help him buy a house and also I am planning to expand my shop by building one more additional room." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of grocery products for her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase a large supply of grocery products

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a vegetable farm; after harvest, she takes the vegetables to the market to sell to vegetable sellers. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Джумаев Бахтиёр проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 21 год. Холост, имеет среднее образование. Джумаев Бахтиёр работает 2 года в области животноводства. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor Dzhumaev lives in the Bokhtar region. He is 21 years old. He is single; has a high-school level education. Bakhtiyor has been working for 2 years in animal husbandry. He is requesting the loan to purchase large cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying large cattle and feed

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar Y. sells cosmetics such as, body lotion, hair creams, soaps and African prints (tie-die) at Memepeasem near Elmina. Hagar has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a civil servant. Hagar has been selling tie-die cloths and cosmetics since 2003. She supports the husband in meeting her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy materials to make her tie-die products and also buy more cosmetics for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and increase her capital base.

loans.use: To buy materials to make her tie - die and also buy more cosmetics for sale at the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is a seamstress and sows different kinds of traditional dresses. She also sells fabrics along with a locally made juice and bags of water at Memepeasem, near Elmina. Mary has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She supports the husband in paying the children's school fees and other family financial responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics to sell and sewing materials to aid in her work as a seamstress. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics to sell and sewing materials to aid in her work as a seamstress.

loans.name: Jursaa

texts.en:
Jursaa is 33 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. His son and three daughters, who are between 12 and 18 years old, attend a local secondary school. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

With the help of his wife, Jursaa operates a meat trading business at a local market. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting meat and livestock from countryside residents and his wife is responsible for selling them. They sell a variety of meats to their customers at a stall in the local market. Jursaa started his business in 2000 and his business currently operates at a stable level and he continues to make progress.

Jursaa hopes to grow his business in the future and his continued success is very important as he must support his daughter, who is going to enter university next year. Jursaa is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for his business

loans.name: Zorigthuu

texts.en:
Zorigthuu is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old infant in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent.

With the help of his wife, who is a cook in his town, Zorigthuu operates a small cafe and grocery booth that he started in early 2009. He previously managed a cellphone trading business which didn't give him much profit. However, in his prior jobs he gained much business knowledge and experience which enabled him to start his cafe.

Zorigthuu’s business has progressed very quickly in its first year of operation and he is already planning to build his own workplace soon. He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to purchase food ingredients, candies and raisins for his grocery booth.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients, candies and raisins

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 43 years old. She is a widow and the mother of six children. She is hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She has a vegetable farm; after harvest, she takes the vegetables to the market to sell to vegetable sellers. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter works in the army while her husband works as a security guard in a secondary school. Her youngest, who is 8 years old, attends a local secondary school. Erdenechimeg operates a DVD rental and PC game service near her home. As she is the only owner of DVD rental and PC game service, her building is always very crowded and is a very profitable place to operate. Erdenechimeg started her business in 2005 by extending her house for her business. At first her working capital was 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD) which then reached 2,200,000 tugrugs (~1550 USD). Due to her successful location and increasing demand from her many customers, Erdenechimeg feels it is time to expand her business. In the near future, she hopes to buy an apartment for her family. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more supplies of DVDs and PC games for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of DVDs and PC games

loans.name: Kiwojjolo Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Ibrahim is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is married with seven children aged between three and sixteen years, all of whom are in secondary or primary school. He also takes care of his parents.
Ibrahim is a poultry farmer in Namawojjolo trading center and, since this is the place where roasted chicken is sold in abundance, he is able to sell his chicken to a ready market. Before poultry keeping, Ibrahim was an operator in the sterling factory but his monthly earnings were not enough to take care of his family well.
Ibrahim's customers are loyal because of his good customer care and his good quality chicken (his loans enable him to feed his chickens well). Ibrahim wants to become a large-scale poultry farmer so that he can educate his children well. He needs a loan to help with buying more broilers for rearing and more feed for the chickens he already has.

loans.use: To buy more broilers for rearing and more feed

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. His son and two daughters, aged between 12 and 16, all attend a local secondary school. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger".
Lhagvasuren operates a meat and livestock trading business in his town. He collects his products from residents in the countryside and sells them at a local marked. He started his business in 1998. He has gained a lot of experience and a good reputation amongst his customers and suppliers. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase more meat to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase more meat at wholesale prices

loans.name: Success

texts.en:
Success is 35 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband works at an oil firm in Benin City, Edo State.

Success owns a pharmacy where she sells medicines to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Success is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella E. is 36 years old and is married with two children. Her children go to school and they are still dependent on her. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home.

Stella owns a fashion house where she designs clothes for her customers. She also sells clothes and tailoring materials like needles, thread and zips. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and clothes to sell

loans.name: Kamollidin

texts.ru: Одинаев Камоллидин проживает в районе Курган- Тюбе. Возраст, 34. Женат, имеет 5 детей. В областе торговли работает 3 года. Одинаев Камоллидин арендует точку в центре рынка. Берет кредит для увеличения товараоборота т.е. закупа велозапчастей.
texts.en:
Kamollidin O. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. He has been working in the retail sales field for 3 years. Kamollidin O. leases a retail outlet at the market center. He is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. to purchase bicycle spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian I. is single and has received a junior high education. Since 2006 she has been working as a hairdresser in her own beauty salon at Ataabazi near Elmina, where she also sells hair creams and weavons. Vivian uses her income to pay her rent and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more hair creams and weavons to meet customer demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to save so that she can invest in her business and improve her services.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams and weavons

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba D. est âgée de 49 ans, elle mariée et mère de sept enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis neuf ans. Elle s'active dans le l'agriculture, son crédit lui permet de développe dans son arrière cour un petit jardin où elle cultive des légumes tels que de la laitue des choux etc. elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille
texts.en:
Dieynaba D. is 49 years old, married and mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" group of Petit Kandé for nine years. Her business activity is gardening, and the credit obtained allows her to cultivate a small garden plot in her backyard, where she grows vegetables such as lettuce, cabbages, etc. She participates in taking care of her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her gardening activity

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, called a "ger". His three children all attend kindergarten.
Lhagvasuren owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. His wife used to operate a grocery trading business, but this stopped for a while. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to help his wife restart her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To restart his wife's grocery trading business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 47 years old and married with seven children. She is a Bini by tribe and she lives in Benin City. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Doris sells drinks, electronics and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future.

Doris needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks, electronics and groceries to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Doris is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and eletronics to sell

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 37 years old and lives with her 12-year-old son and four orphaned siblings in a house in Darhan-Uul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son is a secondary school student.
Narantuya operates a grocery trading booth in her town. She started her business in 1996 and has steadily grown it over the years. For the first few years, she used to operate a mobile consumer goods business. Then, as her business succeeded, she managed to rent a booth at a local market to operate her business. With her business earnings, she has been able to help her four siblings to study and lead their lives for themselves. Next year, she is planning to have her own grocery shop in her town. Narantuya is working hard to grow her business further and improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting a 3,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old and married with four children. She is a Bini by tribe and she lives in Benin City. Her husband is an architect.

Victoria sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Victoria needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Victoria is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has two children. She has received a junior high education. Mary's husband is a farmer while she sells raw maize at Elmina.  Mary has been in this business since 2008, and it enables her to support her husband in paying the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to supply her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is an Igbo by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City with her family.

Sandra sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices and hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Sandra is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
A. Ilhomjon is 45 years old and married with four children. He raises and sells cattle for a living. He purchases small cattle at the central market, feeds them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Ilhomjon has been in this business for eight years and is experienced at choosing the animals, breeding them, and looking after them. He gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills have made his business successful and generated a considerable and stable income for his large family. 
Currently, Ilhomjon is planning to expand his business and purchase more cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1500 USD. You could become an important part in Ilhomjon's family's life – he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest child attends a local secondary school while the youngest one stays at home.
Otgonbayar and his wife operate a retail clothing business in their town. Otgonbayar is responsible for importing the products from China while his wife is responsible for selling the products in the market. They sell a variety of clothes, such as pants, jackets, boots and shirts. Otgonbayar began his business in 2006 and attributes his success to his good business sense and accounting skills. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and widen his product line. He says, “I worked in Korea before where I gained much business experience. With my business knowledge I am expanding and improving my business.” Otgonbayar is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products from China to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is 35 years old and is the loving mother of three children. Since beginning her family, she has dedicated herself to raising livestock, work that she continues to this day with much love and patience. As a result of her self-sacrificing work and the care that Matluba brings to each one of her young cows, she has been able to increase the quantity of her calves. Now, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, which, apart from everything, fill her with pride and much satisfaction. 

Her next desire is to move into the business of selling milk. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and to enable her to pay the university costs of her children. In order to meet her goals, Matluba is relying on your generous heart and asks for a loan in order to buy more cattle and begin this new occupation without delay. Matluba awaits your response in order to finalize her plans and to make her dreams of seeing her children become professionals a reality.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for milk to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and is married with three children. She sells rechargeable phone accessories to make a living and has been in this business for a long time. She is hardworking woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She loves this business because it is highly profitable.

Victoria needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Victoria is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
Ibragim has always been hardworking man. From a young age, he has made sure that his family never goes without daily bread. He is married with three children. 

Ibragim has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food. With a starting capital of 8,000 Somoni, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise four years ago. Today, he needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the variety of items that he sells. With this purpose, Ibragim is requesting a loan of 8,000 Somoni. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and a while to achieve his goal to become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items that he sells

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is 23 years old and was born in Spitamen region, Tajikistan. He is the father of four children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. 

A very ambitious man, Akmaljon would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a barn in which to house them, in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Akmaljon will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is 34 years old and is married to a businessman. She is the mother of one child.

Iyabo owns a boutique where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She stated this business three years ago and she says the business is moving along fine.

Iyabo is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes, and bags to sell. She hopes to expand into a world-class boutique in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ayubdjon

texts.en:
Ayubdjon is 33 years old. He is married with three children. His wife looks after the house and the children. 

Ayubdjon supports his family by breeding cattle, which he sells for meat. He started his business in 2002. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income necessary to allow Ayubdjon to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now, he has applied for a $1,500 USD loan, which he is planning to use to purchase cattle for expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Adkhamjon

texts.en:
Adkhamjon is 28 years old. He has been running his business of raising and selling cattle for 11 years. Adkhamjon tries to invest as much time as possible in his animals. He tries to bathe and vaccinate his animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe them and it's not easy to reach. Without a doubt, the results please him: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a big source of satisfaction. 

Adkhamjon now plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of his animals. He will then generate more income, and, with that, he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort Y. is married and has four children. She has received a senior-high education. Comfort sells fufu (a local dish prepared from cassava), which she serves with a variety of soups. Her bar is located in a small town called Ataabazi near Elmina. She has been doing this business since 2004. Her husband is a security man.  

Comfort uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more raw cassava, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of food for sale. Comfort plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business to improve upon the quantity and quality of food she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more raw cassava, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of food for sale

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en: Muhaiyo is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. Muhaiyo is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Muhaiyo’s business. loans.use: Purchasing cattle and small cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Anvardjon

texts.en: Anvardjon U. is 41 years old. He is married with three children. He sells cattle. As a rule, he purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them with higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 18 years, Anvardjon knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. Today, knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Anvardjon is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. With this purpose, he requests a loan of $1,500. Anvardjon counts on you and thanks you for the trust you’re giving to him. loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 34 years old and she just got married to a police officer. She is the owner of a Beauty Home where she makes different hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions, bags and shoes and has been in this business for a long time.

Cynthia needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Cynthia is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 40 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are at the university. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. 

Joy owns a restaurant where she sells drinks and cooked foods to make a living. She is popularly called ‘Madam Joy’ by her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Joy hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina K. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education.  Augustina sells groundnuts in Ataabazi near Elmina. She has been doing this business since 2004. Her husband is a driver.  

Augustina uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expense. Augustina will use the loan to buy more groundnuts for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Augustina plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Augustina will use the loan to buy more groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 45 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. Her husband is a cleaning agent. She has been selling fish for three years. She obtains the fish from Lake Victoria and sells them to Umoja residents. Previously, she was only selling second-hand clothing, which she still continues. She hopes to export fish in the future. Elizabeth describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fish and second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un étal où elle vend diverses denrées alimentaires. Son objectif est de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady C. is a 35-year-old woman, married and mother of two children. She runs a stall where she sells various food products. Her objective is to contribute to improve her family's living conditions, health, and education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sell food products

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia C. sells groundnut paste in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Cicilia is 40 years old and is married; her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Matale Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Dan is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is married and has four children between the ages of 14 and 1, all of whom are in school.  He also takes care of his parents. Dan has a retail shop in Matale and although he has a lot of competition from other traders, he is able to make profits that sustain his family as well as paying his children’s school fees. 

Dan is so grateful for his loans because they enable him have increased stock as well as having quality products for sale. He wishes to become a wholesaler in the future, and also hopes to build rentals for an increased monthly income. Dan needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, cooking oil, bread and other confectioneries for his shop.

loans.use: Sugar, cooking oil, bread, and other items for store inventory

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne B. est mariée, 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans la couture en vendant des habits cousus par elle-même. Les revenus générés lui permettent de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Julienne B. is married, 52 years old and mother of seven children. Her business activity is sewing and selling clothes she has tailored herself. The income generated allows her to better meet her family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Ndèye Marie

texts.fr: Ndèye Marie N. est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vend divers produits alimentaires au marché. Avec cette activité, elle souhaiterait contribuer au mieux aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Marie N. is a 41-year-old woman, married and mother of eight children. She sells various food products in the market. She would like her business activity to contribute as much as possible to her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of various food products

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu J. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Dudu is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 4 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.
