loans.use: For crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Paulette Isabelle

texts.fr: Paulette Isabelle C. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un étal au marché ou elle commercialise divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de participer à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paulette Isabelle C. is 42 years old, married and mother of two children. She runs a stall in the market where she sells various food products. Her objective is to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of various food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor E. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes and bags of onions to sell. Ayor is 36 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tomatoes and bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Achola

texts.en:
Achola J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Achola is 19 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik is fifty years old. He is married and has five children who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is commerce. As the man of the family, Sadik works very hard to be able to cater for the household. He sells wrist watches. He says he hawks and sometimes treks to nearby communities to sell.

Sadik procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy wristwatches to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 26 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Comfort works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a hairdresser by profession. Comfort works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for three years and currently has seven apprentices under training. Comfort wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 45 years old and is a widow with four children. Her youngest child is 14 years old.

Ifeoma hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Syrga's Group

texts.ru:
Токтакунова Сырга – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок восемь лет. Она вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Балыкчи. Балыкчи – один из тех городов, который прежде относился к одному из растущих городов. Однако с развалом СССР, начал терять потенциал и за пятнадцать лет превратился в «мёртвый» город. Муж Сырга, был вынужден уехать из города, так как, возможности найти работу практически не осталось. Сейчас он работает в Бишкеке. Ему удалось начать своё дело. Он занимается перепродажей автомобилей. Сырга осталась в Балыкчи. Дети были маленькие, и Сырга осталась с ними дома. Благодаря бизнесу мужа, они десять лет тому назад купили дом. Сырга сразу догадалась, что пока есть средства, нужно построить магазин и начать торговлю. Так Сырга смогла начать своё дело. Сейчас она торгует прохладительными напитками, кондитерскими изделиями, копчёной рыбой и продовольственными  товарами. В месяц ей удаётся заработать до десяти тысяч сомов ($230). Дети Сырга уже подросли. Старшему сыну шестнадцать лет. Скоро уже и школу закончит. Младшей дочери девять лет. Сырга обратилась за этим кредитом, с целью вложить их в товарооборот, закупить продовольственные товары и побольше кондитерских изделий для новогоднего периода. 

У Сырга четыре партнёра по группе:

Мурсаевой Базаркул пятьдесят один год. Базаркул не замужем. У неё три дочери. Базаркул уже выдала две старшие дочери замуж. Младшей всего шесть лет. Чтобы прокормить себя и дочку, Базаркул продаёт по организациям под зарплаты трикотажные изделия. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить носков изделий, женских шапок,  и детских изделий. 

Толомушевой Шарый пятьдесят два года. Муж Шарый уже на пенсии. Сама Шарый торгует в павильоне продуктами питания, а также у них есть баня, которую они топят для клиентов три раза в неделю. Шарый надеется получить кредит для ремонта бани.

Бектургановой Бурулсун, пятьдесят восемь лет. Бурулсун – вдова. Она работает учительницей в средней школе, а также получает пенсию. Дочь Бурулсун работает в швейном цехе. Она шьёт и продаёт бальные платья. Бурулсун нужен кредит, чтобы закупить ткани для шитья бальных платьев. 

Жолдошбековой Айзаде девятнадцать лет. Она замужем и у неё уже есть сын, которому одиннадцать месяцев. Муж Айзады работает диспетчером в ОсОО «Кызыл – Саз Транс». Свёкр дома занимается ремонтом автомашин. Айзада обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь свёкру купить коробку передач, амортизаторы и другие автозапчасти. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Syrga T. is the leader of this group. She is forty-eight years old and lives in the city of Balykchi together with her family. Balykchi is one of those cities previously considered to be one of the growing cities; however, due to the breakup of the USSR, it began to lose its potential and became a “dead” city over the course of fifteen years. Syrga’s husband had to leave the city because there was no realistic possibility of finding work. He now works in Bishkek. He was able to start his own business and is involved in reselling cars. Syrga stayed in Balykchi. The children were young, and Syrga stayed home with them. Thanks to her husband’s business, they bought a house ten years ago. Syrga quickly realized that while they had the means, she needed to build a store and begin sales. Thus, Syrga was able to start her business. Currently, she sells refreshments, candy, smoked fish and other food products. Just in a month, she is able to earn up to ten thousand som ($230). Syrga’s children already grew up. The oldest son is sixteen years old. He will soon be graduating from school. The youngest daughter is nine years old. Syrga requested this loan with the goal of investing this money into product turnover, purchasing food products and more candy for the New Year period.

Syrga has four partners in this group:

Bazarkul M. is fifty-one years old. Bazarkul is not married. She has three daughters. Bazarkul already married off her two older daughters. The youngest is only six years old. In order to support herself and her daughter, Bazarkul sells textile goods to businesses. Currently, she needs a loan in order to purchase socks, women’s hats and children’s goods.

Shariy T. is fifty-two years old. Her husband is already retired. Shariy sells food products at a shopping center. They also own a sauna that they run for clients three times per week. Shariy is hoping to obtain a loan to repair the sauna.

Burulsun B. is fifty-eight years old. She is a widow. She works as a teacher at a secondary school and also receives a pension. Burulson’s daughter works at a textile factory. She sews and sells ballroom gowns. Burulsun need a loan in order to purchase fabric for making ballroom gowns.

Ayzada J. is nineteen years old. She is married and already has a son, who is eleven months old. Ayzada’s husband works as a dispatcher at the “Kyzyl-Saz Trans” company. Her father-in-law is involved in car repairs at home. Ayzada requested this loan in order to help her father-in-law purchase a transmission box, suspension shocks and other auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products and candy for the New Year period

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 43 years old and is married with seven children, her youngest child being 3 years old. Her husband is a driver and he drives for a private company.

Queen owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Queen hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 47 ans elle mariée et mère de sept enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Pakour1 depuis un an. Elle possède d'une table où elle vend divers produits alimentaires tels que des légumes comme des choux, des oignons, du piment séché et d'autres épices. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne et à la santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of seven dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Pakour1 for one year. She owns a table where she sells various food items such as vegetables (such as cabbage and onions), dried hot peppers, and other spices. She contributes to the daily expenses and health needs of her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Burma's Group

texts.ru:
Абдылдаева Бурма – лидер данной группы. Она вместе с семьёй проживает в г. Карабалта. Бурме пятьдесят два года. Муж Бурмы работает школьным учителем. Бурма с мужем вырастили четверых детей. Старшей дочери тридцать три года. Второй дочери двадцать девять. Третьей дочери двадцать шесть лет, и младшему сыну двадцать два года. В семье Бурмы издавна господствуют демократические принципы, т.е. они с мужем предоставили детям свободу выбора своей профессии и будущего, предварительно дав им хорошее воспитание и образование. Старшие дочери уехали работать в Бишкек. Сын в данное время учится в университете. Старшая дочь стала модельером. Вторая дочь пошла по стопам отца и стала преподавателем. Третья дочь временно не работает. Бурма же осталась дома следить за хозяйством. Они с мужем на протяжении многих лет копили деньги с зарплаты и смогли купить корову. С тех пор Бурма занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. В месяц Бурма зарабатывает три тысячи сомов ($60). Бурма решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы вложить деньги в покупку ещё одного бычка для содержания. Бурма сейчас хлопочет насчёт своих дочерей. Она надеется их выдать замуж, построить новый дом и сарай возле дома для скота. 

У Бурмы три партнёра по группе: 

Табалды – кызы Лаззат двадцать восемь лет. Лаззат – домохозяйка. Она разводит овец, держит коров и продаёт молоко. Муж Лаззат работает в охранном агентстве. У Лаззат двое детей. Дочери восемь и сыну пять лет. Лаззат обратилась за кредитом с целью купить кобылу для разведения. Лаззат мечтает увеличить поголовье скота и дать детям хорошее образование. 

Салыйке сорок один год. Салыйка занимается домашним хозяйством, разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Муж Салыйки работает в сельской администрации инспектором по наделу земли. У Салыйки четверо детей. Старшие дети учатся в университетах, дочь ходит в школу и младший сын – дошкольник. Салыйка решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы оплатить контракт за обучение сына. Дать образование детям – одна из самых важных целей всей жизни для Салыйки. 

Гульзат двадцать четыре года. Она не замужем. Гульзат самостоятельно ведёт своё хозяйство. Иногда ей помогают родители и брат. Скот достался ей от родителей. За счёт разведения скота Гульзат купила машину, бытовую технику и мебель. Гульзат надеется получить кредит и купить мобильный телефон. Она надеется отремонтировать дом, сарай и выйти замуж. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burma Abdylaeva is the leader of this group. She lives in the city of Karabalta together with her family. Burma is fifty-two years old. Her husband works as a school teacher. Burma and her husband raised four children. The oldest daughter is thirty-three years old. The second daughter is twenty-nine. The third daughter is twenty-six, and the youngest son is twenty-two years old. Democratic principles have governed Burma’s family for a long time, i.e. Burma and her husband gave their children the freedom to choose their career and future, having previously given them good upbringing and education. Oldest daughters left to work in Bishkek. The son is currently attending a university. The oldest daughter became a designer. The second daughter followed her father’s footsteps and became a teacher. The third daughter is temporarily unemployed. Meanwhile, Burma stayed at home to take care of the household. Her husband and she have been setting money aside for many years and were able to buy a cow. Since then, Burma has been involved in animal husbandry and selling milk. Burma earns three thousand som ($60) in one month. Burma decided to request a loan in order to purchase and keep one more bull. Burma is now worried about her daughters. She hopes to marry them off, build a new house and barn for the livestock next to her home.

Burma has three partners in this group:

Lazzat T. is twenty-eight years old. Lazzat is a homemaker. She breeds sheep, keeps cows and sells milk. Lazzat’s husband works at a security agency. Lazzat has two children. Her daughter is eight and son is five years old. Lazzat requested a loan in order to purchase a mare for breeding. She dreams of increasing livestock headcount and providing her children with good education.

Saliyka is forty-one years old. She takes care of the household, breeds livestock and sells milk. Saliyka’s husband works at the village administrative office as a land inspector. Saliyka has four children. The oldest children are attending a university, and the youngest son is a preschooler. Saliyka decided to obtain a loan in order to pay off the contract for her son’s education. One of Saliyka’s most important goals is to provide her children with an education.

Gulzat is twenty-four years old. She is single. Gulzat runs her own household. Sometimes, her parents and brother help her with it. She got the livestock from her parents. Due to the income from livestock breeding, Gulzat was able to purchase a car, household appliances and furniture. Gulzat hopes to obtain a loan and purchase a mobile phone. She also hopes to repair her house, barn and get married.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one more bull

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 35 years old and is married with one child. Her husband works as a chef in one of the restaurant in Benin City.

Gloria sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world class supermarket in the future.

Gloria is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Shayimkul's Group

texts.ru:
Абрахманова Шайымкул – лидер данной группы. Шайымкул сорок три года. Нелёгкое положение дел в стране с обеспечением рабочих мест для населения, сыграло важную роль для Шайымкул в проявлении своих деловых качеств. Пятнадцать лет назад Шайымкул решила начать бизнес. Муж Шайымкул полностью доверился жене и решил ей помочь. Сейчас они успешно занимаются торговлей. За эти годы они набрали большой опыт и прочно встали на ноги. У Шайымкул многопрофильный бизнес. Она торгует продуктами питания и напитками и по воскресеньям выходит на скотный рынок для покупки и перепродажи скота. Занятие торговлей позволило Шайымкул и её мужу приобрести автомобиль, построить дом, возвести хозяйственные постройки вокруг дома. Сейчас её бизнес, в общем, приносит ей около восьми тысяч сомов в месяц ($180). У Шайымкул трое детей. Старшей дочери двадцать три года. Она уже вышла замуж и живёт отдельно. Сыну девятнадцать лет и младшей дочери пятнадцать. Сын пока нигде не работает, а дочка учится в школе. Шайымкул решила обратиться за этим кредитом, так как, нуждается в деньгах, чтобы закупить товар для увеличения оборота. В ближайшем будущем она планирует купить корову, поставить новые ворота и наконец, женить сына. 

У Шайымкул три партнёра по группе:

Айнуре тридцать девять лет. Она замужем за инспектором ГАИ (Государственной Автомобильной Инспекции). У Айнуры трое детей. Старшие сыновья работают. Младший сын – школьник. Айнура разводит скот продает молоко. Это занятие Айнуре передалось по наследству. Айнура нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить бычка для откорма и продажи. 

Венере сорок лет. Она мать пятерых детей. Муж Венеры вместе с ней занимаются домашним хозяйством. Старшему сыну шестнадцать. Он уже работает и сам себя обеспечивает. Трое детей учатся в школе и младшая дочь – дошкольница.  Венера обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить для дома бытовую технику и  ковёр. 

Жамиле сорок восемь лет. Муж Жамилы вместе с ней занимается домашним хозяйством. Они разводят скот и продают молоко. У Жамилы двое детей. Старший сын работает в Бишкеке, а дочь вышла замуж и живёт отдельно. Жамила нуждается в кредите. Она хочет купить корову, чтобы продавать больше молока. В ближайшем будущем Жамила планирует женить сына и построить сарай для овец. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Shayimkul Abrahmanova is the leader of this group. She is forty-three years old. The country’s difficult situation with providing its citizens with jobs played an important role for Shayimkul in developing her entrepreneurial qualities. She decided to start her own business fifteen years ago. Shayimkul’s husband trusted his wife completely and decided to help her. Now they are successfully involved in retail sales. Throughout these years, they gained a lot of experience and were able to strongly stand on their own feet. Shayimkul has a diversified business. She sells food products and drinks, and goes to the livestock market on Sundays to buy and resell livestock. The retail business allowed Shayimkul and her husband to purchase a car and build a house and additional structures around it. Currently, her business brings in approximately eight thousand som ($180) per month overall. Shayimkul has three children. The oldest daughter is twenty-three years old. She is already married and lives separately. The son is nineteen years old, and the youngest daughter is fifteen. The son does not work anywhere yet, and the daughter goes to school. Shayimkul decided to obtain this loan because she needs money in order to purchase merchandise and increase turnover. In the near future, she plans to buy a cow, install new gates and, finally, marry off her son.

Shayimkul has three partners in this group:

Ainura is thirty-nine years old. She is married to a traffic police inspector. Ainura has three children. Her oldest sons work, and the youngest son is in school. Ainura breeds livestock and sells milk. She inherited this business. Ainura needs a loan in order to purchase a bull for feeding and sale.

Venera is forty years old. She is a mother of five children. Venera and her husband are involved in a domestic business. Their oldest son is sixteen. He already works and supports himself. Three of their children are in school, and the youngest daughter is a preschooler. Venera requested a loan in order to purchase household appliances and a rug for home.

Jamila is forty-eight years old. Jamila and her husband are involved in a domestic business. They breed livestock and sell milk. Jamila has two children. The oldest son works in Bishkek, and the daughter got married and lives separately. Jamila needs a loan. She wants to buy a cow in order to sell more milk. In the near future, Jamila plans to marry off her son and build a barn for the sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products and increase turnover

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old and is married with one child. Her husband works as a prison officer in Benin City.

Rosemary sells groceries and drinks and loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world class supermarket in the future.

Rosemary needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Rosemary is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Guldjan's Group

texts.ru:
Ильязова Гульжан – лидер данной группы. Гульжан пятьдесят два года. Гульжан вместе с семьёй проживает в г. Карабалте. Муж Гульжан работает строителем, а Гульжан решила остаться дома и заниматься домашним хозяйством. Она хотела дать четверым своим детям хорошее воспитание и полностью окружить их своей заботой. Сейчас дети уже выросли, однако Гульжан предпочла дальше заниматься разведением скота и не искать другую работу. Гульжан очень привыкла заниматься животноводством, ведь оно все эти годы приносило неплохой доход, позволило вырастить детей, дать им образование, построить дом. Дети выросли воспитанными и трудолюбивыми. Они все помогали Гульжан ухаживать за скотом. Но так как в городе существовала очень большая проблема, связанная с общим экономическим положением, отсутствием производства и безработицей, дети были вынуждены оставить родительский дом и уехать в Россию на заработки. Гульжан также пришлось заняться поиском дополнительного заработка. В итоге, она начала на дому заниматься шитьём национальных изделий. Сейчас Гульжан нужен кредит, чтобы купить ткани. Она хочет сделать сыну подарок; купить ему дом. 

У Гульжан три партнёра по группе:

Сайпиле пятьдесят два года. Жена Сайпила шьёт национальные изделия. Сайпил занимается домашним хозяйством, разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Он – отец пятерых детей. Сайпил начал заниматься скотоводством, купив на собственные сбережения телёнка. Сейчас ему нужен кредит, чтобы купить ещё телёнка. Сайпил хочет накопить средства для ремонта дома и сарая. 

Ириде тридцать восемь лет. Муж Ириды работает на стройке. Ирида находится дома, и занимается животноводством, продаёт молоко. У Ириды трое детей. Старшая дочь работает в кондитерском цехе, сын ходит в школу, а младшая дочь – дошкольница. Ирида надеется получить кредит и купить телёнка. Она хочет накопить достаточные средства для того, чтобы отремонтировать дом и женить сына. 

Гульсине двадцать два года. У Гульсины двое детей. Дочке три года, а младшему всего один месяц. Муж Гульсины занимается разведением и продажей скота, продаёт молоко. Гульсина до родов помогала мужу. Вместе они построили двух – комнатную времянку. Гульсина надеется получить кредит и купить скот для откорма и продажи. Гульсина мечтает о собственном жилье. Она хочет быстрее накопить средства, вложить их в покупку дома и отделиться от родителей. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Guljan I. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-two years old. Guljan and her family live in the city of Karabalta. Her husband is a construction worker, and Guljan decided to stay home and become involved in the household business. She wanted to give good upbringing to her four children and completely surround them with her care. When her children grew up, Guljan still preferred to continue breeding livestock, instead of finding other work. She got used to the animal husbandry business, and, after all, this business earned a good income all these years and allowed her to raise the children, provide them with an education and build a house. The children have grown to be well-brought up and hard-working. All of them used to help Guljan take care of the livestock. However, because the city has been experiencing a difficult economic situation, lack of manufacturing and unemployment, the children were forced to leave the parents’ home and go work in Russia. Guljan also had to find additional sources of income. Finally, she started to sew traditional items at home. Now Guljan needs a loan in order to purchase fabrics. She wants to make a gift for her son and buy him a house.

Guljan has three partners in this group:

Saipil is fifty-two years old. His wife sews traditional items. Saipil is involved in a household business; he breeds livestock and sells milk. He is a father of five children. Saipil started his animal husbandry business by using his own savings to purchase a calf. Now he needs a loan to purchase another calf. Saipil wants to save enough money to repair his house and barn.

Irida is thirty-eight years old. Her husband works at a construction site. Irida stays at home and is involved in animal husbandry and milk sales. She has three children. Her oldest daughter works at a candy factory, the son goes to school, and the youngest daughter is a preschooler. Irida hopes to obtain this loan and purchase a calf. She wants to save enough money to repair her house and marry off her son.

Gulsina is twenty-two years old. She has two children. The daughter is three years old, and the youngest is only one month old. Gulsina’s husband is involved in livestock breeding and sales, and selling milk. Prior to childbirth, Gulsina used to help her husband. Together, they built a two-room temporary home. Gulsina hopes to obtain a loan and buy livestock to raise and sell. She dreams of owning her own home. She wants to save faster, invest the money into a home purchase and move out of her parents’ house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics for traditional sewing

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose is 27 years old and is single without children. She sells groceries and drinks and loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Bose needs a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Bose is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Janet is a businesswoman. She is into local soap production. She manufactures the soap and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy soda, palm oil and other working materials in bulk so as to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy soda and palm oil, etc. for making soap

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
N. Guljan is the leader of this group. She comes from Karabalta, a small city to the west of Bishkek. Guljan and her husband achieved all their possessions through hard work and perseverance. They know that everything in life comes gradually. Guljan is forty-seven years old. Her husband works as a procurement manager in a local high school.

Guljan is a housewife but she is also engaged in raising livestock and sells milk. Twenty-five years ago, she inherited some cattle from her parents. She had a choice to sell everything and have a regular job, but instead she decided to increase what had been left to her. During these years she has accomplished that. Moreover, through raising cattle she has been able to raise five beautiful children and build a house, and furnish it.

The children have grown. The eldest daughter is married and lives separately. One of the sons works in Russia. One of the daughters goes to college, and the rest of the children go to school. Guljan has applied for this loan to purchase coal for the rest of the winter season. She is going to complete the building of the house, buy a car, and increase the total population of her livestock.

Guljan’s partners:

Baktiyar, 28, is single. He raises and trades in cattle. He needs a loan to buy some cattle for feeding and resale.

Nurzada, 24, is single. She is engaged in raising cattle. She hopes to obtain a loan and buy some items of furniture.

Janatkul, 40, has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She stays at home and looks after cattle. Janatkul hopes to get this loan and buy coal.

Dilbar, 57, is the mother of three children. Her husband is an inspector at the market. She is a housewife. Dilbar keeps some cows and sells milk. She needs a loan to buy furniture.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase coal for the rest of the winter season

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-one years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in yams. She procures the yams from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Elizabeth has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy yams for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is 36 years old and is married with three children. Her husband molds blocks to support his family.

Juliet is a petty trader, selling groceries, drinks, clothes and kitchen utensils to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to see her business grow bigger in the nearest future.

Juliet is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Sandra works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a hairdresser by profession. Sandra works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair, etc. for her business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is married with five children and she is 39 years old. She sells groceries such as milk, noodles, bread, biscuits (cookies) and juice and started this business three years ago. She is a friendly and hardworking woman who sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members.

Kate hopes to see her business grow. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is sixty years old. She is married and has six children. Two of her children are currently in school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a primarily commercial community.

Philomena works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of footwear. Philomena hawks and treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures the goods from Accra. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure shoes and slippers in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola O. is 26 years old and married with three children. She is a Yoruba by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a driver for a private company.

Bola is friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She also has a grinding machine that she uses to grind tomatoes, pepper and melons. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members.

Bola needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a forty-one year old married mother of three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Vida works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells local dishes such as banku and rice balls. She sells by the road side in her community. Vida procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is forty-three years old. She is divorced and has three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Yaa works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader in utensils such as plates and bowls. Yaa procures the goods from Accra and then sells them. She also treks to nearby towns to sell on their market days. Yaa has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plates and bowls.

loans.name: Abba

texts.en: Abba is fifty-seven years old. She is divorced and has six children who attend school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Abba works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Abba trades in cosmetics such as pomade, cream, body spray, etc. She sells her goods by hawking and some times treks as well to other communities. Abba procures her goods from Accra. She wants a loan to buy cosmetics in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: A. Justine est née en 1959 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Justine vit à Towéta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs 4 ans. C’est une veuve ayant cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Justine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Justine n’a jamais été à l’école. Justine est une vendeuse de pétrole, une activité qu’elle mène depuis 10 ans et qui lui permet d’assurer les charges familiales. C’est au marché de Gbégamey à Cotonou, que Justine achète son produit ; cependant Justine vend son produit dans son quartier. Justine avait obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés malgré le décès d’un de ses enfants au 2ème crédit. La clientèle de Justine s’accroît au jour le jour ; et Justine n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. C’est la raison pour laquelle Justine sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Justine was born in 1959 in Abomey, a historic city in Benin. Justine has lived in Towéta in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, for four years. She is a widow with five children, three of whom are dependent. Only some of the children go to school. Justine lives on her own with her children and pays the family expenses by herself. Justine has never been to school. Justine sells gasoline, a business which she has run for ten years and which allows her to pay her family expenses. Justine gets her supplies at the Gbégamey market in Cotonou; however, she sells in her neighborhood. Justine has received two loans from ALIDé, loans which she repaid despite the death of one of her children during the term of the second loan. The number of Justine's customers grows daily, and Justine is not able to satisfy them because her financial means are limited. This is the reason Justine is seeking a third loan, in order to build her business.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of six 50-liter drums of gasoline

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel has been married to her husband Arnulfo for eleven years now. They have a 9 year old child. She grew up on a farm because her parents were farmers and is thankful she was taught how to farm properly. Right now, she helps her husband till their rice field. Maribel also needs additional capital for the farm, and that’s why she applied for a loan of PHP5,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to buy farm products like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 35 years old and married with four children. She is a Bini by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Blessing is a friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and with these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Blessing needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sandy pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 27 años, es soltera y es socia nueva. Ella vive en el departamento del Cusco provincia del Cusco distrito de Santiago.  
 
Sandy es profesional y trabaja actualmente en una entidad privada. Ella tiene un negocio familiar que es una quinta bar restaurante llamado “LUCHITO” y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Izcuchaca. El negocio se atiende los domingos y donde se prepara comida típica de la región como chicharrón, asado, abobo y mucho más.    
Sandy es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para apoyar al negocio familiar desea ampliar el local. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sandy, 27, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "COMUZONE" communal bank. She is single and a new member. She lives in Cusco department, Cusco province, Santiago district. Sandy is a professional and works for a private company. She also has a family business which is a restaurant-bar, called "LUCHITO," located in the city of Izcuchaca. The restaurant opens on Sundays and it serves typical dishes of the region like: fried pork rinds, grilled meats, adobo (a type of marinated meat), etc. Sandy is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who needs funding to enlarge the family business. She is grateful for the help received through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her restaurant.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah D. sells plantain and bags of charcoal at Mepeasem near Elmina. Hannah has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Hannah has been selling plantain, charcoal, and other food supplies since 2006. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal and food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: H. Clarisse est née en 1972 à Glazoué au Bénin. Il y a environs 15 ans que Clarisse réside au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à JOMAKI Brice, un revendeur, Clarisse a quatre enfants à sa charge, dont trois sont ses enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Zogbo. Clarisse vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne l’entretien et l’éducation des enfants. Clarisse n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. C’est depuis près de 20 ans que Clarisse vend des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) et divers autres articles à son domicile. Clarisse s’approvisionne à Glazoué et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Son activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. En ces périodes, Clarisse ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité, que Clarisse sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Clarisse a déjà bénéficié d'un prêt à ALIDé, et qui a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Clarisse H. was born in 1972 in Glazoué in Bénin. Clarisse has lived for about 15 years in the Zgobo neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Brice JOMAKI, a retailer, Clarisse has four children in her care, three of which are her own. All the children are at school. The family lives together in Zogbo. Clarisse helps her husband with the upkeep and education of the children. Clarisse went to primary school only. For almost 20 years Clarisse has been selling food produce (corn, rice, etc.) and other miscellaneous items from her home. Clarisse stocks up at Glazoué and also at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Her business allows her to bring in an income which helps her to make a living. At present Clarisse does not have sufficient funds to allow her to satisfy the large number of clients she has and to have a higher income in order to cover her various expenses. In order to strengthen her business Clarisse is thus asking for a second loan from ALIDé. Clarisse has already had one loan from ALIDé which was repaid without any problems.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance is 29 years old and is married with one child. Her husband is a musician and he also supports the home.

Endurance owns a beauty salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells drinks, rechargeable phone cards and salon materials like hair extensions, shampoo, hair cream and cosmetics. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members.

Endurance is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more salon materials and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials, drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Marcia is the coordinator of her group Nuevo Renacer (New Rebirth), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the north of Santo Domingo, an economically depressed urban slum, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and child.

Marcia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses and women's pants in the main market in Santo Domingo and then reselling them at a profit in her neighborhood. She will use the profits to continue to try to meet the daily needs of her small family as well as to improve on her house. She has the long term dream of owning her own home and having a fixed location for her currently ambulatory business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Pants and blouses to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and is married with four children. She lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is an accountant.

Gladys is a friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and with these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Gladys needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Early Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Early pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 28 años y tiene un hijo llamado Manuel que tiene 1 año. El vive en el departamento del Cusco, provincia del Cusco y distrito de Santiago.  
 
Early es policía y trabaja patrullando las carreteras del Cusco. Ya son dos años que es policía. Early, su hermana Sandy y su papá tienen un negocio familiar que es una quinta bar restaurante llamado “LUCHITO” y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Izcuchaca. El negocio funciona los domingos donde se prepara comida típica de la región como chicharrón, asado, abobo y mucho más.    
Early es un padre joven, trabajador y emprendedor que requiere el préstamo para apoyar al negocio familiar y desea ampliar el local. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Early, 28, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "COMUZONE" communal bank. He has a one-year-old son, Manuel. He lives in Cusco department, Cusco province, Santiago district. Early has been a police officer patroling Cusco's streets for the last 2 years. Early, his sister Sandy, and their father have a family business that is a restaurant-bar, called "LUCHITO" in the city of Izcuchaca. The restaurant opens on Sundays and serves typical regional dishes like: fried pork rinds, grilled meats, adobo (a marinated meat), etc. Early is a hard-working, enterprising, young father who needs funding to enlarge the family's restaurant. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his restaurant.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. sells bathroom slippers at Ataabazi near Elmina. She carries the goods on her head, moving from place to place to sell them. Theresa has received junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Theresa has been selling bathroom slippers since 2004. She is responsible for supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers for sale. She hopes to invest the new profits back into the business to enable her to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for sale

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 20 years old, married and the mother of a 3-year-old. She is involved in rice farming. She says that because of their farm, her family’s needs are provided. She works hard to make the farm more productive so her income could also improve.

Sheryl asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. With this loan, she will be able to finance her farm and buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Twenty-seven year old Jocelyn is a rice farmer. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is only six years old. She does not mind having to spend most of her time at the farm because it gives her family food to eat, clothes to wear, and provides their other needs. She currently needs additional capital for her farm. She applied for a loan of PHP5,000, which she will use to finance her farm. She will purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer, a 27 year old married woman, has four children with her husband Francisco. The oldest among their kids is only nine years old. Like most of the people in her town, she is also a rice farmer. She shares that she and her husband had a hard time looking for financial assistance for their farm. Now that she has found CEVI, she applied for a loan of PHP7,000, which will be used to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Elmer believes that her harvest will be good because she was able to finance her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Fifty year old Celsa is still strong enough to perform farming duties. She is married and has four children. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She also joined CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines, to gain access to its financial services. She also wants her business to grow. She applied for a loan of PHP5,000, which will be used for purchasing farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is aged six. She is a rice farmer and inherited land from her parents. She works hard to maintain the farm. She also wants to save for her children’s education. She hopes that some day, all of them will finish school and find decent jobs.

Maribel applied for a loan of PHP7,000. She will use this loan to buy farm inputs, like seeds, fertilizers and many others.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: La Fe 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy centers around sugar cane harvesting and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she views this new venture with Esperanza as an exciting opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing pants, blouses and underwear in the main market and then bringing them to her remote community to sell at a profit. She will use the profits to provide for the needs of her children, including school supplies and shoes. Her long term goal is to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses and pants to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior high.  Mary sells raw corn and onions at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman.  Mary uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more corn, onions and other food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to invest in her business and in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more corn, onions and other food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Iyabo Amira

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente de vêtements de qualité pour dames. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 et livre sa marchande à ses clients à domicile. La plupart de ses clientes apprécient la très bonne qualité des vêtements ; c’est pour cela qu’elle s’approvisionne non seulement à Lomé, mais aussi au Bénin et au Ghana, les deux pays voisins. C’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des bals de vêtements. Elle assure seule l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
This lady specialises in selling quality clothing for women. She began this activity in 2006 and home-delivers her merchandise. Most of her customers appreciate the excellent quality of the clothes, which is why she gets her supplies not only from Lomé, but also from Benin and Ghana, the two neighbouring countries. She is requesting a loan from WAGES so that she can place a new order for bales of clothes. She is sole support for her child’s education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El señor Walter J. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Alto tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
El señor Walter trabaja como taxista, y su esposa atiende una tienda de barrio y por las tardes tiene un kiosco donde vende hamburguesas y salchipapas, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de su vivienda ya que fue destrozada el techo con el viento, que con las lluvias esta humedeciendo la pared y puede sufrir un desplome.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Walter J. lives in his own house, which is in the Alto Tacagua area of La Paz, with his wife and two children. He is a taxi driver and his wife runs a neighborhood grocery store; during the afternoons she sells hamburgers and salchipapas (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces), which are the family's sources of income. He is requesting funding to repair his roof, which was destroyed by the wind, because rain is dampening the walls and he is afraid they might collapse. This is his second loan request and the evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his roof.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda N. is married and has four children. She has received no formal education. Linda sells onions at Ataabazi near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Linda uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Linda will use the loan to purchase more onions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Linda plans to save to invest back into her business to enable her to increase her stock of goods for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more onions for sale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Cristina pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y es socia nueva. Cristina tiene una hija llamada Daniela que tiene 17 años. Ellas viven en el departamento del Cusco,  provincia del Cusco. 
 
Cristina tiene una pequeña agencia de turismo “Avventure Danyskat” y también vende ropa para mujeres, varones y niños en especial ropa interior. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Cristina requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa de la ciudad de Lima como camisas, pijamas y también va comprar sandalias, zapatos y carteras. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Arariwa Association’s Comuzone Community Bank. She is 49 years old, a single mother, and a new member of the bank. She has a daughter called Daniela who is 17 years old. They live in the department of Cusco, in the province of Cusco. Cristina owns a small tourist agency called “Avventure Danyskat” and also sells clothing for men, women, and children, specialising in underwear. She’s been doing this for several years, and all has gone well thanks to the effort she puts in. Cristina requires a loan to buy more clothing from Lima such as shirts and pyjamas, and she is also going to buy sandals, shoes, and purses. She is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to pay the money back according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto Alarcón vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su padre. 
El señor Alberto trabaja como empleado de seguridad privada en la zona sur de la Ciudad de la Paz, con una antigüedad de tres años y los ingresos que recibe es para mantener a su papa el cual es mayor de edad.
El crédito solicitado es para los trámites de propiedad de una vivienda, la cual se encuentra en juicio y necesita ser saneada para no perderla.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Alberto Alarcón lives in his own house with his father in the Llojeta area, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He has worked for a private security firm in the south end of the city for three years. The income that he receives is used to support his elderly father. The loan he is asking for is to secure the property title on a house which is currently in the court system. The documents need to be checked so that he doesn’t lose the house. This is the second time that Alberto has requested a loan. The Bank’s socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for property title costs

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.es:
El señor Gedeon A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El señor Gedeon trabaja como empleado en un punto Internet de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el anticipo parta la compra de un terreno cercano a su vivienda y así poder tener su vivienda propia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Gedeon A. lives in his parents’ house in the area of Llojeta on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He works in an Internet cafe in the city, and he lives off the income he receives there. The loan he is asking will be used as the down payment on a plot of land near their home so that one day he can build his own house there. This is the first time that Gedeon has requested a loan. The Bank’s socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy land to build his own home on

loans.name: Watékou

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est un célibataire sans enfants qui effectue comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce de détail des produits de première nécessité. Il a démarré ses activités en 2008 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. En ce moment il souhaite associé à son commerce la vente de carte de recharge togocel il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 300 cartes  de recharge Togocel de 450 FCFA, 200 cartes de recharge de 1 000FCFA, 25 cartes de recharge de 2000 FCFA et 25 cartes de recharge de 4 500 FCFA.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a bachelor without children, who generates income through retail sales of basic necessities. He began this activity in 2008, in the Agoé area of Lomé. He can meet most of his needs through this business. At this time he would like to add the sale of Togocel telephone cards to his retail activities. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 300 Togocel phone cards at 450 FCFA, 200 cards at 1,000 FCFA, 25 cards at 2,000 FCFA, and 25 cards at 4,500 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone cards

loans.name: Las Intelectuales Y Responsables Group

texts.en:
Melida is the coordinator of her group Las Intelectuales y Responsables (the intellectual and responsible), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy centers around the backbreaking labor of the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 3 children.

Melida is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling chorizos, a delicious smoked mixture of pork that is then formed into sausages using pig intestines. Yum! She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing them shoes and clothes. Her long term goal is to continue growing her business and to see her children grow up to go to university and be successful. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy meat to make chorizos.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Cet homme n’est pas marié mais a à sa charge 02 enfants ; il arrive à subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi à ceux de ses enfants grâce aux commerces des produits électroniques à savoir les postes téléviseurs, les postes radio, les onduleurs, les hauts parleurs, les ventilteurs d’occasion. Il exerce son commerce depuis 2008 dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Il est connu de beaucoup de clients qui apprécient la qualité de ses produits. Actuellement il a besoin de procéder à de nouvelles acquisitions ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des articles électroniques manquants.
texts.en:
This person is unmarried, but has two children under his care. He manages to meet his own needs and those of his children through the sales of electronic products, that is : televisions, radios, UPS (Uninterrupted Power Supply) systems, loudspeakers, and second-hand cooling fans. His business started in 2008 in the Akodessewa part of Lomé. He is known by many customers who appreciate the quality of his goods. He currently needs to replenish his inventory; which is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy missing electronic equipment.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Perpétue

texts.fr: T. Perpétue est née en 1974 à Zangnanado au Bénin. Mariée à ADANOU Parfait, un menuisier, Perpétue est mère de quatre enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis cinq ans à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est surtout le mari de Perpétue qui assure les charges de la famille. Cependant, Perpétue utilise les revenus de son activité pour venir en aide à son mari. Perpétue a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 20 ans, Perpétue vend des produits vivriers et aussi des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, oignons, piments, gombo)  à son domicile. Perpétue vend également du poisson frit, de l’œuf et de l’huile, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Perpétue s’approvisionne à Pahou, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Perpétue a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Perpétue s’accroît au jour le jour; mais Perpétue n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Perpétue sollicite donc un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Perpétue T. was born in 1974 in Zangnanado in Benin. Married to Parfait Adanou, a finish carpenter, Perpétue is the mother of four children, two of which are in her care. All of her children are in school. For the past five years, she and her family have lived in Agla in Cotonou, which is the economic capital of Benin. Perpétue's husband is the one who usually takes care of the family's expenses. However, Perpétue uses the income from her business to help out her husband. Perpétue attended school up to secondary school. For approximately 20 years, Perpétue has sold food items as well as sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra) at her home. Perpétue also sells fried fish, eggs, and oil, which has provided her with additional sources of income. Perpétue buys her stock at Pahou, a market in Benin where food items are sold, and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Perpétue has already received one loan through Alidé, which she repaid in full. Perpétue's customer base is growing day by day, but she is unable to keep up with the demand because she does not have the financial means to do so. She is requesting a second loan so she can bolster her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn and rice, jugs of vegetable oil, and sauce ingredients

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Celinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella.
Celinda, se dedica a la venta D. menestras y lleva  varios años dedicándose al negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su ciudad. Nos cuenta que desD. muy joven, le gusta trabajar, por lo que poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, que hoy en día, son clientes fijos en su puesto. Nos cuenta que su negocio consiste en la venta D. especias como: Maní y maíz crudo, tostado y molido, harina D. plátano, para mazamorras, semillas D. shicashica (fruto selvático) rico en aceite natural, algunas verduras como: fréjoles secos, cacao con harina D. maíz.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará: sacos D. cacao, maíz y maní, para luego preparar mantequilla D. maní, maíz amarillo, para la preparación D. chichas, fréjoles en kilos, racimos D. plátanos verdes,  para preparar harina D. plátano.
Celinda, se siente muy orgullosa con el trabajo que realiza, el buen producto que venD. le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. Agradace al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of "The Jasmines" Communal Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, in the Department of San Martín. She is 62 and married, and she is the mother of 6 children, two of whom are dependents. Celinda has been in the business of selling vegetable stews for some years. She works in the central market of the city. She tells us that she has enjoyed working since she was young. Little by little, she has been saving and becoming well known among her clients. Today, her clients are completely loyal to her. Celinda specializes in the sale of specialties including: raw, roasted and ground peanuts and corn; plantain flour for puddings; seeds of the wild shicashica fruit, which is rich in natural oils; and certain vegetables like dried beans and cocoa with corn flour. With this loan of $350, she will buy sacks of cocoa, corn and peanuts for peanut butter; yellow corn for making the chicha beverage; kilos of beans; and bunches of green plantains for making plantain flour. Celinda is very proud of the work she does. The quality product she offers has afforded her a faithful clientele who buy every day, and she is well known in the market. She thanks Kiva field partner Manuela Ramos for the unconditional help they give to women like herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for making vegetable stews.

loans.name: Carmen Ita

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Ita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.
Carmen Ita, se dedica a la venta de panes y dulces,  lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Carmencita, como le dicen de cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Carmen Ita, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Ita is a member of the Jasmines Communal Bank in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of three dependent children.

Carmen Ita has been selling breads and sweets for several years at the Central Market in the district. Carmencita, as she is known by those who love her, gradually built up her savings and became more well-known among her customers. Today she has a fixed clientele who visit her vending location. Her business continues and she is very proud of the work she has done.

With her loan of 1500 soles, Carmen Ita will purchase ingredients and supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, and flavorings. Some of the money will also be used to purchase a new display case for exhibiting her products. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing unconditional support to her and other women like her who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, supplies, and a display case
